loans.name: Juan José

texts.es: Juan, a sus 25 años de edad, es padre soltero de un hijo de 6 años. Toda su vida ha vivido en el campo, donde aprendió todas las labores agropecuarias gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre. Actualmente se dedica a la cría de ganando para producción de leche y, el líquido que obtiene es vendido en el mercado, de esta manera genera los ingresos necesarios para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar. El cliente es un hombre juicioso, disciplinado y trabajador, a pesar de las adversidades, siempre busca opciones que le permitan progresar. Por esto se anima a solicitar el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos y fertilizantes), necesarios  para abonar los pastos donde se alimenta el ganado. De esta forma podrá ayudarse para que el ganado esté bien alimentado y pueda aumentar su producción de leche, así tendrá la oportunidad de incrementar sus ventas y recibir mejores ingresos con los cuales desea dar una excelente educación a su hijo y continuar sustentando las necesidades de su familia para que en un futuro cercano puedan disfrutar de mejores condiciones y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan, at 25 years of age, is the single father of a 6-year old son.  He has lived his whole life in the countryside, where he learned all the tasks related to agriculture and livestock, thanks to his father's teachings.  Now he makes his living raising cattle for milk production, and the milk that he gets is sold in the market.  In this way, he generates the necessary income to cover the basic needs of his home.

The client is a sensible, disciplined and hardworking man.  In spite of adversities, he always looks for options that allow him to get ahead.  This is why he is applying for a loan to invest in the purchase of agricultural inputs (compost and fertilizers) necessary to fertilize the grass where the cattle feed.  In this way, he will be able to help himself so that the cattle are well fed and can increase their milk production.  He will thus have the opportunity to increase his sales and receive better earnings.  With this, he would like to give his son an excellent education and to continue providing for his family so that in the near future they can enjoy better conditions and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs (compost and fertilizers) necessary to fertilize the grass where the cattle feed.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc is a 55-year-old widow. She lives with her two daughters in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Ngoc has been running a general store for nearly five years. She sells many kinds of food products, such as instant noodles and snacks, for people in the local community. She intends to take a loan to buy a greater quantity of food products to meet her customers' demand and also to make some repairs to her house. 

She hopes that through the loan she can earn more money with her current business and save additional amounts for reinvestment.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of food products to stock her store and also to repair her house

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is a 36-year-old, married woman. She lives with her two sons, near Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. Her husband works in a factory in Turkey and sends her money. Her sons go to a local school. 

Irine works in Tbilisi as a hospital administrator and she gets 300 Gel per month. She also goes to Turkey and purchases bed linens to sell. Irine has been involved in this business for a year. She has orders from her co-workers and neighbors and does not have enough money to purchase the items. 

The start-up program created by Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of USD 600 to purchase stock in Turkey.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of bed linens to sell.

loans.name: Renaissance Group

texts.fr:
Mme LEONIE est la responsable du groupe RENAISSANCE. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 18ans et le moins âgé a 08ans. Les 03 vont à l’école.
Mme vend des céréales depuis 11ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Mme veut s’acheter 05 sacs de mil, 03sacs d’haricot et 04sacs de maïs.
Elle veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité.  Mme ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madam Leonie is the person in charge of the group Renaissance. She is doing well. Married, she is mother to 3 children. The oldest is 18 years old and the youngest is 8 years old. All 3 go to school.

Madam has been selling cereals for 11 years. She gets her supplies in the surrounding villages. Her customers are men and women.

Madam wants to buy herself 5 bags of mil [African cereal], 3 bags of beans and 4 bags of corn.

She wants to reinvest her profits in her business. Madam's ambition is to expand her business and to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy herself 5 bags of mil [African cereal], 3 bags of beans and 4 bags of corn.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
This is Musu, who is 48 years old and from Liberia.  Precisely, she lives in Logan Town of Montserrado County, well known as an early community in Liberia. She is married, and her husband is a driver.  They have three children between the ages of 8 and 16. All three are in school and living at home. Musu stopped her education at the seventh grade. 

For the past 30 years, she has been involved with business, and now she sells charcoal. She started in business by selling at a market table.  Later she received money from her husband to change her business to the charcoal business, and she learned this way of selling from her friends. She boasts of the profit she makes every day, and most interestingly, she meets new people every day. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business.  Her plan is to educate all her children. She appreciates BRAC Liberia and the lenders who supports small-business people.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie lives in Logan Town, she is 49 years old, and she attended school through the third grade. Since 2001 she has been running a table business in her community which sells plantains, oranges, sweet potatoes, eddoes, etc. She sells from Monday to Saturday, spending ten hours each day. She started this business with a little money that her husband earned.  She is married and has five children between the ages of 19 and 22 who live at home and attend school. She hopes to own a house for her children. Marie is requesting a loan to buy more plantains, oranges, sweet potatoes, eddoes, etc. for her business.   She thanks BRAC Liberia for their support.

loans.use: to buy more plantains, oranges, sweet potatoes, eddoe, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 42 years old and lives in Long Town with her husband and their 21-year-old child, who is in school.

Julie has been running a table where she sells rubber dishes (bowls, plates, spoons, etc.) to make ends meet.  She says with her business, she is able to send her child to school. She says she started this business by helping her mother in the local market. 

Julie is requesting a loan to buy more rubber dishware for her business. Her plans are to expand her business even more and in the future to see her child out of high school and attending college.

loans.use: to buy more rubber dishware for her business.

loans.name: Viim Kom Group

texts.fr:
Mme TATIANA est la responsable du groupe VIIM KOM. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 17ans. Les  02 vont à l’école. Elle a 04personnes en charge.
Mme vend des habits  depuis 12ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10. Ses clients sont  les femmes, les hommes.
Mme veut s’acheter 04douzaines d’habits.
Elle veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité.  Mme ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madam Tatiana is the person in charge of the group VIIM Kom. Married, she is mother to 2 children. The oldest is 20 years old and the youngest is 17 years old. Both go to school. She has 4 people under her care.

Madam has been selling clothing for 12 years. She gets her supplies at the market in sector 10. Her customers are women and men.

Madam wants to buy herself 4 dozen outfits.

She wants to reinvest her profits in her business. Madam's ambition is to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy herself 4 dozen outfits to resell.

loans.name: Yamb Yel Benewende Group

texts.fr:
Mme  TENE  est responsable du groupe  YAMB YEL BENEWENDE. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 22 ans et le moins âgés à 09 ans. Les 03 vont  à l’école et elle a 04 personnes  en charge.
Mme fait restauration  depuis 10ans.  Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. Ses clients sont les  femmes, hommes et enfants.
Elle veut s’acheter  02sacs d’haricot ,01sac de riz et 01sac de condiment.
Elle veut  épargner  ses bénéfices. Mme  ambitionne s’acheter  un motocycle, mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madam Tene is the person in charge of the group Yamb Yel Benewende. Married, she is mother to 4 children. The oldest is 22 years old and the youngest is 9 years old. All 4 go to school and she has 4 people under her care.

Madam has been in catering for 10 years. She gets her supplies at the market in her sector. Her customers are women, men and children.

She wants to buy herself 2 bags of beans, 1 bag of rice and 1 bag of condiments.

She wants to save her profits. Madam's ambition is to buy herself a motorcycle and to better take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy herself 2 bags of beans, 1 bag of rice and 1 bag of condiments.

loans.name: Engelbert

texts.fr: Engelbert est un homme de 27 ans, père de famille de 4 enfants dont l'age varie varie entre 2 et 11 ans, 3 d'entre eux vonrt à l'école. il commerçant dans un marché de la capitale depuis 3 ans où il vend les poulets. son activté fonctionne bien, il a conquis et fidelisée une clientèle qui augmente au fil du temps. Alors il sollicte ce crédit augmenter son stock de poulet de chairs parce que la petisse de son capital l'oblige à chaque fois à faire écouler son stock avant de réapprovuisioner d'où la rupture constante de son stock. ceci lui permettraz d'augmenter non seulement ses ventes mais aussi sa marge bénéficiaire. benéfice qui sera réinvesti en partie dans son activité pour l'aggrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Engelbert is a 27 year old man and father to 4 children whose ages range from 2 to 11 years old. Three of them go to school. He has been a shopkeeper in a market of the capital for 3 years, where he sells chickens. His business is doing well. He has acquired a loyal clientele which is increasing with time. Thus he is requesting this loan to increase his stock of chickens for meat because his small capital requires him to sell out his stock each time before restocking due to constant stock shortages. This will allow him to increase not only his sales but also his profit margin. His profits will be partly reinvested in his business to expand it and the rest will allow him to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to increase his stock of chickens for meat.

loans.name: Román Edilberto

texts.es:
Román de 45 años de edad,  esta casado y tiene 6 hijos de 19, 17,15, 14, 12 y 13 años de edad y todos asisten a la escuela. Debido a la situación económica de aquel tiempo, ya que tenia 12 hermanos, Román solo estudio hasta cuarto grado; después se dedico a trabajar con su padre.

Román es agricultor desde los 15 años, comenzó trabajando con bueyes, carretas y arados, hasta la fecha cultiva 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, a las que le dedica gran parte de su tiempo, viaja dos kilómetros en bicicleta todos los días para llegar al lugar donde esta sembrando, trabaja de 6:30 am  a 12:30 pm. Y cuando sus hijos no asisten a la escuela le apoyan en el trabajo.

Román tiene sembrada 10,500 metrod cuadrados de maíz y con el préstamo comprara fertilizante y pesticidas para obtener la mejor cosecha posible.

El sueño de Román es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios, reparar la casa donde viven que se daño desde el terremoto de 2001 y también quiere comprar un par de bueyes para trabajar la tierra.
texts.en:
Román is 45 years old. He is married and has six children, who are ages nineteen, seventeen, fifteen, fourteen, twelve, and thirteen. They are all in school. Because of the financial situation at the time, since he had twelve siblings, Román only went to school until the fourth grade. After that he went to work with his father. 

Román has been a farmer since he was fifteen. He started out working with oxen, carts, and plows. So far he farms 3.5 acres of corn, and dedicates a lot of his time to the land. He travels two kilometers by bicycle every day to get to the place where he farms. He works from 6:30 am to 12:30 pm. And when his children aren't in school they help him at work. 

Román has planted 2.6 acres of corn and will use the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides in order to obtain the best possible harvest. 

Román's dream is for his children to finish school, to repair the house where they live, which suffred damages in the 2001 earthquake, and also to purchase a pair of oxen to work the land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru:
Мархабо проживает в городе Душанбе. Ей 48 лет. Мархабо живет с мужем. У них большая семья. Их восемь человек в семье. Мархабо повар. Она на протяжении пяти лет работает поваром в своей столовой. Мархабо открыла семейный бизнес. Этот бизнес приносит доход, так как у Мархабо много постоянных клиентов, ведь она готовит вкусный плов. 
Мархабо выдает замуж свою любимую дочь. Она просит кредит для организации свадебных мероприятий, а также приобретения необходимых продуктов для приготовления других видов блюд, чтобы составить определенное меню. Он заранее благодарит всех и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Marhabo lives in Dushanbe. She is 48 years old. Marhabo lives with her husband. They have a big family. There are eight people in the family. Marhabo is a cook. She has been working as a cook in their cafe for five years. Marhabo opened the family business. This business generates income. Marhabo has many loyal customers since she prepares a delicious pilaf. 

Marhabo is marrying off her beloved daughter. She is asking for a loan to pay for the wedding, as well as buying products to prepare dishes for the wedding meal. She thanks everyone in advance and is anticipating your kindness.

loans.use: organize her daughter's wedding.

loans.name: Qurbonbubi

texts.ru:
Курбонбуби 14 лет занимается торговлей фруктов на рынке района Шахритус. Ей 49 лет. Когда она только открыла свою прилавку ей дружно помогали родственники и продавцы рынка. Жители Шахритуса добрые и приветливые люди. И на рынках все продавцы относятся с уважением и добротой к друг другу. На рынке Шохмансур можно найти большой ассортимент различных фруктов и овощей. Шахритус самых солнечный район Таджикистана, там более жарко чем в других районах. Курбонбуби продает овощи, фрукты и ягоды. Такие как: персики, абрикосы, яблоки, груши, перец, болгарский перец, зелень и петрушка. 
Курбонбуби берет кредит для покупки новых видов фрукт в оптом. Она надеется пополнить свою прилавку новым и свежим товаром.
texts.en:
Qurbonbubi has been trading fruit in the Shahrituz market for fourteen years. She is 49 years old. When she opened her shop, her family and other sellers at the market helped her. The citizens of Shahrituz are a kind and friendly people. And at the market, all the sellers treat one another with respect and kindness. In the Shohmansur market, one can find a wide variety of different fruits and vegetables. Shahrituz is the most sunny region of ​​Tajikistan. It's hotter there than in other areas. Qurbonbubi sells vegetables, fruit, and berries. This includes peaches, apricots, apples, pears, peppers, bell peppers, herbs and parsley. 

Qurbonbubi is taking out a loan to buy new types of fruit in bulk. She hopes to add another section to her shop with new and fresh goods.

loans.use: purchase new kinds of fruit and sell them at the market

loans.name: Guljamol

texts.ru: Гулджамол с детства работала на земле, трудилась вместе с родителями на грядке. И даже после замужества помогала мужу с работой на земельном участке. Гулджамол имеет богатый опыт в области растениеводства. Она берет кредит, чтобы посадить осеннею пшеницу и чтоб в следующем году получить богатый урожай. Гулджамол усердно готовиться к осеннему посеву. На полученный кредит она намерена купить семена пшеницы и горючее, чтобы начать работу.
texts.en: Guljamol has worked the earth since childhood.  She worked the plot of land with her parents. And even after her marriage, she helped her husband on their land. Guljamol has a wealth of experience in farming. She is taking out a loan to plant wheat in the autumn so that next year she will get a rich harvest. Guljamol is diligently preparing for the autumn sowing. She intends to use the loan to buy wheat seeds and fuel to start work.

loans.use: buy wheat seed and fuel.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be God fearing . She operates a beauty salon where she offers salon services. She describes her family challenge to be lack of enough water storage facilities. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will have a proper and stable family with an adequate financial status. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 42 year-old Hawa. She is married and has 4 children, age 20, 17, 7 and 5. She has 2 additional dependents who live with her, one for school and the other to assist her in her business. In 2010, Hawa established her plastic pans and dishes business. She began her business just to provide assistance to her husband. Her business is located at the city center and her main customers are both men and women. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 500,000 every month from this business. 

Hawa would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. She requires a loan in order to buy pan dishes for 2,000,000 and rubber dishes for 1,000,000. She hopes that this loan will increase her stock levels. In the future, Hawa plans to educate her kids, to send her kids abroad and to build a house. She is saying thanks to Kiva, and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more pans and dishes for her shop.

loans.name: Foday

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Foday. He is married and has 3 children, ages 18, 15, and 10. He has 2 additional dependents who live with him for schooling.  In 2001, Foday established his Patient Drug business. He began his business just to provide adequate support to his children and wife. His business is located at the city center and his main customers are all classes of business people. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about Le 500,000 every month from this business. 

Foday would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. He has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy Panado (tabs) 500,000, Amoxillin (cap) 500,000 and Amplicillin (cap) 500,000. He hopes that this loan will increase his stock levels. In the future, Foday plans to educate his children and to create a business for his wife. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drugs for his pharmacy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bedsheets for his stall.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Hawa. She is married and has 3 children, ages 22, 18 and 15. In 1997, Hawa established her clothing and textile business. She began her business just to provide assistance to her husband in the running of the home. Her business is located at the city center and her customers are mostly women. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 450,000 every month from this business. 

Hawa would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy dry cotton for Le 500,000 and wax cotton for Le 2,500,000. She hopes that this loan will increase her stock levels and hence her income. In the future, Hawa plans to develop her table into a shop and to educate her kids. She appreciates the gesture she is receiving from Kiva. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase textiles and plastic shoes to sell.

loans.name: Shamsidin

texts.ru: Шасмидину 53 года, он уроженец Шахритуса. Шамсидин в течение 10 лет занимается растениеводством. Раньше он просто сажал овощи на грядке. Но теперь он серьезно хочет заняться бизнесом и готовится к новому посеву. Шамсидин хочет на деньги от кредита купить семена пшеницы и начать готовиться к осеннему посеву. Раньше ему помогал сын, но сейчас он работает заграницей и теперь Шамсидину помогает его жена. Жена Шамсидина знает, как ему нравится работать на земле и всячески помогает мужу. Шамсиддин надеется получить к весне богатый урожай и остаться довольным своим трудом. Мы желаем, чтоб его мечты осуществились.
texts.en: Shasmidin is 53 years old and a native of Shahrituz. Shamsidin has been farming for ten years. Before that, he was just growing vegetables in his garden. Now he is serious about wanting to do business and is preparing for a new planting. Shamsidin wants to borrow money to buy wheat seed and start preparing for the autumn sowing. Previously, his son helped him, but now his son is working abroad.  Shamsidin's wife is now helping him. Shamsidin's wife knows how he likes to work the earth, and she helps her husband in every way. Shamsidin hopes to reap a rich harvest in the spring and gain satisfaction with his work. We wish to make his dream come true.

loans.use: buy wheat seeds.

loans.name: Sunguchini Group

texts.en:
Richard is in his early 30s and single. For three years now, Richard has run a restaurant business. Richard and his few helpers are doing great in his business. His workday starts at 12 noon and continues to 11 p.m. daily and he is able to earn a fair profit. 

This is Richard's third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loans to buy plates, glasses, chairs, a gas cooker and freezer for his restaurant. He managed to repay all his previous loans successfully. He used the profit to pay for school fees, bought food for his family and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to open another restaurant in another place. Richard dreams of opening a big hotel.
He will share this loan with his loan group "Sunguchini," which totals seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open another restaurant in another place.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and help with the labor

loans.name: Aminata J.

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Aminata J.  She is married and has 4 children, ages 21, 19, 15 and 5 years. All are school-going children. She has 2 additional dependents who live with her as foster children, and they assist her in the business. In 2006, Aminata J established her building materials - cement, paint, floor mats, nails, shovels, zinc, electric cable, etc. business. She began her business because her father forced her into early marriage which caused her to drop out of school. Her husband gave her money to start her business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,250,000 every month from this business. 

Aminata J. would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. She requires a loan in order to buy shovels, cement and rice. In the future, Aminata J. plans to expand the business, continue to educate her children and buy another piece of land. This loan will help to generate more income. The high cost of transportation is her major challenge. She is a hardworking businesswoman. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy shovels, cement and rice.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a kiosk business, selling food to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. Sarah dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Mayrash

texts.ru: Майраш 64 года, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает троих детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Майраш - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Майраш занимается животноводством, стартовав 33 года назад, с покупки скота на 100 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Майраш, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 6 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Майраш обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Майраш планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Mayrash is a 64 year old widow who, after her husband's death, has been raising her three children and maintaining the farm on her own. Mayrash received secondary education and her family's main source of income is animal husbandry. 

Mayrash started raising animals 33 years ago with the purchase of 100 KGS worth of livestock. Thanks to her hard work, Mayrash now has three milk cows and six sheep, and her monthly income is 12,000 KGS. Wishing to further expand her business, Mayrash applied for a loan of 135,000 KGS from Bai Tushum and Partners in order to buy calves. Mayrash plans to reinvest any profit she receives into further growing her flock.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil lives in eastern Georgia, near the capital city of Georgia, with his wife, Dali. Dali teaches math at a local public school and gets 250 Gel per month. Avtandil is a part-time carpenter and makes different types of furniture. There is not much demand for furniture in the region, so he decided to be involved in the additional business of growing tomatoes. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, was made for people such as Avtandil. He has a chance to get a loan of 1,000 Gel and build a greenhouse in his yard. He will purchase tomato seeds and polyethylene to cover the greenhouse. Avtandil will harvest the tomatoes 2-3 times in a year and sell to local restaurants and supermarkets. He is very motivated to be involved in this business and hopes that it will be successful.

loans.use: to purchase tomato seeds and polyethylene for the greenhouse.

loans.name: Mkambe

texts.en:
Mkambe is a widowed woman with six children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past three years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. Mkambe dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en: Luvuno is a married woman with two children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She has operated a charcoal selling business for the past four years. Her potential clients are neighbors and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Ishenkul

texts.ru: Ишенкуль 50 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 6 детей. У Ишенкуль - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Ишенкуль занимается животноводством, стартовав 2 года назад, с покупки скота на 8,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Ишенкуль, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 телки. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Ишенкуль обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Ишенкуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на проведение свадебного торжества сыну.
texts.en: Ishenkul is 50 years old, married, and raising six children with her husband. Ishenkul has a secondary education. The family's primary source of income is animal husbandry. Ishenkul started this two 2 years ago when she bought cattle with 8,000 KGS. Thanks to Ishenkul's hard work, she now has three heifers on her farm. She earns a monthly income of 5,000 KGS. In order to further develop her farm, Ishenkul has asked the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 130,000 KGS to buy calves for cattle breeding. Ishenkul plans to use income from loan to increase her number of domestic animals, and is planning on saving money to celebrate her son's wedding.

loans.use: buy calves

loans.name: Meme

texts.en: Meet Meme a businesswoman from Logan Town, one of the early communities in Liberia that is well-known. She is 34 years old, married and has three children between 11 and 16 years old. Meme completed her education at the 6th grade level. For the past 16 years, she has been involved in business. She is selling frozen chickens in the local market, spending nine hours each day from Monday to Saturday.  She started her business with money from her fiancee in order to help in the home. She learned ways of selling from his friends.  She enjoys the flow of her customers. She is requesting a loan to buy more chicken for her business. Her plan is to build a house. She thanks BRAC Liberia for lending her money.

loans.use: to buy more frozen chickens for her business.

loans.name: Watta

texts.en:
Watta is 27 years old and lives in Logan Town, one of the early communities in Liberia that is well-known. She is unmarried and has a 2-year-old child who is presently in school and lives at home. Watta did not attend school.

For the past six years she has been running a shop where she sells charcoal. She started this business with a small amount she saved. She learned this way of selling from her friends. She likes her business because she makes lots of profit and it keeps her busy. She is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Sababougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Mme AZILA JUDITH représente le groupe SABABOUGNOUMA. Elle se porte bien. Mariée,elle est mère d’un enfant. Il est âgé de 03 ans. L’enfant ne va à l’école et elle a 03 personnes en charge.

Mme vend du combustible depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne par livraison à domicile. Ses clients sont les femmes du quartier.

Elle veut s’acheter 02 rangée de bois.

Elle veut épargner ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité et améliorer sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Madam Azila Judith represents the group Sababougnouma. She is doing well. Married, she is mother to one child. He is 3 years old. The child doesn't go to school and she has 3 people under her care.

Madam has been selling fuel for 10 years. She gets her supplies delivered to her home. Her customers are the women in the neighborhood.

She wants to buy herself 2 rows of wood.

She wants to save her profits. Madam's ambition is to expand her business and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy herself 2 rows of wood.

loans.name: Doris's Group

texts.en:
This group is composed of three women who are on their fourth loan. The members would like to develop their revenue-generating businesses and thus improve their living conditions and facilitate their access to consumer products. The main work of these women involves selling of wax-print fabrics, cosmetics and underwear. 

Doris (standing right in the photograph) is the group's representative. She is 30 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She is active in selling underwear that she purchases at the communal market to sell to her customers.

With this new loan, she intends to purchase more underwear to sell to customers. 

The profits from her work will enable her to increase her savings and to help her husband meet the needs of the family. They need a total amount of GHS 1500 to be able to satisfy their customers.

loans.use: To purchase more underwear to sell to customers.

loans.name: Alexis

texts.en:
Alexis has always had the entrepreneurial spirit. He is happy, outgoing, and has an infectious smile. So when Alexis found himself unemployed last year he decided to start a business for himself. Why depend on more short term work when he could follow his dream of running a small business, and create employment for others while doing it?

The primary means of transportation for most Rwandese is the matatu, a mini-bus taxi that is often overcrowded and overloaded with cargo. Most of these buses are very old, and with a lack of proper maintenance and second-hand parts, they are very dangerous on Rwanda's curvy, hilly roads.  Alexis saw that the cost of repairs deters owners from properly maintaining their matatus, and set his sights on finding a way to make the repairs more affordable and, in turn, the buses safer.
Earlier this year, Alexis started an auto shop to provide repairs and spare parts to the bus companies. In addition, he has partnered with a local vocational school to hire graduates from its auto repair program. With Alexis these students will receive a full time job—rather than a low-paid apprenticeship—and will provide Alexis with highly skilled technicians.

Right now, Alexis's business is small, but he has finally secured a deal with his first large-scale client to provide spare parts for their entire fleet of buses. This $10,000 loan will give him the working capital to service this client and hire two auto repair students from the next graduating class, giving Alexis the capacity and credibility he needs to bring in other big clients and grown his business in the future.

loans.use: To hire two employees and secure a new large-scale client.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his stock of staple goods.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 61 years old and works selling smoked fish. This loan will be her sixth with Kiva's partner, ID-Ghana. Gladys is going to use the loan amount of GHS 1,000 to purchase  two cartons of fish and a bundle of firewood. Her reason for requesting a loan is to improve her business. 

She is going to use the loan in order to continue buying fish in order to continue improving her business and in that way to continue generating more income with the goal of improving her quality of life. 

Gladys feels happy, as demonstrated in the photograph, and thankful for the opportunity that has been offered since this is the only work that allows her to support herself.

loans.use: To purchase two cartons of fish and a bundle of firewood.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a single mother of two children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister and brother). She has a business of food-vending and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of banana fingers, Irish potatoes, sweet potatoes, onions, tomatoes, and cassava. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and defaulters. She is aspiring to own a delivery to ease in transportation and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and no piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more  bags of banana fingers, Irish potatoes, sweet potatoes, onions, tomatoes, and cassava.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Fatu. She is married and has 3 children, ages 25, 22 and 20. She has 2 additional dependents who live with her and give her sales assistance. In 1980, Fatu established her textile business. She began her business because she was not educated and wanted to help herself. Working 7 days a week and 18 hours a day, she earns about Le500,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le5,000,000. Fatu requires a loan in order to purchase more bales of cotton fabric for resale. In the future, Fatu plans to build a house on her land. She is very hardworking. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of cotton fabric for resale.

loans.name: Absatou

texts.fr: Madame ABSATOU est une femme âgée de 26 ans qui habite à coté du Guichet. Elle évolue dans le commerce de tissus et a une expérience de plus de 3ans dans ce domaine. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. ABSATOU aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais scolaires de ses enfants. Elle quitte sa maison à 8h du matin pour y revenir le soir à 19h. Elle sollicite ce prêt d'un montant de 100 000 F pour renforcer son fond de commerce augmenter son  stock de marchandises et satisfaire sa clientèle. A l'avenir ABSATOU souhaite ouvrir un grand magasin pour augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Absatou is a 26-year-old woman who lives next to the Guichet [loan distribution counter]. She is involved in fabric trade, and has more than 3 years of experience in the domain. She is married and has children. Absatou helps her husband manage their daily expenses and their children’s tuition. She leaves the house at 8 a.m. and returns home at 7 p.m. 

She is seeking this loan of 100,000 CFA Francs in order to strengthen her business, expand her stock of merchandise and satisfy her customers. In the future, Absatou hopes to open a large store to increase her income and provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy and sell fabric at the market.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Mary. She is married and has 2 children, ages 8 and 12. In 2000, Mary established her palm oil and soft drinks business. She began her business when she realized her husband’s salary is very small. She decided to join in business to help in taking care of the home. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about Le250,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le4,000,000. Mary requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and drinks of different kinds for resale. In the future, Mary plans to build a house and to educate her children. She is very hardworking. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and drinks of different kinds for resale.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a  Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be God-fearing. He operates a bicycle transport service where he transports customers using his bicycle. He describes his family challenge to be lack of enough water. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store enough clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future he will be financially stable. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is married with three children and all of her children go to school.  She has a restaurant business and has been in this business for 15 years.  She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of Irish potatoes, cooking oil, beef, chicken and sausages.  She works in the restaurant seven days a week and sells on a retail basis.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.   She aspires to own a fully stocked restaurant and to build her own house.  She resides in a rented house where the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bags of irish potatoes,cooking oil,beef,chicken and sausages

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a single mother of four children and two of her children go to school. She also take care of additional family members (old parents). She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for 20 years. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income through selling used clothes. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to own a delivery van for the ease of transportation. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Lamarana

texts.en:
This is Lamarana, who is 49 years old.  She is married, and she has two children, aged 25 and 20 years.  

In 2007, Lamarana established her provisions business. She began her business because she inherited it from her late mother. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 600,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000 . Lamarana requires a loan in order to purchase more provisions, e.g., milk and suger, for resale. 

In the future, Lamarana plans to build a bakery for her business . She is very hard-working She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions, e.g., milk, suger, for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more frozen fish for resale.

loans.name: Florecitas Barraqueñas Group

texts.es:
La señora Blandina Floridalma de estado civil casada. De edad 35 años. No tuvo la opoetunidad de estudiar. Tiene 3 hijos y de ellos 1 está estudiando. Se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno. Inició este negocio con sus padres y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de 2 toritos para criarlos y luego venderlos en las carnicerias de la comunidad. En el futuro espera contar con más capital de trabajo para poder criar mas ganado y asi obtener mejores ganancias.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a comercializar frutas y verduras las cuales distribuyen en la localidad.
texts.en:
Blandina Floridalma, 35, is married and has three children, one of whom is in school.  She didn't have the opportunity to attend school.

Blandina Floridalma makes a living raising cattle.  She started this business with her parents and currently has five years of experience.  She has the support of her husband, who works in agriculture.

She's organizing a group and requesting a loan to buy two young bulls to raise and then sell in the butcher shops in the community.  She hopes to have more working capital in the future so she can raise more cattle and earn more profits.

The other members of the group earn a living selling fruits and vegetables in the town.

loans.use: to buy two young bulls

loans.name: Alimamy

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Alimamy.  He is married and has 3 children, ages 11, 6 and 4 years. Two of them are school-going children. In 2006, Alimamy established his used shoes business. He began his business because the loss of his father caused him not to further his education.  He went to a gold mining area and mined for some years. The money he got was used to start this business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Alimamy requires a loan in order to buy bales of assorted used shoes. In the future, he plans to develop his piece of land, provide quality education for his children and expand his business. The loan will help to improve the business. His main problems are inadequate capital and that sometimes some bales of shoes are not of good quality. He thanks you for providing additional capital for his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bales of assorted used shoes.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a 52-year-old married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be creative and trustworthy. She operates a green grocery where she sells groceries. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a highly populated area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low supply. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water tank and stock her business. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and stock her business.

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en:
This is 55-year-old Yeabu. She is married and has 3 children, ages 17, 15 and 12. All are school-going children. In 2007, Yeabu established her dried fish business. She began her business because her parents were traders and they could not afford to send their children to school. Her father believes trading and marriage is best for a girl child, and that paying school fees is a waste of time and resources.  

Yeabu helped her mother to trade from one place to another till she got married to a businessman, which makes it easy for her to have a good experience in business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 611,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Yeabu requires a loan in order to purchase baskets of dried fish. In the future, Yeabu plans to expand her business and give her children a good education. Shortage of goods and the rainy season are her major challenges. Acquiring this loan will help in developing her business and change her family's status. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase baskets of dried fish.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
30 year-old Ahmed is married and has one child aged nine months. 

In 2013, Ahmed established his Pharmacy business. He started his business because he wanted to help his family and improve his livelihood. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, he earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from his business. 

Ahed is requesting a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. He requires a loan in order to buy more medicine for resale. In the future, he plans to build a house for dwelling a shop and to educate his child. Ahmed is very hard working and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy medicine for resale

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Fanta.  She is married and has one child aged 7 years. 

In 2013, Fanta established her business selling rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc. She began her business because she wants to improve her livelihood. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le5,000,000. Fanta requires a loan in order to buy more rice, cooking oil, sugar, etc. in a very large quantities for resale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits. 

In the future, Fanta plans to become an international business woman. She is very hardworking and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, sugar, etc. in a very large quantities for resale.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is 23-year-old Mariatu. She is a divorcee and has no children. 

In 2011, Mariatu established her Building Materials & Electrical Appliances business. She began her business because she wanted to improve her livelihood. 

Her business is located on the outskirts of town and her main customers are contractors and men. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Mariatu requires a loan to buy building materials like cement, iron rods, nails and paints for resale. 

In the future, Mariatu plans to build a house and establish another business outlet in the city. She is currently unable to open another business but if she experiences more profit from her business it will help her to open another outlet. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials like cement, iron rods, nails and paints

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more sacks of cassava, potatoes and palm oil

loans.name: Shelia

texts.en: This is Shelia from Liberia. She is 27 years old and has a one-year-old child. They live in the Logan Town area, one of the early communities in Liberia that is well-known. Shelia is married to a man who works at a goldsmith shop. Shelia finished 12th grade before starting this business five years ago. She is presently selling charcoal. She started her business with money from her husband and learned the business from her friends. She likes her business because she realizes some profit. She is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. Her plans are to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a businesswoman who is very hardworking. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Kwekwe has operated a charcoal selling business for the past four years. Her potential clients are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is widowed with six children who attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a water distribution business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish a wholesale business in the near future. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase a water pipe to distribute water. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a water pipe to distribute water.

loans.name: Vastina

texts.en: Vastina is a 51-year-old widow with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in farming for four years but also sells local brew in order to earn a living. Like most farmers, she is challenged by price fluctuation and the prolonged dry season, while her dream is to venture into modern farming methods. Vastina intends to use the loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school and are still under her care. They live at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Christine operates a clothes-selling business at the local market, selling clothes to her town dwellers and her neighbours. She cites her major challenge to be the rate of stock turnover, which is affected by seasons. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase one bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: José Ignacio

texts.es:
José de 19 años de edad, esta casado no tiene hijos y solamente estudio hasta 6º grado, dado que sus padres, pasaban por una situación económica muy mala, así que no tuvo la oportunidad de seguir estudiando. 

Tiene 6 años de experiencia como sastre, oficio que aprendió después de dejar de estudiar, asistiendo como aprendiz a una sastrería local, gracias a ello tiene la posibilidad de ayudar a sus padres económicamente. Para llegar al lugar de trabajo camina todos los días aproximadamente un kilómetro y trabaja de  7 de la mañana a 5 de la tarde

El préstamo será utilizado en la compra de maquinas de coser, para instalar un negocio propio, necesita seguir trabajando pero de forma independiente.
texts.en:
José, 19, is married and has no children.   He only studied up to sixth grade.  His parents were having bad financial problems, so he wasn't able to continue attending school.

José has six years of experience as a tailor, which he learned when he left school.  Thanks to his apprenticeship to a local tailor, he's able to help his parents economically.  He walks about a kilometer to work every day and works from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m.

José will use the loan to buy sewing machines to set up his own business.  He needs to continue working, but on his own.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 46 years old and lives in Logan Town, one of the early communities in Liberia that is well-known. She is unmarried and has four children between the ages of 14 and 31. Only three are presently in school and live at home. For the past 20 years Janet has been running a table where she sells soft drinks from a cooler. She started this business with a little money which she saved over the year and learned this way of selling from her friends. She likes her business because she makes a lot of profit and it keeps her busy. She is requesting a loan to buy more soft drinks for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Muzafar

texts.ru: Музафар мужчина в возрасте  40 лет, женат имеет 3 детей. У него есть  магазин который он построил у своего дома. 12 лет назад ему пришла идея посторить свой собственный подуктовый магазин. Теперь его жена постоянно сидит в этом магазине и помогает мужу в развитии бизнеса. Музафар сам ездит за товаром на городской рынок и привозит с рынка необходимый товар. В его магазине есть напитки, мороженное, и другие продукты. Но уже начитнает холодать и Музафар решил обновить свой товар  и помещение.  Он планиует в эту зиму  сделать помещение более теплым. Накопленные средства недостаточны для реализации его планов. Поэтому он обращяется за кредитом в Арванд.
texts.en: Muzafar is a forty year old man. He is married and has three children. He has a shop he built in his home. Twelve years ago he got the idea to build a grocery store at home.  Now, his wife always minds the store and helps her husband develop the business. Muzafar goes to the city to buy products from the city market. His shop stocks drinks, ice cream, and other products. But it is getting colder and Muzafar has decided to upgrade his products and shop. He plans to make the shop warmer in the winter. He doesn't have enough savings to do this. so he approached the company Arvand for a loan.

loans.use: buy goods for resale.

loans.name: Rosalie Irma

texts.fr: Rosalie  est une femme de 37 ans mariée mère de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 8 et 12 ans, tous ses enfants vont encore à l'école. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais( tomate, carottes et choux... ) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 3 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaiterai augmenter le stock de cajots de tomates et sacs de carottes ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Rosalie is a 37-year-old married mother of three children aged between 8 and 12 years old, all of whom attend school. She is a trader who sells fresh seasonal produce (tomatoes, carrots and cabbages). She has been working in the marketplace for three years old. She has a solid understanding of her suppliers, as well as the customers she has served over time thanks to her experience in this area. But she constantly finds herself running out of produce. Because of her extremely limited resources, she is forced to sell off all her stock at a lower price in order to be able to buy new produce. She hopes to increase her stock of tomato crates and sacks of carrots, which will allow her to better satisfy her customers' constant demand and avoid inventory shortages. She will save her profits not just to grow her business, but also to provide for her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of tomato crates and sacks of carrots

loans.name: Benedicte Jeanne

texts.fr: Jeanne est une femme de 55 ans mariée mère de 4 enfants dont l'age entre  17  et  32 ans , elle a aussi 2 autres personne à sa charge. Jeanne est commerçante dans un marché de la capitale depuis 4 ans déjà. son activité c'est la vente des vivres frais(macabo, manioc,couscous) depuis 5 ans . Elle sollicite un nouveau crédit parce qu'elle aimerait acheter en grande quantité les régimes de plantains, sacs de macabo et de manioc dans les brousses pour venir revendre dans plusieurs points de vente. Mais la petitesse de son capital ne lui permet pas de le faire, d'où la nécessité de ce crédit pour renforcer son activité.Ceci augmentera son capital, ses ventes et donc son bénéfice.Elle économisera ce bénéfice pour s'acheter dans le futur une moto carrosserie qui lui permettra de faire les livraisons à domicile.
texts.en: Jeanne is a 55-year-old married mother of four children between the ages of 17 and 32. She also has two other people under her care. Jeanne has been a trader in one of the capital city's markets for four years. She has been selling fresh produce (macabo, cassava, couscous) for five years. She is looking to take out a new loan because she would like to buy bunches of plantains and sacks of cassava and cocoyam in bulk in order to re-sell them across several stalls. But her limited capital restricts her from doing this, which is where the need for this loan to bolster her business comes in. This loan will increase her capital, her sales, and thereby her profits. She will save these profits so that at some point in the future, she can buy herself a motorcycle, which will allow her to make home deliveries.

loans.use: to buy bunches of plantains and sacks of cassava and cocoyam in bulk

loans.name: Angèle

texts.fr: Angèle est une femme de 53 ans mariée mère de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 13 et 27 ans. Trois de ses enfants vont à l'école. Elle a ouvert un restaurant qu'elle gère depuis des années. c'est grâce à lui qu'elle s'occupe de sa famille. Le fait d'acheter les produit de restauration en détail ne rapporte vraiment grand chose pour elle. D'où l'importance de ce crédit pour son activité parce que ça lui permettra d'augmenter le stock de ses denrées alimentaires ( son stock de viande, de poisson et plantains et le petit nécessaire pour cuisiner ses plats. Cela lui évitera les déplacements quotidiens et diminuera ses frais de taxi, ça augmentera aussi ses bénéfices. Elle réinvestira une partie de ce profit pour agrandir son restaurant, l'autre l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Angèle is a 53-year-old married mother of four children between the ages of 13 and 27. Three of her children attend school. She opened a restaurant which she has run for many years. It is thanks to this restaurant that she is able to provide for her family. Buying specific catering produce doesn't earn her a great deal of money. This is where the importance of this business loan comes in. It would allow her to increase her food stocks (meat, fish, plantains and small essentials for cooking the dishes). This loan will cut out daily travel and reduce her taxi expenses. It will also increase her profits. She will reinvest part of these profits into growing her restaurant. The rest will go towards providing for her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of meat, fish and plantains

loans.name: Marco

texts.en:
Marco is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in metal art for decor as well as function. He would like to purchase tools and a polishing machine for his workshop.

Marco has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story:
"From the time I was a boy, I was inclined toward design. As a teenager, I studied maintenance mechanics and what I learned there enabled me to work and to depict my own ideas in metal. My specialty is working in cold metal. I try to make the most of materials that others usually discard. Nothing is junk – I can use everything."

A message from Marco: "Thank you all for taking part of this microcredit, and for supporting artisans around the world. With these funds I'll be able get the tools I need to increase production, as well as to work on the new designs I have in mind. Thank you so much!"

loans.use: to purchase tools and a polishing machine for his workshop

loans.name: Ymerli

texts.en:
Ymerli is an Egyptian Albanian who has four grown up children and a paralyzed wife he has to look after. They are indeed poor and they fall below the national poverty line, according to our institution’s poverty measurement tool. 

Ymerli and his wife live under very poor conditions and now they want to make some improvements to their home before winter kicks in. They live among other members of their community in a main city in the part of southern Albania that is known for the largest Egyptian ethnicity. 

Here it is what Ymerly stated to the loan officer who interviewed him, “I have to care for my paralyzed wife, and living in such conditions doesn’t make it any better for me, unfortunately. I will be extremely appreciative to all lenders who will generously help me financially through this loan.”

loans.use: to improve their living conditions that are currently under the national poverty level.

loans.name: Lydia's Group

texts.en:
The representative of this group is Lydia, who is 44 years old. She has an elementary school education, is married, and has three dependent children. She earns a living selling vegetables.

Lydia will use this loan to buy more cabbage, carrots, onions, green peppers, beans, etc. She wants to make the most of this opportunity. She's requesting this loan because she doesn't have enough money to buy these items to sell to customers. It will benefit her greatly because she can sell and increase her income.

Lydia is happy because this marks her fifth loan request. She and her friend need a total amount of 1,700 GHS to buy and sell adequately.

loans.use: To buy cabbage, carrots, onions, green peppers, beans, etc. to sell to customers.

loans.name: Pancrace Doris

texts.fr: Doris est une femme de 37 ans veuve et mère de 3 enfans dont l'age varie entre 4 et 11 ans. Elle a ouvert un pressing qu'elle gère depuis 3 ans. c'est grâce à lui qu'elle s'occupe de sa famille. Elle aimerai s'acheter une nouvelle machine à laver pour augmenter la rapidité et satisfaction de sa clientèle. d'où la nécessité ce crédit pour son activité parce que ça lui permettra de d'augmenter, satisfaire, fidéliser sa clientèle . Elle réinvestira une partie de ses bénéfices dans son activité et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Doris is a 37-year-old widow and mother of three children aged between 4 and 11. She opened a dry-cleaner's which she has been running for three years. It is thanks to this business that she is able to provide for her family. She would like to buy a new washing machine in order to increase her turnaround and better satisfy her customers. This is where the need for this loan comes in. This loan will allow her to increase her number of customers, give them better service and make sure they use her business again. She will reinvest part of her profits into her business and the rest will go towards providing for her family.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine

loans.name: Los Lirios (The Irises) Group

texts.en:
The seven women of the group Los Lirios (The Irises) live in the small city of San Miguel Dueñas, Sacatepéquez, Guatemala.  The businesses these women have include selling ice-cones, embroidery, tortillas, catalog items, and a small store.  

Clarita Florentina (3rd from left) is 26 years old and migrated to San Miguel Dueñas from another part of the country because of the lack of opportunity in her hometown.  She is married and has three small children, one of whom is in school.  The others are still too young to go to school.  She and her husband rent their home.  She runs a small store, and her profit from this store is the largest source of income for the family.  She opens the store at 6 AM and closes it at 10 PM.  

Because of her inexperience in the business world, her store has struggled in the past.  She is looking forward to the financial education and business advice that Namaste will provide to her along with her loan, so that she can do a better job of handling her money and managing her store.  With her loan, she intends to buy fruit, fruit juices, and other items that her customers want which she does not currently have in the store.  Currently, her profit is around $357 USD and her dream is to work up to a profit of about $800 with her new skills and the additional supplies she plans to buy.  This additional profit will ensure that her two younger children can go to school when they are old enough.

loans.use: to stock more items in her small store

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a Guatemalan artisan who specializes in hand-carved sculptures and masks. He would like to invest in wood, saws, paints, and sandpaper for production.

Jose has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"I learned my craft from my father. When I was younger he would only allow me to sandpaper a piece, and as I got older he would let me paint too. It wasn't until I was older that he'd finally let me carve the wood. I remember well the first piece I ever did completely on my own: an angel. I put it among the things my father took to the market to sell, and then I lost track of it! I hope it got sold to someone who appreciated it because at the time I was only an apprentice."

A message from Jose: "Sales at the market have gone down this year, making it hard to purchase the materials I need. That's why I am so grateful for your support through your microcredit, because it will make it possible for me to continue carving and working on new products. Thank you very much, and may God bless you."

loans.use: to invest in wood, saws, paints, and sandpaper for production

loans.name: Johana Del Socorro

texts.es: Johana vive en una comunidad de Matagalpa desde los siete años. Ella está casada y tiene dos hijos. Una joven de 17 años y un niño de 6 años. Ambos están estudiando. La joven está en secundaria y el niño en la escuela primaria. Ella tiene una micro tienda donde vende vivieres y productos básicos del hogar. Su marido le ayuda con la microtienda. Además con ellos vive un sobrino. Su hermana, mamá del sobrino, emigró a Costa Rica y le ayuda mandándole dinero para los gastos de la casa. En la comunidad donde ella vive había luz eléctrica pero el Huracan Mitch (1998) les quitó ésta. Desde entonces quedaron sin energía eléctrica. Ella solicita un crédito para obtener un sistema solar y asi poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y tener una mejor calidad de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Johana has lived in a community in Matagalpa since she was seven years old.  She's married and has two children, a young girl, 16, and a boy, 6, both of whom attend school.  The girl's in high school and the boy's in elementary school.  Her husband helps her in her small store.  A nephew also lives with them.  Her sister, the mother of her nephew, emigrated to Costa Rica and sends money to help Johana with the household expenses.

There used to be electricity in the community where she lives but it was destroyed in Hurricane Mitch (1998).  Since then they haven't had electricity.

Johana's requesting a loan to get a solar energy system.  This way she'll be able to give her customers better service and have a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran is a 47-year-old lady, living along with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  The financial condition of her family is not good; her husband is the only person who can afford all the household expenses. 

Her husband has grown old, but even in his old age, he is conducting a scrap business. He is a hawker, and purchases scrap iron, plastic, waste paper, etc. from people door to door. He uses his four-wheeled cart to carry the goods from one place to another. Nowadays, his cart has damage due to the loading and unloading of goods. He wants to repair it and change its tires, but he does not have sufficient savings.

Sughran requested a loan so that her husband would be able to repair his four wheel cart and could buy scrap goods for resale. Sughran hopes that with the profit amount, she will increase her savings to meet sudden needs in the future.

loans.use: For the maintenance of four wheel cart and to buy scrap goods for resale.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Doña Ana de 56 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su madre, ella se dedica a la venta de carne, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por su amabilidad y buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, doña Ana está solicitando un crédito para la compra de carne por mayor para poder seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así poder obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana, 56, lives in a relative’s house with her mother.  She works selling meat.  Her business is located in the market near her place of residence.  She has many customers because of her kindness and good prices.  She earns profits that allow her to cover some of her household expenses.  

Ana’s asking for a loan to buy meat at wholesale to stay in business since this is her only source of income so that her profits will rise and she can give her family better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy meat at wholesale.

loans.name: Caminando Juntos Group

texts.es: Personas carismáticas y responsable  conforma el grupo  “Caminando Juntos” constituida por 07 mujeres trabajadoras. Clariza de 20 años es  separada con 01 hijo menor de edad. Hace 02 años que se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, la cual lo realiza a pedidos, siendo sus mayores clientes vecinos y amistades. Gracia a su esfuerzo puede apoyar a su hijo. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de casacas, pantalones, polos y chompas. El deseo de Clariza es de poner una tienda donde pueda ofrecer sus prendas de vestir. El grupo “Caminando Juntos” está agradecido con el crédito brindado, pues le permite seguir mejorando cada día. Clariza se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste chompa negra.
texts.en: All seven members of the "Caminando Juntos" group are charismatic, responsible and hard-working women.  Clariza is 20 years old and is separated.  She has one son and, for two years, has made a living selling clothes that people order from her.  Her biggest customers are her neighbours and friends.  Thanks to Clariza's efforts, she is able to support her son.  Clariza will use this loan to buy coats, trousers, t-shirts, and pullovers.  Her wish is to have a shop where she can sell her clothes.  The "Caminando Juntos" group is grateful for this loan as it will allow the members to continue improving every day.  In the photo, Clariza is the one one the left - she is sitting, and wearing a black jumper.

loans.use: to buy coats, trousers, t-shirts, and pullovers.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia con su hija y su madre, posee un negocio de tienda desde hace algunos años con su negocio ella va solventando algunas de las necesidades, es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora además de ello muy responsable, posee mucha clientela por la variedad de productos y los buenos precios, la clienta está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar más variedad de productos y poder surtir su tienda con: granos básicos, pan dulce, aceite, sopas, golosinas, etc.  y para obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad económica.
texts.en:
This client lives in her own house with her daughter and her mother.  She has had a grocery store business for several years and is able to cover her needs with it.  She’s a very enterprising, hardworking woman as well as very responsible.  She has a large clientele because of the variety of her stock and the good prices.  

She’s asking for a loan to buy a wider variety of goods to stock her store with such as basic grains, sweet bread, oil,, soups, snacks, etc. to earn higher profits and provide her family with better economic conditions.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Juan  Dolores

texts.es: Don Juan de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia junto con su familia,  tanto él como la esposa se dedican a la elaboración de tamales desde hace varios años, posee una gran clientela por su amabilidad en el negocio, es una persona muy conocida en el lugar donde el reside,  con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, don Juan está  solicitando un crédito para poder invertirlo en el negocio de tamales comprando: maíz, vegetales, tomates, hojas de huerta así como las que muestra la fotografía que sirven para envolver, etc. y seguir con su negocio y tener una mejor calidad de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Juan, 46, lives with his family in his own house.  He and his wife have worked making tamales for several years.  He has a large clientele because of his kindness at work.  He’s very well-known where he lives and his work produces enough for him to cover some of his household expenses.  

Juan’s asking for a loan to invest in the tamale business buying corn, vegetables, tomatoes and leaves which as shown in the photo are used to wrap, etc. and to continue in business and have better quality of life with his family.

loans.use: to buy corn, vegetables, tomatoes, leaves, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Elfida Paulina

texts.es: Doña Elfida Paulina, casada vive en una aldea de Santiago Sac, empezó vendiendo solo granos básicos, ahora ya es una tienda de consumo diario, como venta de golosinas, gaseosas, jugos, maíz, frijol, ahora también productos lácteos, sin duda a logrado surtir su negocio gracias a los créditos que ha obtenido DE KIVA, vende de lunes a sábado de seis de la mañana a siente de la noche, también vende al crédito solo a socias que ella considera que le cancelaran, es muy conocida tiene clientela favorable pues su buena atención y amabilidad hace que sus clientes la prefieran. Espera poder seguir ayudando a sus hijos y que ella pueda ser de ayuda para cualquier necesidad y que su techo sea seguro cuando ya no pueda trabajar.
texts.en: Elfida Paulina is married and lives in a village in Santiago.  She started her business selling just basic grains but she now has a shop where she sells everyday, consumable products, such as sweets, fizzy drinks, juices, corn, beans and, now, dairy products as well.  Without a doubt, it is with Kiva loans that Elfida has been able to stock up her business. She works Monday to Saturday from 6am until 7pm.  Elfida also sells on credit but only to people who she knows will pay their debt.  Elfida is very well-known and has regular customers as she offers good service and is friendly.  Elfida hopes to keep helping her children and to support them with whatever they need. She also hopes that she will have a secure roof over her head when she has to stop working.

loans.use: to buy everyday, consumable products.

loans.name: Dúo Jenesis Group

texts.es:
Dúo Génesis
Este dúo está conformado  por doña Liria quien es casada y tiene 6 hijos y nos cuenta que desde hace un año ella se dedica a la venta de pollo destazado de manera ambulante en el sector del caserío los Cux, los días lunes miércoles y sábados y los días que no va a vender, va a lavar y planchar(ropa). Ella está solicitando este crédito  porque necesita comprar el pollo al contado ya que el camión repartidor se lo deja al crédito pero muchas veces los pollos estan lastimodos(golpeados) y se mueren, entonces ella prefiere comprarlos al contado así le dan opción a escogerlos y ner que no esten lastimados(golpeados), además quiere ayudar a sus hijos que están estudiando y uno de ellos ya se va a ir a carrera(diversificado) y el gasto va a ser mayor y su esposo no cubre todo entonces quiere que Fape/Kiva la pueda ayudar. También esta doña María Ruth es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijas y ella vende ropa típica desde hace 15 años, también hace costuras y diferentes tipos de blusas para luego venderlos.
texts.en:
"Genesis Duo"

One member of this duo is Liria, who is married and has six children.  She tells us that for a year she has been making a living selling chickens as a street vendor in the Los Cux hamlet.  On Mondays, Wednesdays, and Saturdays Liria does not go out to sell chickens but works washing and ironing clothes.  Liria is applying for this loan because she needs to buy chickens on credit.  The lorry that comes round selling the chickens sells on credit but, on many occasion, the chickens have been injured and die.  So, Liria prefers to buy on credit and can choose which ones she takes and make sure that they have not been injured.  Liria also wants to help her children, who are studying, including one who is working for his degree, which costs more.  Liria's husband does not earn enough to cover all the costs so Liria is applying to Fape and Kiva for a loan.  The other member of the group is María Ruth.  She is a single mother and has three daughters.  She has been selling traditional clothes for fifteen years.  She also does dressmaking and makes different kinds of blouses to sell.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is married with four children and all her children go to school.
