She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 400000 Uganda to buy more bags of charcoal. She works from home seven days a week and sells to all categories of people on retail basis. Her major business challenges includes the rainy season, which hinders her customers ability to reach her. 

She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen is married with three children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister). She has a beauty salon business and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids, weaves, and Vaseline. She works in a shop seven days out of every week and sells on retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and on-and-off electricity. She aspires to own a generator to assist in power shortages and also to own a fully stocked salon. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy boxes of cream relaxers, braids, Vaseline, and weaves.

loans.name: Mujeres Zona 2 Ki Group

texts.es:
La señora María Isabel es casada. Cuenta con 46 años de edad. No le dieron la oportunidad de estudiar. Tiene 2 hijos y de ellos 1 esta estudiando. Se dedica a la venta de ropa típica. Inició este negocio como empleada y a la fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de mercadería tales como: Cortes, guipiles, fajas, etc. para surtir su venta. Espera en el futuro contar con un local bien establecido en el centro del municipio.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la venta de ropa tipica y a la venta de refacciones.

Una de las integrantes no pudo asistir en el momento de tomar la foto.
texts.en:
María Isabel’s married.  She’s 46-years-old and never had the opportunity to go to school.  She has two children one of which attends school.  She works selling traditional clothing.  She started this business as an employee and to date has 10 years’ experience.

She organizes a group and requests a loan she’ll use to buy supplies like bolts of fabric, skirts, sashes, etc. to stock her shop.  She hopes in future to have a well-established locale downtown.  

The other group members sell traditional clothing and snacks.  One of the group members was unable to be present when the photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Dúo Cosechando Metas Group

texts.es: La señora Vilma Floridalma quien tiene una tienda en su casa desde hace once años nuevamente pide otro crédito para su negocio ya que necesita comprar varias cosas para la tienda como, jabones, pastas, granos básicos como el maíz, frijol y también gaseosas en latas, desechables y en litros y  también para poder comprar queso crema.  El dinero que tiene no le alcanza y por eso necesita otro préstamo para poder comprar y surtir la tienda de las cosas que le hacen falta y no quedarles mal a sus clientes que siempre la visitan cuando llegan a comprar con ella, espera que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: Vilma Floridiana has had a store at home for 11 years and in once again asking for another loan for her business because she needs to buy several things for the store like soap, pasta, basic grains like corn and beans, soft-drinks in cans, disposables and in liters and also to buy cream cheese.  The money she has is insufficient and that’s why she needs another loan to be able to buy and stock the store with the items she lacks so that she won’t disappoint her customers who always visit her when they come by to buy from her.  She hopes you will be able to help her with the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy staple good to stock her store.

loans.name: Dúo Nelly De San Pedro Group

texts.es: La señora Nelly Evelia quien se dedica a la venta de queso de diferentes clases, crema por litro y vaso, también algunos cosméticos como cremas, lociones, champo, y calzado por catalogo.  Ella se ve en la necesidad de un crédito porque tiene varios pedidos de queso y crema, también pedidos de calzado pero le hace falta dinero para poder invertir y así no quedarles mal a sus clientes que son muy buenos compradores.  Su sueño es tener algún día su local para ya no ser una vendedora ambulante, y trabajar mucho para ayudar a su esposo y sacar a delante a sus dos hijas quienes están estudiando la primaria.  Su compañera doña Migdalia Azucena también se ven en la necesidad de comprar algunos güipiles y cortes que le han pedido, también algunos cosméticos y le hace falta dinero para poder comprarlo.
texts.en:
Nelly Evelia works selling different kinds of cheese, cream by the liter and by the glassful and also some cosmetics like creams, lotions, shampoo and shoes via catalog.  She needs a loan because she has several orders for cheese and cream and also for shoes but lacks money to invest and does not want to disappoint her customers who are very good buyers.  Her dream is to someday have a locale of her own to stop being a street vendor and work much to help her husband and move her two daughters who are in primary school forward. 

Her fellow member is Migdalia Azucena who also needs to buy some traditional skirts and fabrics she has orders for and also some cosmetics but needs money to buy them.

loans.use: to buy dairy products and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Exitosas De Chuabaj Group

texts.es:
La señora María Guadalupe es de estado civil casada. De 28 años de edad. No tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela. Tiene 1 hijo que aún no estudia. Se dedica a tejer guipiles típicos de la región. Inició este negocio por la enseñanza de su madre y hasta la fecha lleva 6 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para ampliar su capital de trabajo comprando materiales como tela, hilos, etc. para tejer más guipiles. Desea en el futuro cobtar con un capital amplio para tener mas ventas y tambien desea tener más clientes.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a venta de ropa tipica.

En la fotografia aparecen 7 integrantes, pero, solamente a 5 de ellas se les concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
María Guadalupe is 28 years old and married. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She has a son who is not yet in school, and makes a living by weaving huipiles [traditional garments] typical of her region. She started this business on what she learned from her mother and she has six years of experience so far.

María Guadalupe has organized a group and is asking for a loan that she will use to expand her working capital, buying materials like fabric, thread, etc. to weave more huipiles. In the future she wants to have ample capital in order to have more sales and she also wants to have more customers.

The other members of the group make a living by selling traditional clothing.

Seven members appear in the photograph, but only five of them were given the loan.

loans.use: to buy thread and fabric to weave huipiles

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a single and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 10 years and earns 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month aside from other income. 

Her previous loan from GDMPC was successfully repaid. Again, she borrowed a loan to purchase fertilizer for this cropping. Her hope and dream is to improve her living situation and save a portion of her profit for the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is married, and has two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental along with her family. Her husband is a farmer and at the same time works as a driver. For six years, she has been running a general store to make a living. Her previous loan that is used in her business was successfully repaid. 

Recently, she borrowed 15,000 PHP intended for the farm which is in need of fertilizer such as manure. A portion of her loan will also be used to buy additional grocery items for sale. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure and additional grocery items for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for materials needed in making mufflers.

loans.name: Servando

texts.en:
This is Servando; his previous loan was a big help in his businesses. He is a variety store owner, and he is also a Jeepney ( a popular form of mass transit) operator. His loan also helped in the education of his children. As he increases his loan, his income also increases which he used in their household expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 60,000 PHP loan for him to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the variety store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Servando dreams that he will be more successful in his business, and hopes that his children will finish their studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week, and also to draw strength and inspiration from the study of the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
This is Ronald.  He previously obtained a PHP 10,000 loan that he used to buy more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in his business. His earnings were a big help in meeting his personal, household, and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another PHP 50,000 PHP loan that he will use to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in his inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Ronald hopes to improve his business and dreams of becoming a good businessman. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and business every week.  There he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen. Her previous loan was a big help in her business as she was able to have her multicab repaired and she was able to buy the spare parts needed in her business. Her loan also helped in the education of her children. Her income from the loan assisted in their everyday household expenses. She and her husband are both working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their mulitcab unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and her child's everyday expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Helen dreams to have another mulitcab used as a service for students. She hopes that her youngest child will finish his studies. She meets with her co-fellowship* members each week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and for the maintenance of her multicab unit.

loans.name: Neda

texts.en:
This is Neda. She previously accessed a 13,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for an 18,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials like fabric, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and her child’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Neda dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week in a place where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en: Hasmik lives in Kapan city in Syunik region. She has a higher education and she is a marketer by profession. Hasmik is a widow. Her daughter was just three years old when her husband died in a car crash. Since that time Hasmik lives alone with her daughter to whom she devoted all her time, her love and strength in order to bring up a kind, clever and honest person. It is already fourteen years that Hasmik has been engaged in the cloth trading business. She works at the Kapan city wholesale market where she rents a stall and sells womens clothes. Products for her stall she brings from Yerevan once a month. She asks for a loan of 1.000.000 Armenian drams in order to buy a new collection of autumn-winter clothes and enlarge her income.

loans.use: to buy a new autumn-winter clothes collection for her clothes trading business in order to enlarge her income from clothing

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Kadiatu. She is married, and has one child aged 3. She has one additional dependent who lives with her for schooling purposes. 

In 1999, Kadiatu established her plastics business. She began her business because she wants to assist her husband  to take care of the home. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le4,000,000. Kadiatu requires a loan in order to buy more plastics of different kind for resale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits. 

In the future, Kadiatu plans to buy land and to build a house. She is very hardworking and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more plastics of different kind for resale

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: This is 35-yr-old Kadiatu. She is married and has one child aged six years. In 2009, Kadiatu established her charcoal and wood business. She began her business because she wants to help in taking care of the home. Working seven days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about SLL 850,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Kadiatu requires a loan in order to buy more bags of charcoal and wood for resale. In the future, Kadiatu plans  to get more profit and invest it in timber to get established in business. She is very hardworking.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal, eg.100 bags, for resale

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Saidu. He is married with two children, who are 14 and 9 years old.

In 1994, Saidu established his business selling various goods and foods, including pure water, biscuits, lunch meat, sardines, and milk. He started his business because he was trained as a businessman. Working seven days per week and 14 hours per day, he is able to earn approximately 1,000,000 SLL every month.

He is now seeking a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Saidu would like this loan in order to purchase more inventory for re-sale and would use any remaining money on transportation needs. In the future, Saidu would like to expand his business and to ensure that his children are educated. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory (e.g., water, biscuits, lunch meat, sardines, and milk) for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
This is 47-yr-old Ramatu She is married and has three children, who are 25, 16, and 12 years old. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her as a sale assistant.

In 1996, Ramatu established her plastics sales business. Specifically, she sells goods such as plastic/rubber bowls, buckets, and spoons. She began her business because she wants to help take care of her home and family. By working 7 days per week and 15 hours per day, she is able to earn approximately 850,000 SLL every month from her business. She explains that she is very hardworking.

She is now seeking a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Ramatu would like this loan in order to buy more rubber, buckets, and spoons in a very large quantity for re-sale purposes. In the future, Ramatu plans to build a house and to educate her children to the university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory (e.g., rubber, buckets, and spoons) in bulk for re-sale purposes.

loans.name: Consulate

texts.en:
Consulate used the loan to buy cosmetics to sell. She is a 27-year-old mother of two children living in Kagadi, Uganda. She operates a beauty salon business, having begun it with savings accrued from her teaching job. Inadequate capital and high transport costs are factors affecting her business growth.

Having used her previous loan to buy cosmetics for her salon, Consulate intends to use this loan to buy more cosmetics to sell. She wishes to expand her business into other new markets, and buy land for growing crops.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Willi Mapu Runca Group

texts.es: Ana Maria, quien en la fotografía aparece en medio de la fotografía sentada, lleva puesto un gorro negro y una bufanda naranja, pertenece al Banco Comunal Willi Mapu Ruca, de Valdivia, En este Banco Comunal los socios tiene diversos negocios tales como compra y venta y arreglo de vehículos. Venta de ropa, negocio de abarrotes, y venta de empanadas. Ana Maria tiene un negocio de venta de empanadas, ahora vende empanadas de horno pero comenzó hace aproximadamente unos 5 años vendiendo empanadas fritas. Ella vendió casa por casa sus productos hasta que un día algunas personas le solicitaron empanadas de horno y como la masa es distinta le pidió a un amigo que tiene una panadería que le enseñara a hacer la masa de las empanadas de horno. Hace ya un año que cambio su rubro y solo prepara para la venta empanadas de horno. Ha tenido muchos altos y bajos y uno de sus problemas más graves ha sido la falta de dinero para poder trabajar. Con el dinero que está solicitando necesita comprar harina, carne y cebollas que es lo básico que necesita para sus empandas. Ella está muy contenta y esperanzada en que le irá muy bien con la venta. Lo que más e ha gustado de poder trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de que no le solicitan tantos documentos para poder solicitar un préstamo, que solo creen en su negocio.
texts.en: Ana Maria, who is seated in the center of the above photograph and wearing a black hat and orange scarf, belongs to the communal bank "Willi Mapu Ruca" in Valdivia.  The members of this communal bank have a variety of businesses, such as buying, selling and repairing vehicles, selling clothing, running a small grocery and selling "empanadas" (a stuffed bread or pastry that is baked or fried).  Ana Maria has a business selling "empanadas."  Right now she sells baked "empanadas," but she started out approximately five years ago selling fried "empanadas."  She sold them from house to house until one day some people asked her for baked "empanadas."  Since the dough is different, she asked a friend, who has a bakery, to teach her to make the dough for baked "empanadas."  A year ago, Ana Maria changed direction, and now she only makes baked "empanadas" for sale.  She has had a lot of ups and downs, and one of her gravest problems is not having enough money to work.  With the money she is requesting, Ana Maria needs to buy flour, meat and onions, which are the basics for her " empanadas."  She is very happy and hopeful that all will go well with her sales.  What Ana Maria likes most about working with Fondo Esperanza is the fact that they don't ask her for so many documents to get a loan; they just believe in her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, meat and onions.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 29-year-old married man and has a child.  They live together in Taiz, Yemen. He is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic man.  He studied for a diploma as an Electrical Technician. He is an employer who puts all of his efforts into getting ahead.  Unfortunately, his salary isn't enough to improve conditions for his family. 

He would like to buy a refrigerator to keep foods and soft drinks cold, but he is not able to due to lack of money. So, he has applied for a youth loan of 125,000 YER from AMB to buy a refrigerator to use in the house.  He hopes to open an electrical materials shop to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to use in the house.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is a Oaxacan artisan in Mexico who specializes in handwoven Zapotec textiles. He would like to increase the physical space of his workshop and hire additional weavers from his community. He would also like to purchase new pedal looms, combs, nets, and bulk wool.

Mario has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story:

"I come from a family of weavers, it is a legacy I inherited from my great-grandfather. My aim is to preserve and promote the beauty of the Zapotec art. We dye the wool with natural colorants and we work on the pedal looms."

A message from Mario: "The only way to preserve the dignity of handcrafted arts is to get to know what artisans like me can do with their hands and creativity. I thank you for your support through this microcredit."

loans.use: to increase the physical space of his workshop and hire additional weavers from his community, and also to purchase new looms and raw materials

loans.name: Arif

texts.en:
Arif is a 37-year-old married man and the father of three sons. He is very energetic, an honest and hard-working man. 

He performs all his duties regarding selling his milk very well. He gets up early in the morning for getting milk from buffaloes so that he can carry it to the urban area.  He uses part of the unsold milk for making yogurt, butter, and cheese and for his family's usage. 

Getting milk and then selling it into the market is not an easy work for a single person, but Arif does a lot of hard work for the sake of his family. He recently recruited two assistants, who help him in the completion of his daily tasks. 

Inflation is increasing day by day, and his family's needs are, too. His children are growing older and now are going to a higher school. To cope with the inflation, to pay the salary of his assistants, and to meet the increments in his family's expenses, Arif wants to grow his business. So he decided to buy another buffalo so he can increase the milk production and supply. He loves his family and wants to provide them comfort at any cost.

Therefore, Arif has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so he can buy a buffalo and get more milk to sell. 

Arif hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in the lives of his beloved family members. Although he is doing hard and a little bit dirty work, he feels proud of his efforts for his family.

Arif says thank you to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for getting milk to sell.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida is a married woman who has been blessed with three children, two of whom are in school and one still underage. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Hamida operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is high cost of transportation.

She is requesting for a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Sonia Yiseth

texts.es: Sonia es una joven de 22 años de edad, dedicada a trabajar en el negocio de comidas rápidas que inició como una opción para generar ingresos y así aportar a la economía de su hogar. Trabaja sola de Martes a Domingo desde las 5:00 y hasta las 10:00 pm, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su casa desde hace un año y desde allí ha logrado generar los recursos suficientes para solventar algunos gastos familiares. Ella se caracteriza por ser activa, pujante y emprendedora, con una mentalidad positiva que la ha llevado a lograr lo que se propone. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de un enfriador, mesas, sillas e insumos al por mayor (salsas, carnes frías, aceite, papas), adicionalmente realizará unas adecuaciones locativas, de esta forma tendrá la capacidad de ofrecer un mejor servicio, pues los clientes estarán más cómodos y además cambiará la imagen del local, lo que le permitirá atraer nuevos clientes; esto se reflejará en el incremento de sus ventas y por ende de sus ingresos. Es así como Sonia desea avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño que es montar un restaurante, en el que pueda generar oportunidades de empleo y que sea rentable, así tendrá la posibilidad de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sonia, 22, is a young woman who is dedicated to working in her fast-food business that came about as a way of earning income to contribute to her home’s upkeep.  She works alone Tuesday to Sunday from 5-10pm.  Her business has been located at home for a year and she’s earned sufficient income there to cover some off the family expenses.

She’s noted for being active, driven and enterprising with a positive outlook that has led her to attain what she’s set out to do.  She’s currently asking for a loan to buy a cooler, tables, chairs and supplies at wholesale (sauces, cold-cuts, oil, potatoes) and also to do some physical improvements to the site.  In this way she’ll have greater capacity to provide better service since her customers will be more comfortable and she’ll also change her site’s appearance which will attract new customers and this will be reflected in her sales and thus her income.

This is how Sonia intends to advance towards reaching her main dream which is to open a profitable restaurant where she can generate employment and have the opportunity of improving her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a cooler, tables, chairs and supplies at wholesale and also to do some physical improvements to the site.

loans.name: Paula Raquel

texts.es:
Paula, una mujer trabajadora de 30 años, a pesar de que hace 3 años falelcio su compañero de vida, ha sabido salir adelante, y es hoy, que requiere de una ayuda para sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos de 2, 5 y 8 años de edad.
Paula actualmente posee una refrigeradora y le saca provecho, porqué vende productos como: gelatinas, charamuscas, chocobananos y hielo. Actividad que la adquirió, para ir subsidiando las necesidades de la familia, ya que no cuenta con la ayuda de sus familiares.
Con el préstamo, se le estará ayudando para que pueda comenzar a invertir en la compra de vitaminas, ya que mucho tiempo atrás se dedicaba a la ventas de productos varios, y hoy quiere retomar esa habilidad en las ventas; ya que ha visto las experiencias de una vecina, que le esta yendo bien en las ventas de medicina.
Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda, para que sus hijos puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Paula, 30, is a hardworking woman. Despite her spouse’s death three years ago she’s managed to get ahead and needs help now to move her three children who are 2, 5 and 8 years old forward.

Paula owns a refrigerator at present that she avails herself of to sell products like gelatin, ‘charamuscas’ [frozen treats packaged in clear plastic baggies], chocolate covered bananas and ice.  She started this activity in order to meet her family needs since she gets no help from relatives.

The loan will help her to start buying vitamins for some time ago she worked selling various products and she’d like to start selling them again because she’s noted that a neighbor of hers is doing very well selling medicine.

Her dream is to make home improvements so that her children will have better living conditions and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy vitamins (medicine) to sell.

loans.name: M. Boota

texts.en:
M. Boota is a 50-year-old married man, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is the father of three daughters and three sons. His three daughters have reached the age of marrying but he does not have savings to arrange the dowry for them. He has grown old and always has to worry about the future of his daughters. His two sons are doing jobs in industry and one goes to college. 

M. Boota requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he could buy 'rexine', leather, shoe polish, buckles, nails and thread for making shoes.  He is a shoemaker by profession; he has been making shoes for many years and now he is one the finest professional shoemakers in the market. He makes shoes by hands for both genders and his handmade shoes are very famous in his hometown. M. Boota wants to grow his business so that he can increase his savings for a dowry for his daughters. 

Therefore, M. Boota requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he can make his ambitions come true. He utilizes the full amount for the establishment of business so that he can relieve his worries. 

M. Boota hopes that the lenders will kindly help him to raise the loan; he praises all the lenders who support the poor people all over the world. M. Boota is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy raw material such as 'rexine', leather, and buckles for making shoes to sell.

loans.name: Shahzad

texts.en:
Shahzad is 28 years old, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Shahzad newly begins a business on partnership, in which he sells mobile phones and phone accessories. Initially, he did not have enough money to start the business, so he has taken financial help from his friend. Due to this partnership, he has to distribute the profit amount in two equal parts, which leaves him with much less. Also, his friend is not happy over the turnover, so he wants his money back. Shahzad does not have the money to pay the partially-invested amount to his friend. 

Therefore, Shahzad requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that he could pay the borrowed money and get full control over the shop and its profits. 

Shahzad is a married person and recently started in his new life. He does not want to fail in fulfilling his responsibilities. He wants to get maximum earning, so that he can create a good reputation among his family members. 

This time, Shahzad is hopeful that this business will work well and he will establish it soon, so that he can earn income for his family. Shahzad is very thankful to the Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To pay the  partially-invested amount to his friend in Mobile shop.

loans.name: Fahmida's Group

texts.en:
Fahmida is the age of 43. She is the mother of seven children. Her husband owns an electrician shop in which he sells electrics tube rods, bulbs and energy saver bulbs of various brands. He provides services to his clients for electric goods also. For the growth of his business and desire for getting maximum profit for his family, he wants to buy more bulbs, tube rods and energy savers for his shop.

Therefore, Fahmida requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband becomes empowered to buy bulbs, tubes and energy savers. In addition, he wants some extra electric switches, bulb holders, sockets, etc., to offer his customers. 

This is third loan for Fahmida; she describes her wish to take a huge amount after this loan. She hopes that her husband would be able to grow his business soon.

Note: Fahmida is standing with a raised hand in the given picture.

loans.use: To buy tube rods, bulb and energy saver bulbs of various brands.

loans.name: Ebenezer De La Guardiania Group

texts.en:
This group of eight women from La Guardianía in Sacatepéquez, Guatemala, chose the name Ebenezer for their group because they are mostly Christian, and Ebenezer means “Until now God has helped me.”  They formed the group because two of their friends had been in the Namaste program.  The women of Ebenezer saw with their own eyes how the business advisor, business education program, and loans provided by Namaste helped their friends to improve their businesses.  These women are now eager to start learning for themselves how to better manage their own businesses and how to control their expenses.  Some of the women in the group cannot read or write, and their average education level is 4th grade.  They all have several children and some of the women are the only support for their family.  The average age is 38 and the oldest is 55.

Marta Lidia (on the far right) started her store, which is pictured above, one year ago with approximately US $90.  She was able to reinvest in the business because her husband helped her with household expenses.  Then he lost his job and they started having to use the money from the store to feed the family and send two of their three children to school.  Their third child is still too young for school.  They live in a very humble place but because her store presents itself well her current profit is approximately US $590.  She says, “With a loan I can buy black beans, rice, sugar, corn and charcoal in bulk.  I am sure I can then increase my profit by 23%, continue making my business bigger, and help my husband until he finds a job.”

loans.use: to buy beans, grains, sugar and charcoal in bulk to increase her sales

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es: El grupo “LA AMISTAD” está conformada por 06 mujeres emprendedoras quienes día a día trabajan para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Maria tiene 38 años de edad es conviviente con 03 hijos educando. Maria se dedica al tejido a base de lana e hilo hace varios años y en sus tiempos libres trabaja como ayudante de cocina en fiestas y su localidad. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de lana e hilo para su trabajo. En el grupo cumple la función de tesorera. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Maria es la segunda del lado derecho viste casaca roja. De la misma manera se encuentra incluida la foto de Norma que no pudo estar presente en la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The "La Amistad" (Friendship) group is formed by six entrepreneurial women who work to improve their families' quality of life on a daily basis.

Maria is 38 years old and lives with three of her children who are in school. Maria has made a living from knitting with wool and thread for many years, and in her free time she works as a kitchen helper for parties in her town. The loan will be invested in buying wool and thread for her work. Maria holds the position of treasurer in the group.

The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan. Maria is the second woman from the right and is wearing a red jacket. The photo of Norma is likewise included; she couldn't be present at the meeting because she was working.

loans.use: to buy wool and thread

loans.name: Liliam

texts.es: Liliam de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 25 y 24 años y un nieto de 2 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas desde hace 15 años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado afuera de su casa, posee clientela fija ya que no hay muchas ventas de pupusas cerca de su casa y eso le da la oportunidad de tener más clientes, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, liliam está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, frijoles, quesillo, chicharrón, tomates, repollos, aceite, etc. para poder seguir con su negocio y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Liliam is 49 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and two children ages 25 and 24 and one grandchild 2 years old. She has been selling pupusas (a traditional dish) for 15 years. Her business is located outside her house. She has a steady clientele as there aren't many businesses selling pupusas near her house and this provides her the opportunity to have more customers. With her income she is able to pay some household expenses. Liliam is seeking a loan in order to buy corn, beans, cheese, pork rind, tomatoes, cabbage, oil, etc. in order to continue with her business and provide her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, cheese, pork rind, tomatoes, cabbage, oil, etc.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es: Doña Maria de 51 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia  junto a su hijo de 19 años de edad él estudia actualmente,  la cliente posee un negocio  de venta de ropa y zapatos nuevos y usados, es una persona muy responsable en su trabajo como en su hogar  con lo que obtiene de su trabajo va solventando algunas de las necesidades de casa, por eso ella está solicitando un crédito para poder realizar una inversión en el negocio comprando mas ropa y zapatos para damas y caballeros por mayor para mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica al  lado de su hijo
texts.en: Maria is 51 years old, a single mother who lives in her own house with her 19 year old son who is in school. She has a business selling clothing and shoes, new and used. She is a very responsible person in her work as in her home, and she uses her income to pay her household necessities. She is seeking a loan in order to make an investment in her business buying more clothing and shoes for women and men at wholesale in order to improve her sales and income and have a greater economic stability for herself and her son.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes for women and men at wholesale.

loans.name: Mujeres Para Un Futuro Mejor Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “Mujeres Para Un Futuro Mejor”  conformada por 05 socias entusiastas de comenzar a trabajar. Este el caso de  Elsa de 39 años de edad casada con 03 hijos  02 de ellos aún dependiente. Con los deseos de superarse y motivada por su pareja Elsa apertura su puesto de venta de comida, la cual se viene desempeñando hace mas 03 años.  Con perseverancia y esfuerzo ha mejorado su vivienda. El crédito solicitado lo destinará para la compra de insumos como arroz, azúcar, fideos y menestras.  Mejorar su negocio es su siguiente meta. El nuevo grupo “Mujeres Para Un Futuro Mejor” está agradecido por la ayuda brindada. Elsa se encuentra en la parte posterior es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste chompa ploma.
texts.en:
The new group "Mujeres Para Un Futuro Mejor" is comprised of five members who are excited to start working. This is the case for Elsa, 39, who is married with three children, two of whom are dependents. With hopes of improving and being motivated by her husband, Elsa opened her food stall, which she has been developing for three years. With perseverance and effort, she has improved her home.

This loan will be used to buy products such as rice, sugar, noodles, and soup. Her next goal is improving her business. The new group "Mujeres Para Un Futuro Mejor" is grateful for the help. Elsa is in the back row, first one on the left and is wearing a sweater.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, sugar, noodles, and soup.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Cruz Del Norte Group

texts.es:
Isabel, tiene 41 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos a su cuidado. Ella pertenece al grupo "Cruz del Norte", éste grupo está formado por cinco socias, es un grupo unido y muy trabajadores cada uno en su negocio.
Desde hace quince años Isabel tiene una pequeña bodega en su domicilio, la cual dedicándole tiempo y gracias a los créditos que ella ha podido obtener ha ido creciendo su negocio. Como una actividad paralela ofrece en alquilar un local destinado a eventos y reuniones lo cual le permite tener otra ingreso económico.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de golosinas y bebidas para surtir su bodega.
texts.en:
Isabel is 41 years old, married, and has two children in her care. She belongs to the group "Cruz del Norte". This group consists of five members, and it is a very hard-working and united group, each one has her business.

Isabel has had a small store in her home for 15 years, because of the times she has dedicated and the loans she has been able to obtain she has grown her business. As a parallel activity she rents out a locale for events and meetings which permits her to have additional economic income. 

The loan will be used to invest in buying snacks and beverages to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Missekple I Group

texts.fr: Le groupement MISSEKPLE I est formé de quinze personnes qui résident dans le même village. La représentante de ce groupement, nommée Gagnonsi est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Gagnonsi âgée de 53 ans est veuve avec quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et un à sa charge. Gagnonsi vit avec ses enfants. Gagnonsi n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, Gagnonsi vend depuis quinze ans des condiments dans sa région. Parallèlement, Gagnonsi vend également du maïs. Gagnonsi achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Gagnonsi et les autres membres du groupement MISSEKPLE I sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité et d'accroître leur fonds de roulement, afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en: The group Missekple I consists of fifteen people who live in the same village. The representative of the group, named Gagnonsi, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. Gagnonsi is 53 years old and a widow with four children, some of whom are in school and one is her dependent. Gagnonsi lives with her children. Gagnonsi did not attend school. To provide for her family, Gagnonsi has been selling condiments in the region for fifteen years. At the same time, Gagnonsi also sells corn. Gagnonsi buys goods in a market in Benin. This is the first time that Gagnonsi and the other members of the group Missekple I are seeking a loan from Alidé. This credit will allow them to strengthen their business and increase their capital, in order to better meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy spices and corn

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestine is married and has four children. She works hard to support her family with her dried fish making business in the Philippines. 

Celestina is requesting her fifteenth loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional fish to make dried fish.  She successfully paid back her previous loans and will use the new loan to further build her business.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is married with three children, and all of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister's children). She has a beauty salon business, and she has been in this business for ten years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy boxes of hair oils, Vaseline, weaves, and braids. 

Deborah doesn't have any additional income-generating activities. She works six days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. She aspires to own a bridal salon, and also to earn enough profits to be able to build her own house. She resides in a house with her family, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of hair oil, weaves, braids and Vaseline.

loans.name: Unyenyekevu Group

texts.en:
Georgette is the accountant of Unyenyekevu business group. She is 37 years old and a mother of 1 child who is in school. 

The client started a business of selling second hand shoes 5 years ago with her own funds received from her husband.  With this loan, she wishes to buy 60 pairs of shoes in order to sustain her activity and to pay school fees for her child. 

She thanks Hekima for their financial support in this situation of war.

loans.use: buy 60 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a 33-year-old married man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a retail shop but also does farming in order to earn a living. Inadequate capital and price fluctuations are his major challenges, while his dream is to own a supermarket. 

Andrew intends to use the loan to buy sugar, salt, and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Umoja Virunga Group

texts.en:
The client Buyana is 36 years old and a mother of 7 children. She is the secretary of “Umoja Virunga” business group. She sells second hand shoes in the public market. She started the activity with her own funds given by her husband. 

With the new loan, she will buy 50 pairs of shoes. Her wish is to see her business grow, and continue paying school fees for her 5 children who study and feed them. The client is thankful to Hekima for its support.

loans.use: to buy 50 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Maa Thakurani Group

texts.en:
Banita is about 40 years old and lives with her husband and four children at Bhawanipatna, in Kalahandi district of Odisha state in India. She has three daughters, aged about 17, 15 and 12, and one son, aged about 10 years. All are studying at school and college now. The lady standing at the extreme left with her hand raised is Banita. 

She has been running a tea stall for the last eight years, with some snack items prepared by her along with her husband. From the above, her family gets a monthly income of 6,000 INR, with which it is very difficult to maintain her family. 

She has already availed one loan from Mahashakti during last year. Now she wants another loan to purchase a gas stove and repair the roof of the tea stall for the expansion of her business. She has an ambition to provide a better education to her children for a bright future. 

Other members of the group, Swarnaprabha, Gitadei, Partha and Banita, need loans for an automobile shop, a betel shop, a fish business and a chicken center respectively. All the members have established businesses, and it will be their second-cycle loan from Mahashakti Foundation.

loans.use: to purchase a gas stove and repair the roof of her tea stall.

loans.name: Maa Tarini Group

texts.en:
Suryamani, aged about 53 years, is a widow. She is residing with her nephew, aged about 31 years, at Bhawanipatna of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India. The lady standing on the right with her hand raised (back row, right side) in the photograph is Suryamani. 

Suryamani has been running a grocery shop for the last 14 years. She earns about Rs. 7,000 (INR) per month from the business. Although she has a small family of two members only, according to Suryamani, this amount is not at all sufficient for her to manage the household expenditures. So she wants to expand her business to earn some extra income.

She has already availed two loans from Mahashakti.This is her third-cycle loan. With the present loan, she wants to invest in a fridge and ice cream items. 

Other members of the group, Indumati, Sarojini, Rabamani, Minakumari and Swapna, need a loan for a rice business, electrical shop, tailoring business, tailoring business and tea stall respectively.

loans.use: to invest in a fridge and ice cream items.

loans.name: Linda Group

texts.en:
This group is called “Linda”. It is made up of four ladies who work together in different areas in Sana`a, Yemen. This is a group of women with initiative, values and good proposals on how to conduct business nowadays. They requested a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. 

Linda is 32 years old and a married woman with three children. She is a merchant; specifically she sells new clothes for adults and children, according to the season. She sells her products from her house. She buys her merchandise from distributors and stores where the prices are cheaper. 

She began this activity as a result of selling her business from home. With the income from her business, she was able to upgrade her home and enjoy more comfort. At the present time, her business doesn't get her as much profit due to the bad situation in Yemen. So she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to acquire articles of clothing such as dresses, shirts, pants, skirts, shoes, etc. She will sell them to her customers, thus giving her the opportunity to improve her income from her business. 

One of her personal dreams is to send her children to private high schools.

loans.use: to acquire articles of clothing such as dresses, shirts, pants, skirts, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Asem Group

texts.en:
This group, called Asem, consists of four ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. They have applied for a loan totalling 130,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank. 


One of the group members, 30-year-old Muthia, wants to build another room in her house because sometimes she feels embarrassed when guests arrive and she has no place to welcome them. She will use her loan portion of 30,000 YER to buy construction supplies to build the room.


Muthia hopes to improve her living standards so that she and her family can live more comfortably in their home.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pay laborers, pay the rent on the land he works, 2 liters of herbicide, and 10 pounds of bean seed.

loans.name: Saeed

texts.en:
Saeed lives in Punjab, Pakistan, with his family. He believes in hard work and honesty. He is a caring and responsible father. He owns a small herbal medicinal store, which is the only source of income for the family.

Saeed wants to purchase a variety of herbal medicines for his medical store. However, due to a lack of money he is facing a problem. Therefore he has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of the loan, he will purchase medicines from the factory. He hopes to increase his net income by adding a new variety of herbal medicines. 

Saeed wants to thank all the staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of herbal medicines for his medical store.

loans.name: Baishnodevi Group

texts.en:
Rahila, aged about 39 years, resides with her husband and two sons, aged about 18 and 15, at Bhawanipatna of Kalahandi district, in Odisha, India. The lady standing at the extreme left with her hand raised in the photograph is Rahila. In the year 2010, she formed a group with other members of her locality to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation.

Rahila has been running a grocery shop in her locality for the last 15 years. She earns about Rs. 8,000 (INR) per month from her business. According to Rahila, there is a huge demand for snacks/dry food items. So, she is planning to procure those type goods from Raipur and start wholesaling snack items. 

She has already availed two loans from Mahashakti. This is her third-cycle loan. With the present loan, she wants to purchase snacks and instantly usable dry food items to increase the turnover of her business. Rahila has an ambition to provide a better education for her children for a bright future.

The other four members of her group, Jhili, Gitanjali, Laxmi and Madhu, need the loan to invest in a grocery shop, tailoring business, tea stall and tailoring business respectively.

loans.use: to purchase snacks and instantly usable dry food.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a business woman who is very hardworking. She has seven children who go to school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

Fatuma has operated a charcoal selling business for the past two years. Her potential clients are her neighbors and passersby. 
With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase twenty sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase twenty sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Yuni

texts.en:
Yuni is an artisan from Bali who specializes in batik [a type of cloth] and silk accessories. She would like to invest in the purchase of silk to stock up for the holiday season.

Yuni has been selling through Novica since 2006. This is her story:

"I learned the art of batik from my mother when I was very young. She has been making batik at home in Java for over 23 years, while waiting each day for my father to come home from the sea. We still design together, especially the floral and bird motifs that are typical in Pekalongan batik. My husband, Rieckey, also helps me a lot, but as a local Balinese woman, I'm very proud of the fact that I can have the career that I love and also provide for myself and my family."

A message from Yuni:

"I would like to increase my stock for the holiday season, so I am happy to be able to do it with this microcredit. Thank you for your support. Hopefully my stock and sales will increase! I would be so happy if any of my shawls were to hang beautifully from your shoulders."

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of silk to stock up for the holiday season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia is the single mother of four children, and three of her children go to school. She doesn’t have additional family members to take care of. 

She has a business selling green bananas, and she has been in this business for one year. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis.  

Zakia has applied for a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality.  She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house. 

She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water.    Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Izolda

texts.en:
Izolda is a 60-year-old woman. She lives with her son in a small village of the Gardabani district. She is provided with a retirement pension. Her son is an artisan in building and gets GEL 250 per month.

Izolda decided to run her own dairy business, so she has requested a loan for purchasing a cow and food for it. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, gives her a chance to get a loan of GEL 1,500. She will purchase a cow and will milk it every day to produce cheese products to sell. 

She is very motivated to have her own business and plans to sell her cheese in local markets.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and food for it

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra is 47 years old and married, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children.  Part of her house is still under construction   because she does not have savings to complete the remaining construction. 

Her husband owns a clothing business.  His practice is to buy fabrics from wholesalers and sell them to retailers. He has built up a good reputation in the market.  Due to the large numbers of customers, the demand for fabrics is increasing day by day, but he does not have sufficient money to buy more fabrics.

Therefore Azra has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can be able to buy more fabrics to fulfill the demand. She is in her sixth loan cycle and has shown an excellent repayment behavior.  She has already taken loans from BRAC and invested in the business. 

Azra hopes that her savings will much increase, and she will complete the remaining construction of her house.  She dreams of a bright future for her children, of building the business, and of a better standard of living for her family.

She is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Shaktimayee Group

texts.en:
Chaimani lives in the small town of Bhawanipatna, the district headquarters of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India. She is a headstrong and confident lady. She hails from a poor family of below poverty line. The lady standing at the extreme right with her hand raised is Chaimani. She is 38 years old and lives with her husband, three daughters and one son. 

Chaimani has had a bakery factory for the last 15 years with the active support of her husband. Chaimani gets a monthly income of Rs. 8,500 (INR) from the above business. Out of this income, she hardly is able to manage her household expenses. She needs financial support from Mahashakti to purchase sugar, wheat, whole wheat, oil, etc. for making bakery items. She also wants to invest some portion of the loan for the repair of the factory.

In the year 2010, Chaimani, along with other women members of the locality, formed a group named Shaktimayee to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation to expand their businesses. This will be their third-cycle loan.

The other three members of the group, Noorjahan, Salimun and Saira, want loans for a meat shop, motor garage and bag business respectively.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, wheat, whole wheat, oil, etc. for making bakery items.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is a 40-year-old, married man. He lives in the capital city of Georgia with his wife, two sons, and mother. His sons go to the local public school. His mother works at the library and gets 400 Gel per month. Levan’s wife is a housekeeper. 

Levan is an artisan. He repairs damaged cars. He already has a car and a driver's license. 

He decided to be involved in an additional business and requested a loan. His loan request was approved within the framework of a start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, to get a loan of USD 1,200. 

With the received loan, Levan will install a fuel system in his car and he will serve local people as a taxi driver. This will increase the income of his family.

loans.use: to install a fuel system in his car.

loans.name: Andersen Milan

texts.es:
Andersen es un joven de 19 años, quien trabaja como obrero de un fundo agrícola, para poder solventar los gastos de manutención y poder salir adelante, Andersen labora en su trabajo alrededor de 8 horas al día, Andersen también tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de cerdos, con lo cual tiene un ingreso extra para los gastos de su hogar; Andersem cree que le está yendo bien en su trabajo porque es responsable y sobre todo porque se esfuerza mucho.

Andersen está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder cercar el corral de sus chanchos y de esta manera los cerdos no se salgan de los corrales; así el seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño: “Estudiar la carrera de derecho”.
texts.en:
Andersen is a young man of 19 who works as a laborer on an agricultural estate in order to pay his expenses to maintain himself and to be able to advance. Andersen works at his job about 8 hours a day. He also has a little business of selling pigs, from which he has some extra income for his household expenses. Andersen believes that things are going well for him in his work because he is responsible and above all because he works hard.

Andersen is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help that they have offered him he will be able to buy construction materials to enclose the corral for his pigs and in this way the pigs will not get out of the corrals. Thus he will be able to continue striving to make a reality of his great dream: to study for a career in law.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for a corral

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa alquilada junto a su hija, su madre y su hermano que también aporta al hogar, ella tiene un puesto de venta de pupusas desde hace varios años en su lugar de residencia, es una persona muy trabajadora y muy responsable con su trabajo, es de esta manera como ella sostiene las necesidades de su hogar, la clienta está solicitando un crédito  para poder invertir en su negocio comprando maíz, quesillo, chicharrón, frijoles, repollos, tomates, etc.  y generar mayores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia
texts.en:
This borrower lives in a rented house with her daughter, her mother, and her brother, who also supports the household. She has a stand in her home where she has sold pupusas (a traditional dish of El Salvador) for a number of years. She is a very hard-working person and very responsible in her work. It is in this way that she sustains the needs of her household. 

This borrower is applying for a loan to be able to invest in her business by buying corn, fresh cheese, cracklings, beans, cabbages, tomatoes, etc., and generate greater earnings to have better economic stability in her family.

loans.use: buy corn, fresh cheese, cracklings, beans, cabbages, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Grupo Unido Group

texts.es:
JHON MICHAEL, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero. Desde muy joven ha empezado a trabajar con la meta de apoyar a sus padres económicamente y estudiar una carrera profesional.
Él forma parte del grupo de nombre "Grupo Unido" formado por seis integrantes, cada uno de ellos dedicados a una actividad comercial, socios que han demostrado responsabilidad y compromiso con su grupo.
Jhon Michael, se dedica desde hace tres años a prestar servicio de transporte mediante un vehículo menor que en el Perú le denominamos mototaxi, el cual sirve para trasladarse a zonas cercanas. Gracias a ésta actividad él puede apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa y así juntar para mas adelante estudiar.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de la mototaxi, en la regularización de documentos.
texts.en:
Jhon Michael, 19, is single. Since a very young age he has worked with the goal of helping his parents financially and studying a professional career. He is part of the "Grupo Unido" group, made up of six members. Each one of them is dedicated to a commercial activity. They are members that have demonstrated responsibility and dedication to their group.

Jhon Michael has been making his living for three years by providing transport service via a small vehicle that we call a "mototaxi" in Peru. This is used to take him to nearby places. Thanks to this activity he can support his parents with the expenses of the home and save in order to further his studies.

The received loan will be invested in the maintenance of the mototaxi and in the updating of documents.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance of his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Shekainer Women's Group

texts.en:
Patience managed to buy materials for school jerseys. She is now able to have different school uniforms in stock. The standard of living of the family has greatly improved because of the extra income she has generated, and she is also able to pay fees without hassles.

She has requested a loan of $700 to buy more materials for uniforms.

loans.use: to buy knitting wool for school jerseys.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Peruvian artisan Miguel recycles metal pieces into sculptures. He would like to invest in new tools and equipment to design and shape his sculptures and also to increase the physical space of his workshop.

Miguel has been selling through NOVICA since 2007. This is his story:

"I'm a self-taught and impassioned artist. I was only 13 years old when I began to make my own toys. I used to tear apart other toys and use their components to create my own versions. That's how I got into making sculptures, but this time by recycling mechanical parts."

A message from Miguel: "With this microcredit I'll be able to continue working and developing as an artist, so thank you so much for your support."

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment to design and shape his sculptures and also to increase the physical space of his workshop

loans.name: Nengah

texts.en:
Nengah is an Indonesian artisan who specializes in hand-carved sculptures. He would like to invest in new tools and equipment, including an airbrush and a sander, as well as wood and finishing materials.

Nengah has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story:

"From an early age I loved natural things: plants, animals, birds, or sea life. When I was still quite young I knew I had an ability to translate nature into artful things of beauty. Although I have no formal art training and work purely from my own inspiration and intuition, I know what looks good and what doesn't look right in a carving. I particularly want to create wildlife and other animal themes in an exact, realistic, and original way."

A message from Nengah: "Many thanks to all of you for offering me this microcredit, because it will let me prepare a good stock for the holiday season, and this will greatly benefit my business and make it grow. Thank you, all my lovely customers; without you my business cannot grow."

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment, including an airbrush and a sander, as well as wood and finishing materials

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando and his family are Mexican artisans who transform metal scraps and used car parts into original sculptures. He'd like to buy materials and also a machine for soldering his metal art.

Armando has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is his story:

"I was born in a Mexican town famed for its traditional artistry, but I dreamed of creating something new. As a child I enjoyed inventing toys and soon yearned to create a unique style of art. Environmentally enamored, I now transform recycled goods. I began to craft figures from scrap and discarded mechanical parts, mostly from cars and bicycles. Thanks to the creativity that God gave me, today I have an enjoyable and better way of life."

A message from Armando: "Thank you for your concern for artisans like us. Your loan is helping us to have a better life, and you will always be in our prayers."

loans.use: to buy materials and also a machine for soldering his metal art

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is a Guatemalan artisan who specializes in hand-carved wood items for home and kitchen decor. He would like to invest in the purchase of cedar and palo blanco woods for production.

Roberto has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story:

"When I was 11 years old I walked into a wood workshop and asked the owner to teach me the carver's craft. My desire to learn was very strong, and I was motivated by my ambition to be the best and of course, to help my family. It hasn't been easy to establish myself as a lone artisan, but my wife's support encourages me to constantly renew myself as an artist. I believe it is important to showcase the handcrafted nature of wood carving, and that's why I take time to teach. I don't want to see this art form disappear. I also stress the importance of working with certified woods and being conscious of preserving the environment. In fact, we have participated in reforestation campaigns to ensure green and healthy forests. I am so grateful to the Lord for allowing me to achieve what I wanted. I have a workshop I can leave to my children, I have a good job, and I try to instill in others the example of hard work, will and honesty that my parents taught me."

A message from Roberto: "Thank you all for the opportunity of this microcredit so I may keep producing. I am working on increasing my stock and developing new designs to generate more sales. It will go toward providing a dignified quality of life and education to our children."

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of cedar and palo blanco woods for production

loans.name: Rubi's Group

texts.en:
Rubi is 47 years old and living with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a weaver and knots the carpets at home. For knotting carpets, different kinds of natural and synthetic fibers are used, namely, wool, cotton, jute, and viscose. Carpets are woven by hand on a structure called a loom. There is no better kind of the carpet than a carpet made by hand, though this is far from implying that all hand-tufted carpets are superior to all machine-made ones. Traditionally, carpets are woven on wooden looms. The carpet is generally woven in a warp, i.e., a chain of vertical threads, fixed almost vertically in front of the weaver.

Her husband is very expert and knots very fine carpets. This is a very slow and time-consuming procedure; he knots carpets over nights. This is the reason her husband can sell at a high price, but the problem is that the customers do not always agree over the demanded cost. The demand for fine carpets has been increasing from time to time.

Her husband wants to buy more raw material for knotting carpets, but he does not have enough savings to make this purchase possible. Therefore Rubi has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can buy raw materials, such as polyester, wool, cotton, jute, and viscose fibers for knotting carpets.  The loan should cause her husband's income to increase. 

Note: Rubi raises her hand in the picture.

loans.use: To buy synthetic fibers, namely wool, cotton, jute, and viscose, for knotting carpets.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu is 33 years old and lives in the Kakata.  She is married, with eight children, ages 3 to 16; all live at home and are in school.

For the past five years, Musu has been selling lappa (fabric). She sells for six days a week, spending nine hours each day. She makes lots of profit, especially during school time.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more lappa (fabric) for her business. The main business problem she faces is her capital is very small; she hopes to enlarge her business.

loans.use: to purchase more lappa (fabric) for her business.

loans.name: Walter Alberto

texts.es: Walter de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, él se dedica a la agricultura principalmente a la siembra de maíz, frijol y sorgo, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Walter está solicitando un crédito para la compra de herbicidas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y seguir con sus siembras ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Walter, 30 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and his two children. He is a farmer, and grows mainly corn, beans, and sorghum. He is able to cover some household expenses with what he earns from his sales. Walter is asking for a loan to buy herbicide, fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc., and to continue with his crops, since this is his only source of work. In this way he will be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy herbicide, fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Shriya Group

texts.en:
Mandakini, a young entrepreneur, hails from a small town of Bhawanipatna, district headquarters of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India. The lady standing at the right with her hand raised is Mandakini. She is 36 years old and lives with her husband and one daughter, aged about 13, and one son of 11 years of age. 

Mandakini has had a betel shop for the last 15 years with the active support of her husband. Mandakini gets a monthly income of Rs. 6,000 (INR) from the above business. Out of this income, she hardly is able to manage her household expenses. Now she wants to expand her business by adding daily needs goods in her shop.

In the year 2010, Mandakini, along with other women, formed a group to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation to expand their businesses. This will be her third-cycle loan. With this loan, she wants to purchase rice, oil, sugar, tea, washing powder, shampoo, potatoes, onions, etc. for expanding her business.

The other member of the group is Dali. Her husband is running a gymnasium. For supporting her husband, she wants a loan for purchasing body-building machines like a treadmill, dumbbells, bench-press, triceps machine, etc.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, sugar, tea, washing powder, shampoo, potatoes, onions, etc.

loans.name: Subhashree Group

texts.en:
Ahalya lives at Bhawanipatna, the district headquarters of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India. She is a headstrong and confident lady. The lady standing at the left and raising her hand is Ahalya. She is 38 years old and lives with her husband and one son and two daughters. 

Ahalya has been doing tailoring and dress designing for the last 12 years. She also gives training to girls. Ahalya gets a monthly income of Rs. 8,000 (INR) from the above business, but it is not enough for the household expenses. Ahalya also wants to give a better education to her children to make their careers bright. She needs financial support from Mahashakti to purchase more tailoring machines (picot and interlock machines) and cloth. 

In the year 2010, Ahalya got her first loan from Mahashakti Foundation. This will be her third loan. In the future, she wants to be a professional tailoring tutor. 

The other member of the group, Lalima, is having a grocery shop of her own. She wants a loan for purchasing grocery items for her shop.

loans.use: to purchase more tailoring machines (picot and interlock machines) and cloth.

loans.name: Alicia Yaneth

texts.es: Doña Alicia de 39 años de edad  vive casa propia  sus dos hijos  y su esposo quien es mecánico, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y con buenas referencias personales por parte de sus vecinos, su negocio es una carnicería que está ubicada en el mercado central cerca de su casa, posee mucha clientela por los buenos precios y amabilidad que ella tiene a la hora de vender, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunas de las necesidades en su hogar, ella solicita un crédito para  comprar carne y chorizos  para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad d vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Alicia, 39 years old, lives in her own house with her two children and her husband, who is a mechanic. She is a very hard-working woman with good personal references from her neighbors. Her business is a butcher shop, which is located in the central market near her house. She has many customers due to the good prices and her friendliness when selling. She is able to cover some of the household necessities with what she earns from her sales. She is asking for a loan to buy meat and sausages in order to earn more and give her family a better quality of life with no limitations.

loans.use: to buy meat and sausages

loans.name: Malimba Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the members of the “Malimba” group from Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. 

They are small-business people who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000  for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their respective businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profits, and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Ibrahim. Ibrahim was born in Sanda, in northern Sierra Leone, 38 years ago. He is married and has two children who are attending primary schools. His wife is a businesswoman, too. 

Ibrahim sells building materials. With his share of this loan, he is going to buy building materials like cement, corrugated iron sheets, etc., to resell.

loans.use: to buy building materials like cement, corrugated iron sheets, etc., to resell

loans.name: Francisca Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Francisca es una persona muy trabajadora y honesta, vive en casa propia con sus hijos ellos estudian actualmente, hace varios años se dedica a su propio negocio posee una pequeña  tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Francisca solicita un crédito para la compra de mercadería como granos básicos, aceite, azúcar, refrescos, golosinas, etc. y con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Francisca is a very hardworking and honest person.  She lives in her own house with her children, who are currently in school.  She's had her own business for a number of years; she has a small store located in her home.  From this store, she obtains income to pay her household bills.  Francisca is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as: staple consumer goods, cooking oil, sugar, beverages, snacks, etc.  With this loan, she hopes to be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy staple consumer goods, cooking oil, sugar, beverages, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Hector Asael
