texts.es: Don Héctor  de 33 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar conformado por su esposa, sus dos hijos y su padre, hace varios años se dedica a la venta de madera su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don Héctor solicita un crédito para la compra de  maderas por mayor, para obtener mejores ganancias y  brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Héctor, 33 years old, is a very hard-working and responsible person. He lives in his own house with his family members, consisting of his wife, his two children, and his father. He has sold wood for several years. He has his business in his place of residence. He is able to cover some household expenses with what he earns from his business. Héctor is asking for a loan to buy wholesale wood in order to earn more and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale wood

loans.name: Bertila

texts.es: Doña Bertila vive en casa propia junto a sus 5 hijos y su esposo, ella posee un molino desde hace varios años,  es una persona con mucha clientela  establecida, amable, atenta, y con  buena moral  de pago, gracias a sus labores ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos familiares. Doña Bertila solicita un crédito para mejorar su negocio en la compra de más herramientas, cuchillas, fajas, discos, etc.  para mejora su molino, incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Bertila lives in her own home with her five children. She has had a small mill for several years. She has a large, established customer base. They are kind, attentive, and have a good payment moral. Thanks to her workers, she has been able to pay her family expenses. Bertila is requesting a loan to improve her business by buying tools, blades, belts, disks, and other items to improve her mill, increase her income, and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more tools, blades, belts, disks, and other items.

loans.name: Blanca Del Rosario

texts.es: Blanca de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura y sus dos hijos quienes trabajan y ayudan en los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir desde hace 20 años posee mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la calidad con que las confecciona, con lo que gana de su trabajo y la ayuda de su esposo y sus dos hijos logran cubrir los gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un  crédito para la compra de los materiales que utiliza en su trabajo como: hilos, agujas, botones, telas, etc. y así poder obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en: Blanca, 47 years old, lives in her own house with her husband, who is a farmer, and her two children, who work and help with the household expenses. She has made clothing for 20 years. She has many customers due to the good prices and the quality with which she makes the items. With what she earns from her work and her husband's help, they are able to cover the household expenses. She is asking for a loan to buy the materials she uses in her work, such as thread, needles, buttons, fabric, etc. In this way, she can earn more in order to have better economic stability with her family.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, buttons, fabric, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bundle of clothing

loans.name: Taratarini Group

texts.en:
Bhawanipatna is the district headquarters of the Kalahandi district in Odisha, India, where Dali, aged about 24 years, resides with her husband and mother-in-law. The lady standing in the middle with her hand raised in the photograph is Dali. In the year 2009, she formed a JLG with other members of her village to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation.

Dali has had a grocery shop for the last five years. She earns about Rs. 6,500 in a month. Her husband also supports her in the business. According to Dali, this amount is not at all sufficient for her to manage the household expenditures as well as business expenses. So, she wants to expand her business to earn some extra income. It will be her fourth-cycle loan.

With the present loan, she wants to purchase rice, sugar, soap, oil, washing powder, potatoes, onions, ginger, garlic, dry chili and spices powder, etc. for the growth of her business. 

The other four members of the group, Jangyaseni, Bhumisuta, Kumudini and Golapi, also need a loan for a betel shop, cloth store, tailoring and vegetable vending respectively.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, soap, oil, washing powder, potatoes, onions, ginger, garlic, dry chili and spices powder, etc.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 55 years old and married, with five children, one of whom is in school.  Fe works very hard to provide for them.

Fe runs a business buying and selling native products in the Philippines.   She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of native products to sell.

She has been in this business for five years.  In the future, Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of native products to sell

loans.name: Finaumaleloto

texts.en:
Finaumaleloto is 52 years old and is married with 5 children.  She has a small garden where she grows pineapples that she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years.

Finaumaleloto needs a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, chemicals, a rake, aspade and a garden hose. She has been a member of SBPD in 2013.

Finaumaleloto will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: buy gardening tools and chemicals

loans.name: Jose Neftali

texts.es: Don José es una persona muy emprendedora y honesta, vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos ellos estudian  actualmente, hace varios años se dedica a la venta de pan dulce y pan francés y adicional a eso también posee un  molino, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don José  solicita un crédito para la compra de herramientas para su molino como: cuchillas, discos, fajas, etc.  Para mejor sus molinos y segur i con su negocio y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José is an enterprising, honest person. He lives in his own home with his life partner and their two children, who are currently studying. For several years, he has been in the business of selling sweet bread and French bread, and he also owns a mill. With what he earns from his business, he is able to meet his household expenses. José is requesting this loan to purchase tools for his mill such as blades, disks, belts, and so forth. This will help him improve his mill, continue with his business, and provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase blades, disks, belts and more for his mill

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is a 19-year-old married woman with 1 child. She makes and sells pork buns and donuts in her community to earn a living.  

Ivy needs a loan to buy flour, chicken, onions, oil, garlic, salt, sugar and a frying pan. She plans to use her profits to extend her business.

Ivy has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Maria Elena Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Maria de 67 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo, nieta y bisnieto en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y tamales desde hace mas de 15 años, posee muy buena referencia de parte de sus vecinos, es una persona humilde, responsable, honesta y muy amable, gracias a su trabajo ha logrado sacar a su familia adelante. Doña Maria solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos para continuar con la elaboración de tortillas y tamales como maíz, cal, verduras, tomates, etc.  de esta manera  incrementar su nivel de ventas y mejora su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Maria is 67 years old and she lives in her own home with her son, granddaughter, and great-grandson. She has been in the business of selling tortillas and tamales for more than fifteen years, and her neighbors speak very highly of her. She is a humble, responsible, honest, and friendly person. Thanks to her labor, she has managed to get her family ahead. Maria is requesting this loan so that she can buy supplies to keep on making tortillas and tamales. These supplies would include corn, lime, vegetables, tomatoes, and more. By doing this, she will be able to increase her sales and improve her own and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: buy corn, lime, vegetables, tomatoes and more

loans.name: Dugerjav

texts.en:
Dugerjav is 29 years old and lives with his father, mother and sister in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He has been working as bunker operator for a mining company for two years. His mother is a cook and works at a small cafeteria. Currently his father and sister are unemployed and looking for jobs. 

Dugerjav is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to buy automobile which runs on natural gas. The natural gas vehicle has cleaner emissions and wastes less fuel. The automobile will be used by his father for a taxi service and the family income will increase.

loans.use: buy a natural gas vehicle

loans.name: Rene Humberto

texts.es: Don René de 33 años de edad  es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en casa alquilada con su  hermano y sobrino, hace 4 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta  de pan francés, posee mucha clientela por la amabilidad que el tiene con sus clientes, los buenos precios y la higiene con que elabora los alimentos,  con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don René solicita un crédito para la compra de un motor que lleva el cilindro del horno donde elabora el pan, comprar latas y todos los ingredientes necesarios como: harina, lavadura, etc.  y con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: René, 33 years old, is a very hard-working and responsible person. He lives in a rented house with his brother and nephew. He has made and sold French bread for 4 years. He has a large clientele due to his friendliness with his customers, the good prices, and the hygiene with which he makes the food. He is able to cover some household expenses with what he earns from his business. René is asking for a loan to buy a motor for the cylinder in the oven where he makes the bread and to buy baking sheets and all the necessary ingredients such as flour, yeast, etc. With this, he hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy baking sheets, flour, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Anilyn

texts.en:
This is Anilyn, 39, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Gilberto, a vendor, and they have a child. She together with her husband manage their household while operating their business. Anilyn works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Anilyn operates her family's buy and sell business.  She buys general merchandise from wholesalers and resells them with a little profit. Her products are men and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  Anilyn earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Anilyn is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy ready-to-wear products and merchandise items like women’s clothing to expand her product inventory.

Anilyn hopes to have a stall in the mall. She dreams to give her child a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Lorelyn

texts.en:
Lorelyn is 34 years old and married with four children who are in school.

Lorelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been running this store for 6 years.  She also earns an income from selling rice.  

Lorelyn requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like eggs, oil, shampoo, sugar, groceries, etc. to sell.  She has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. Lorelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy inventory for her store

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 52 years old and has seven children. She is married and 3 of her children are in school.

Maria is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines.  She has been farming vegetables for 20 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Maria requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional seed and fertilizers for her farm.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mary Joy works hard to support her family.  She has a blacksmith business in the Philippines. 

Mary Joy is borrowing PHP 28000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like steel bar, aluminum, iron, etc. for her blacksmith business.  She has  successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her blacksmith business.

Mary Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy metals

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 8 years.

Virginia is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and now request a new loan to build her fish vending business.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: buy fish to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 35 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school.

Nenita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been running it for 5 years.  She also earns an income from selling livestock.

Nenita requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, milk, coffee, etc.  She has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan.  

Nenita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 56 years old and a widow with four children, one of whom is in school. Felicidad works very hard to provide for them.

Felicidad runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks like soap, sugar, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

Felicidad has been in this business for two years.  In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks, like soap, sugar, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 45 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items to sell like snack foods, sardines, diapers, noodles and other groceries. Cecilia has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from a coffee shop. She aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.fr: Boniface est un homme de 45 ans père de famille de 02 enfants de 10 et 16 ans. Il commercant dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 02 ans où il a ouvert une petite alimentation qu'il gère luio-même. C'est grace à elle qu'il subvient aux besoins de sa petite famille. son acceuil chaleureux et ses bonnes relations avec le voisinnage lui permis de fideliser une clientèle. il a juste un problème dû à la petitesse de son capital c'est pour celà qu'il sollicitye ce crédit qui lui permettre d'augmenter son stock des produits de première necessité (riz, savon, sel sucre et autres...). Ceci augmentera ses ventes ainsi que sa marge bénéficiaire. Bénéfice qui sera réinvesti en partie dans sa boutique pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Boniface is a 45-year old man, married, and the father of two children, 10 and 16 years of age. He [has been] a vendor in one of the neighborhoods of the capital city for two years. He has opened a small grocery store and manages it himself. This is how he provides for his small family. His friendly service and good relationship with the community help him to build a loyal customer base. His only problem is his small capital, which is why he is seeking loan to be able to expand his stock of first necessity goods (rice, soap, salt, sugar etc). This will increase his sales and also his margin. His revenue will be partly reinvested in his store in order to expand his merchandise stock. .

loans.use: to expand his stock of first necessity goods.

loans.name: Nancy Beatriz

texts.es: Nancy de 33 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, hace varios años posee un molino y adicional a eso elabora respaldos para asientos de vehículos, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Nancy solicita un crédito para la compra de materiales para la reparación de su molino fajas, discos, hierro, etc. para seguir con su trabajo, con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Nancy is 33 years old, and is a very hard-working and responsible person. She lives in her own home with her family. For several years, she has owned a mill, and in addition to that, she makes support backs for car seats. With what she earns from her business, she is able to meet her household expenses. Nancy is asking for a loan to purchase materials to repair her mill, including belts, disks, iron, etc.  This will help her continue with her business, with which she hopes to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase belts, disks, iron, and more

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Don Ricardo de 61 años edad vive en casa propia  con su esposa, su hija y su yerno,  su negocio es una ferretería cuenta con 11 años de experiencia laboral, es una persona trabajadora y esforzada por su familia es muy conocido en la zona por su personalidad y amabilidad con sus clientes, por ello posee una buena referencia de parte de sus clientes y vecinos, don Ricardo está solicitando un préstamo para capital de trabajo y poder comprar más clavos, madera, tornillos, pinturas, mangueras, etc. todo por mayor y surtir aun mas su negocio  para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en:
Don Ricardo, 61 years old, lives in his own house with his wife, his daughter, and his son-in-law. His business is a hardware store, and he has 11 years of work experience. He is a hard-working person and works hard for his family. He is well-known in the area for his personality and friendliness with his customers, and has good reviews from his clients and neighbours. 

Don Ricardo is requesting a loan for working capital to purchase more nails, wood, screws, paint, hosepipes, etc. to better stock his business, increase his earnings, and improve his family's economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase more nails, wood, screws, paint, hoses, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Doña Rosa de 47 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y honesta, vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo de 19 años de edad él trabaja y ayuda en el hogar, hace varios años se dedica a la confección de todo tipo de ropa, con lo que obtiene de su negocio y con la ayuda de su esposo y su hijo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Rosa solicita un crédito para la compra de telas,  botones, agujas, etc. para obtener mejores ganancias, con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rosa, 47 years old, is a very hard-working, responsible, and honest person. She lives in her own house with her husband and her 19-year-old son, who works and helps out at home. She has made all kinds of clothing for several years. They are able to cover some household expenses with what she earns from her business and with the help of her husband and her son. Rosa is asking for a loan to buy fabric, buttons, needles, etc. in order to earn more. With this, she hopes to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, needles, etc.

loans.name: Vilma Agustina

texts.es: Doña Vilma de 50 años de edad es una persona muy emprendedora y responsable, vive en casa propia con su hijo, hace varios años se dedica a la venta de antojitos típicos: yuca y papas fritas, empanadas, enchiladas, pastelitos de carne, etc. posee mucha clientela pues tiene ubicado su negocio en un punto muy estratégico donde transitan muchas personas,  con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Vilma solicita un crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos como: papas, yucas, plátanos, carne, vegetales, etc. y  con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Vilma, 50 years old, is a very entrepreneurial and responsible person. She lives in her own house with her son. For several years, she has sold typical snacks: fried yucca and potatoes, empanadas, enchiladas, meat pies, etc. She has many customers, since her business is located in a very strategic spot where many people go by. She is able to cover some household expenses with what she earns from her business. Vilma is asking for a loan to buy raw materials for preparing the food such as potatoes, yucca, bananas, meat, vegetables, etc. With this, she hopes to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, yucca, bananas, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Viminda

texts.en: Viminda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase additional products such as hotdogs, chicken, pig meat, etc. for her business. Viminda has been in this business for 5 years, and earns additional income from a general store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as hotdog, chicken, meat of pigs, etc.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz is 55 years old and widowed. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items to sell like bread, soft drinks and other groceries. Beatriz has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like bread, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en: Celia is 42 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock to sell. Celia has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. In the future she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Chona works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. Chona is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of the motorcycle she uses in her transport business.

Chona has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Solema

texts.en:
Solema is a 40-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, banana, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. 

She is requesting this loan to help her make improvements to her house, so her family can have better living conditions. She will use the loan to buy cement, timber, nails, and iron roofing. She will also use part of her loan to buy chemicals, spade, wheelbarrow, and fertilizer.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Solema hopes to help her children's education

loans.use: to buy cement, timber, nails, iron roofing, chemicals, spade, wheel barrow, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Mr. Battulga, 41 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. 

He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2006. His wife works at a food chain and oversees the product sales. Their elder son studies at a university, while their younger one goes to high school. 

He is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to pay for his elder son's tuition fees. He believes that the best investment he can make for his children is to give them good education.

loans.use: to pay for his elder son's university tuition fees.

loans.name: Jackieline

texts.en:
Jackieline, 40 years of age, is married and blessed with three children. She owns and operates a retail store in their village for almost two years. In this business, she's earning a net income of PHP 6,000 a day. 

Due to a lack of capital, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 30,000 to purchase rice grain, canned goods, breads, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve and expand her business to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase rice grain, canned goods, breads, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: San Luis De Cumbe  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito San Luís está formado por 8 socias y 2 socios quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, lugar de clima frio, amplias praderas y verdes campos que mezclado con su geografía accidentada nos regalan hermosos paisajes. Su gente al igual que las socias es tradicionalista, conservan muy bien sus costumbres y tradiciones que sus padres les inculcaron, trabajan en la crianza de animales, agricultura y mucha de su población viaja a diario a la ciudad a ejercer diferentes actividades.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora María Segunda, se encuentra realizando su segundo crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito San Luís de Cumbe, le gusta formar porte de este grupo ya que todas son muy cumplidas y solidarias.

La Señora María Segunda tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos, cinco de ellos son casados y viven independientes, una hija pasa en casa ayudándole a los quehaceres de su hogar y su última hija está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña María Segunda algunos días trabaja como jornalera, pero su principal ingreso es la crianza de ganado del cual vende la leche, también cría cerdos, cuyes, gallinas, lo que obtiene de su trabajo de la agricultura es para su hogar pero si existe un sobrante lo vende. 

El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de un becerro y en alimento para todos sus animales. 

Su meta es criar más animales y de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
The San Luís credit group is composed of 8 female and 2 male members, who live around the Cumbe parish in Cuenca. This area has a cold climate, wide grasslands, and green countrysides which, combined with the rugged terrain, make for beautiful scenery. The local people, including the group members, are traditionalist and maintain the customs and traditions that their parents taught them. They work in animal husbandry, agriculture, and much of the population travels daily into the city to pursue different activities. 

One of the members of this group is Señora María Segunda. She finds herself pursuing her second loan alongside her friends and companions from the San Luís de Cumbe credit group. She likes being a part of this group as everyone is very accomplished and supportive. Señora María Segunda is 49 years old, married, and through her conjugal union has 7 children. Five of them are married and live independently, one daughter lives at home to help with the household chores, and her youngest daughter is attending school in the city. Her husband works as a mason, and they own their home.  

Doña María Segunda sometimes works as a day labourer, but her main income source is cattle breeding, through which she sells milk. She also raises pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens. What she gets from her agricultural work is for her household, but if there is a surplus, she sells it.

She will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of a calf and in feed for all of her animals. Her goal is to raise better quality livestock.

loans.use: to purchase a calf and animal feed.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 57 years old and married with five children.

Cristina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks such as soaps, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, etc.

Cristina has borrowed and paid 26 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Cristina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks such as soaps, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks such as shampoos, soaps, canned goods, etc. to sell in her general store business.

Helen has been in this business for 20 years. Helen earns more income from buy and sell charcoal and firewood and from raising pig.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks such as shampoos, soaps, canned goods, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ana Janneth

texts.en:
Ana is currently attending the Universidad Mayor de San Simon, working towards her degree in business administration. She expects to graduate in November 2014, but without a loan is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Ana shares that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. 

With a loan, Ana plans on purchasing her much-needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Ana feels she will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. Working 30 hours a week, one of Ana's biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With a degree in business administration, she expects to earn $15 a day. 

As the youngest in her family, with two older siblings attending college already, Ana is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks and school supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 30 de Agosto se reúne en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 17, 12 y 8 años que estudian dos en colegio y el menor en escuela. El marido trabaja de ayudante de construcción. 

Doña Rosa al ver que su esposo no gana mucho en su trabajo y que su trabajo no es seguro hace 12 años le dijo que le construyera un pequeño galpón en el cual comenzó a criar pollos, con el paso del tiempo ella ha aumentado su granja y en la actualidad tiene hasta 400 pollos por temporada, la misma que dura dos meses tiempo en el cual los pollos están listos para la venta, ella entrega a comerciantes que luego los llevan a sus negocios en los diversos mercados de la ciudad.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para pollos para que estos tengan un buen desarrollo. Lleva más de un año en el Banco y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. 

Su sueños es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The "30 de Agosto" communal bank meets in Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. This is a place known for its busy commerce, its traditional fiestas of San Pedro and San Pablo, and the cheerfulness of its people. 

This is where Rosa lives. She is 34 years old and in a common-law relationship from which she has three children, ages 17,12 and 8. Two of her children  go to high school and youngest goes to primary school. Her husband works as a construction helper.

12 years ago, seeing that her husband did not earn much in his job and that his job was not secure, Rosa told him to build her a small shed in which she began to raise chickens. Over time she has expanded her chicken operation and currently has up to 400 chickens per season. The season lasts two months, by the end of which time the chickens are ready for sale. She delivers to merchants, who then take them to their businesses in the various city markets. 

She is going to use this loan to buy chickens, feed, and medicines for chickens so that they develop properly. She has been in the communal bank for more than a year, and likes it because of the loan assistance that is given. Her dream is to do her best for her children.

loans.use: To buy chickens, feed and medicines for chickens.

loans.name: Dolores Cecilia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 30 de Agosto se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Dolores, tiene 38 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 18, 14 y 11 años, el mayor no estudia y los dos menores estudian en colegio. El marido es comerciante.

Doña Dolores se dedica junto a su marido a la venta de billetes de lotería. Su esposo recorre por las calles de la ciudad de Portoviejo, mientras que ella tiene una tienda de víveres en la cual trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 20h00,  a pesar de que su tienda es pequeña le gusta tener de todo para que  sus clientes lleguen con más frecuencia a su local, allí  es donde vende los billetes de lotería, lleva tres años con su tienda y le está yendo muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda y billetes de lotería para vender alii y  para su esposo. Esta desde el inicio en el banco comunal y le gusta ya que gracias a uno de los créditos empezó su negocio. 

Su sueños es tener una tienda mucho más grande y bien surtida.
texts.en:
The 30 de Agosto communal bank meets every 15 days in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. This area is known for its commerce, its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo festivals, and the joy of its people. 

This is where Dolores lives. She is 38 years old, and in a common-law relationship through which she has three children aged 18, 14, and 11. The eldest is no longer studying and the two younger ones are in high school. Her partner is a merchant. 

Doña Dolores, together with her partner, makes her living by selling lottery tickets. Her husband sells in the streets of the city of Portoviejo, while she has a grocery store where she works every day from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. Although her shop is small, she likes to have some of everything so that her customers come to her more frequently, and she sells lottery tickets there. She has had her store for three years and it is going very well.

She will use this loan to purchase staple goods to stock her store and lottery tickets to sell there and for her partner to sell. She has been part of the communal bank since its inception and she likes it, because thanks to one of the loans she was able to start her business. Her dream is to have a much bigger and better-stocked store.

loans.use: to purchase staple products and lottery tickets.

loans.name: Sinive

texts.en:
Sinive is a 31-year-old single woman with one child.
 
She has a small plantation and grows banana, taro, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Sinive has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, spade, bush knives and barbed wire for her business.
 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. With her profits, Sinive hopes to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizers, spade, bush knives, and barb wire.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials and inventories to meet an order to produces 25 shoes on time.

loans.name: Elena Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 30 de Agosto se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Elena, tiene 32 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 4 hijos de 16, 13, 4 años  y el menor de apenas 3 meses de nacido, los dos mayores estudian en colegio. Su marido es comerciante.


Doña Elena es una mujer muy independiente que le gusta valerse por sí misma y también ayudar con el crédito a su marido que también como ella se dedica al comercio, mientras su marido se desplaza hasta Manta a vender su mercadería ella también lo hace pero solo por su localidad, ellos venden ropa interior, camisetas, carcasas de teléfonos, gorras y varios productos más. Trabajan todos los días el  casi todo el día mientras que ella solo en las mañanas. Llevan 15 años con este negocio el cual les permite salir adelante. 

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar ropa, gorras, carcasas de teléfonos, etc.  Lleva 4 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan con los créditos. 

Su sueño es comprar un carro y tener un local.
texts.en:
The 30 de Agosto communal bank meets every 15 days in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. The area is known for its commerce, its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo festivals, and for the joy of its people. 

This is where Señora Elena lives. She is 32 years old, and is in a common-law relationship through which she has 4 children aged 16, 13, 4, and the youngest barely 3 months old. The two oldest are in high school. Her husband is a merchant. 

Doña Elena is a very independent woman who likes to stand on her own and also help with loans for her husband, who, like her, works in commerce. While her husband goes as far as Manta to sell his merchandise, she does so as well but only locally. They sell underwear, tshirts, phone cases, hats, and various other products. He works every day almost all day while she works only in the mornings. They have been in this business for 15 years, and it allows them to get ahead. 

She will use this loan to purchase clothing, hats, phone cases, etc. She has been with the communal bank for 4 years and she likes it because of the help it always provides through loans. Her dream is to purchase a car and to have a shop.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, hats, phone cases, etc.

loans.name: Jennefer

texts.en:
Jennefer is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell tobacco business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of tobacco to sell in her buy-and-sell tobacco business.

Jennefer has been in this business for 18 years and she earns more income from a general store.

Jennefer has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 50 years old and married with four children.

Juliet works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks such as soft drinks, rice, noodles, milk, sugar, etc. to sell.

Juliet has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 26 years and earns an income from poultry raising.

Juliet aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks such as softdrinks, rice, noodles, milk, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Dila

texts.en:
After graduating from college, Dila decided to move to Los Angeles and find a job. Dila found a job, but she quickly realized something was not right. Dila knew that she was an entrepreneur at heart, and she had always dreamed of starting her own business. She started working as a freelance deejay, but being a female, she was constantly faced with challenges because audiences were skeptical as to how good she could actually be. These challenges, coupled with the fierce competition she faced from others, got in the way of Dila’s goal of becoming a professional deejay.  She jumped back into the job market, but still held onto her dream of one day becoming her own boss.

A couple of years ago, Dila began to help her friend with her spray tan business. She would occasionally assist in providing in-home spray tan services for customers who preferred to tan in the privacy of their own homes. After doing this work several more times, she found it very interesting and most importantly, with this job she was at an advantage as a female because most of her clientele were women. Over the next couple of years, Dila gained experience and built a solid customer base. 

She has now decided that it is time for her to start her own sun spray tan business. Her goal is to own her own tanning salon and become a successful entrepreneur. A $2,500 Kiva loan will help her attain the required licenses and capital needed to purchase the equipment and material to start her business.

loans.use: to get the license and purchase equipment for her sun spray tan business.

loans.name: Yolanda Cyntia

texts.en:
Yolanda dreams of becoming a systems engineer. She is currently attending the Universidad Autonoma Tomas Frias, working towards her degree. She expects to graduate in December 2013, but without a loan is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. For Yolanda, it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. 

With this loan, Yolanda plans on purchasing her much-needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Yolanda feels she will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. In addition to her responsibilities at school, Yolanda currently works 30 hours a week as an office administrator and earns $3 a day. With a degree in systems engineering, she expects to earn $10 a day. 

With two older siblings attending college already, Yolanda is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks.

loans.name: Novelinda

texts.en: Novelinda is 36 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Novelinda has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming coconuts and buying and selling dried coconut meat. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Martha Feliza

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 30 de Agosto se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 2 hijos de 7 y 3 años, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo trabaja con ella.

Doña Martha es una muy buena esposa que junto a su esposo se dedican a la preparación y venta de ceviche de camarón y pescado,  todos los días abren su local el cual está ubicado en su casa, a pesar de que su negocio no tiene mucho tiempo su clientela es muy buena y esto se debe a la sazón con la que prepara este delicioso plato   que es la delicia de sus clientes quienes salen muy satisfechos.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pescado, sodas y otros víveres necesarios para preparar el ceviche. Lleva un año en el Banco Comunal  y le gusta porque con el primer crédito ella empezó su negocio. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante con la bendición de Dios.
texts.en:
The 30 de Agosto communal bank meets every 15 days in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. This area is known for its commerce, its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo festivals, and the joy of its people.

This is where Señora Martha lives. She is 36 years old, married, with 2 children aged 7 and 3. The oldest attends school. Her husband works with her. Doña Martha is a very good wife who, together with her husband, prepares and sells shrimp and fish ceviche. Every day they open their shop, which is located in their house. Despite that their business is quite new, they have a very good clientele thanks to the time they spend preparing this delicious dish, which is the delight of their clients who leave very satisfied.

She will use this loan to purchase fish, soda, and other groceries necessary to prepare the ceviche. She has been a member of the communal bank for a year and she likes it because with the first loan, she started her business. Her dream is to get ahead with God's blessing.

loans.use: to purchase fish, soda, and other groceries.

loans.name: Gilberta

texts.en:
Gilberta is 34 years old and married with six children. With five children in school, Gilberta works very hard to provide for them.

Gilberta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Gilberta has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items, such as sugar, biscuits, bread and other groceries. 

In the future, Gilberta would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Veronika

texts.en: Veronika is a 28-year-old woman who is married with five children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She is requesting this loan to help her make improvements to her house, so her family can have better living conditions. Veronika will use the loan to buy cement and iron roofing. She will also use part of her loan to buy barbed wire, a pick axe, a spade, a rake and chemicals and to pay her children's school fees. Veronika joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services. With the profits from her business, Veronika hopes to satisfy her family's everyday needs and wants.

loans.use: to buy cement and iron roofing to make improvements to her house and also to buy barbed wire, a pick axe, a spade, a rake and chemicals, and to pay school fees

loans.name: Marie Jeanne

texts.fr: Marie Jeanne est une femme âgée de 37 ans mariée et mère de 02 enfants dont un scolarisé. Elle est commerçante dans un quartier de la capitale où elle exerce cette activité depuis 06 ans .Sa gentillesse  envers son entourage lui a  fait accroître une clientèle au fil du temps. La petitesse de son capital ne lui permet plus les exigences de sa clientèle. Elle sollicite à nouveau pour un crédit qui lui permettra d'accroître son stiock de marchandises afin d'équilibrer l'offre et la demande. Les bénéfices générés l'aideront à étendre son activité et améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Marie Jeanne is a 37-year-old woman who is married and the mother of two children, one of whom attends school. Marie Jeanne is a shopkeeper in a neighborhood of the capital, where she has been running her business for six years. Her kindness to those around her has won her steady customer growth over time. The small size of her working capital no longer allows her to meet customer demand.

Marie Jeanne is seeking a new loan that will allow her to increase her stock of merchandise in order to stabilize supply and demand. The profits generated will help her to expand her business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Lugen

texts.en:
Lugen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Lugen has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell. In the future, Lugen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 35 years old and lives in Cartagena Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children. 

Amelita has a mini grocery store, and she has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan to purchase assorted biscuits and candies, a gallon of cooking oil, and a sack of sugar.

Amelita is a newly member of PMPC. In the future, Amelita hopes to succeed in her business.

loans.use: to purchase assorted biscuits and candies, a gallon of cooking oil, and a sack of sugar

location.town: Plaridel - Cartagena Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Lourdesita

texts.en:
Lourdesita is married with 3 children. She is 57 years old and lives in Lupagan, Clarin, Philippines.

To earn a living, Lourdesita  has a motorcycle business. She has had this business for 15 years, and each month she earns approximately PHP 3,000. 

Lourdesita has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, she hopes to supplement her family's income and to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of the borrower's motorcab

loans.name: Bathuu

texts.en: Mr. Bathuu is 41 years old lives with his wife and children in a ger, the traditional nomadic yurt, in Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife, Mongontulga, works at a local traditional shoe manufacturing company and is very good at it. Mongontulga has also started producing handmade traditional shoes at home by customers' order. Now she has received an order for 15 pairs, and in order to meet the order on time, she has requested a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase leather, soles and other supplies from Ulaanbaatar city to produce shoes for her clients. Bathuu has been supportive of his wife's efforts to increase the family income.

loans.use: to purchase leather, soles and other supplies for his wife to produce shoes for her clients

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is married with four children. Her husband is a farmer, while she runs a sari sari (variety) store to earn a living. She also has a part-time job providing manicures and pedicures. In 13 years of doing this, she was able to support the needs of her children's primary education. Thinking that in this service, she can earn profit to save for the future education of her children, she borrowed a loan of 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) from GDMPC microcredit to buy a new manicure set to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a new manicure set.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with four children. Josephine is 50 years old and lives in Maikay, Tudela, Philippines.

Josephine is a farmer and grows sweet peppers to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers and other insect controls such as bug spay, spider and insect traps, 3-in-1 garden spray, etc.

Josephine has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Josephine hopes to save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other insect controls such as bug spay, spider and insect traps, 3-in-1 garden spray, etc.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 45 years old and lives in Cartagena Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children.
 
Mercedita has a hog-raising business and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to pay for feeds and vitamins.

Mercedita is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Mercedita hopes to have success in her business.

loans.use: to pay for feeds and vitamins.

location.town: Plaridel - Cartagena Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is married with two children. Chona is 47 years old and lives in Gata Daku, Clarin, Philippines.

Chona sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy additional goods to sell such as sweets, chocolates, candies, biscuits, noodles, canned goods, junk foods, drinks, etc.

Chona has been a member of PMPC for five months. In the future, Chona hope to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell such as sweets, chocolates, candies, biscuits, noodles, canned goods, junk foods, drinks, etc.

location.town: Tudela-Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mind

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 25 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which has the highest production of rubber in Liberia. She is single and has a 5-year-old child who lives at home and goes to school. For four years now she has been selling fish in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this trade from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. She hopes to build a house and educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Rubie

texts.en: Rubie, a 52-year-old married woman with three children, resides in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. After losing her capital in a retail store, Rubie was determined to find a way to provide for her family. She borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC to buy grocery goods for sale. She helped her husband to make money and be able to give comfort to the family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods for sale.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is a 36-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses; from time to time, it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. But this time the maintenance costs will exceed his savings. For this reason, Lubna has applied for a loan for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and do some needed engine maintenance for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service for his passengers. 

Lubna is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business. Lubna is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of the rickshaw.

loans.name: Kpanah

texts.en:
Forty-eight-year-old Kpanah is a businesswoman from Liberia. Precisely, she lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which has the highest production of rubber plantations in Liberia. She is married with seven children between 10 and 28 years old; only three live at home and are in school. 

She has been selling salt, rice, oil, peppers, vita, onions and peanuts in the local market for 15 years now. She started this business with 500 LD (Liberian dollars) given to her by her mother and learned this trade from her. She is requesting a loan to purchase more salt, rice, oil, peppers, vita, onions and peanuts for her business. Her future plans are to educate all her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more salt, rice, oil, peppers, vita, onions and peanuts for her business.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat belongs to an ultra poor family, living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

At the time she was newly married, her husband did not have any occupation to afford the responsibility of a single family. Then she sold her golden jewelry for getting some cash so that her husband could start a blacksmith business. He has been providing services for making iron doors, windows and broken accessories with the help of a welder. A few days ago, his welding tool became out of order due to heating, and he wants to buy a new one.

Therefore, Nusrat requested a loan from BRAC, which is an active field partner of Kiva, so that her husband would be able to buy the welder for manufacturing.  

Nusrat says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy welding tool for manufacturing.

loans.name: Alassane

texts.fr: Monsieur Alassane est un homme âgé de 32ans qui est marié et père de famille. Il évolue dans l'achat et la vente de bétails. Il a une expérience de plus de 5ans dans ce activité, Alassane demande ce crédit d'un montant de 500000F pour aller dans les marchés hebdomadaires acheter du bétails et revenir les revendre a ses clients. Il gère les charges familiales quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Il commence sa journée à 6h du matin pour la terminer à 19h du soir. A l'avenir Alassane voudrait grâce à l'aide des crédits augmenter et diversifier son cheptel enfin de pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa petite famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Alassane is a 32-year-old man who is married and a father. He is active in the buying and selling of cattle, and has more than 5 years' experience in this business.

Alassane requested a credit loan in the amount of 500,000 francs to go to the weekly markets to buy cattle and return later and resell them to his customers. He manages the daily family expenses and tuition for his children. He starts his day at 6 am to finish at 7 pm in the evening.

With the help of credit loans, Alassane would like in the future to expand and diversify his herd, so he can increase his income and improve the living conditions of his small family.

loans.use: Buy sheep and goats for resale

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 56 years old, married and has nine children; three of her children are in school. 

Julia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Julia requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Julia has been raising pigs for 30 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Julia would like to save money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sunset School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Muhammed. He is the director of Sunset Junior School, a mixed sex Nursery & Primary School in the Peri-urban area of Kawanda in Kampala with 680 students. Sunset Junior School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school is currently using a water bucket filter, which provides just 20 litres of water. This is not sufficient to meet all of the school’s needs and means that the students have to bring their own water to school, which many cannot afford. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the pupils every day. An example of the type of water system which will be purchased with this loan is displayed in the photo above

Sunset Junior School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Muhammed ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Kazo School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Sheikh Twaha. He is the head teacher of Kazo Islamic Centre Nursery & Primary School, a mixed sex school in the Peri-urban area of Kazo in Kampala with 400 students. Kazo Islamic Centre has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Having a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the pupils every day. An example of the type of water system which will be purchased with this loan is displayed in the photo above.

Kazo Islamic Centre will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Sheikh Twaha ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Sari Pertami Group

texts.en:
To increase the number of pigs they can purchase, the Sari Pertami group applied for a loan with increased amounts. They will use the extra cash to buy superior quality piglets and feed.
Evaluating her previous sales, Ni Ketut used the loan to buy sow. Her business as a piglet seller has so far been successful and she has earned a satisfactory profit. She hopes to sell piglets not only in her village, but in the surrounding areas as well. To do this, she has been advertising her piglets around the neighboring villages. She hopes her efforts will pay off.

loans.use: To purchase a sow

loans.name: Tauleva

texts.en:
Tauleva is a 39 year old married woman with 7 children. 
She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for 4 years. Tauleva has requested a loan to buy chemicals, weed spray, a wheelbarrow, a spade and an ax. 
She has been a member of SBPD since 2009. With her profits,Tauleva will support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weedspray, a wheelbarrow, a spade and an ax

loans.name: Munkhzul

texts.en: Mrs. Munkhzul is 33 years old and lives with her two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in an old brick house on a plot of land. Her husband went to Korea on a three year employment contract in October, 2012. She has been working as an assistant cook at a kindergarten for the last two years. Her elder daughter goes to high school while her youngest attends kindergarten. This summer, she began to renovate their house but due to lack of finances, she couldn't finish it in time. So she is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam. After making repair and insulation using those materials, her family will be able to live in a comfortable and warm place without worrying about the upcoming winter. Also, the family will burn less coal for heating because of insulated walls thus, releasing less pollution into the atmosphere.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 39 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more canned goods, milk, sugar, and coffee to sell

Nelia has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from food vending.  Nelia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, milk, sugar, and coffee to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 57 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Erlinda has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from weaving.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Benkadi (Parler La Même Voie) Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi est un regroupement de femmes du quartier  Hamdallaye Extension  de la ville de Koutiala qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 28 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les fruits et légumes, les cosmétiques et divers etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt de groupe. 
Maïmouna est un membre du groupe assise  deuxième personne de la gauche vers la droite.   Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des bidons d’huile. Elle se procure de ces produits à Koutiala. Elle vend de huile en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Benkadi comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60 000  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Maïmouna  compte réaliser  65 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group of women from the Hamdallaye Extension neighborhood in the city of Koutiala who live in large traditional families. They average 28 years of age, are married and have at least three children. This group of women sells various products such as fruit, vegetables, cosmetics and others.

To increase the size of their operations, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their first group loan.

Maïmouna is a group member who is the second person sitting from left to right. She plans to use the loan to buy cans of oil. She gets her supplies from Koutiala. She then retails the oil for cash at home and at the market to a diversified clientele.

While other members of the Benkadi group expect to achieve an average profit of 60,000 each during this loan cycle, Ms. Maïmouna expects to achieve 65,000 CFA francs.

In addition to repaying the loans, they use some of the income to meet personal expenses and increase their stock-in-trade.

loans.use: buy cooking oil

loans.name: Peresite

texts.en:
Peresite is 48 years old and married with 5 children. 
She has a small garden where she grows taro, cabbages, cucumbers and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. Peresite needs a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, an ax, a spade, chemicals and bush knives for her farm.
She has been a member of SPBD since 2001. Peresite will use the profits from her sales to save for her children's school fees and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, an ax, a spade, chemicals and bush knives for her farm

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi est un regroupement des femmes de Koutiala  quartier Hamdallaye qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans, sont mariées et en moyenne 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les habits et chaussures, de la restauration, les produits cosmétiques et divers etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe. 
Rokia  est un membre du groupe Benkadi assise au bout  avec  son bébé.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des chaussures des habits avec les grossistes. Elle se procure de ces habits à Koutiala. Elle vend ces habits en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Benkadi comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen 77000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Rokia  compte réaliser  80 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group of women from the Hamdallaye neighborhood of Koutiala who are well acquainted and live in large traditional families. They average 30 years of age, are married and have at least three children. This group of women retails various products such as clothing and shoewear, food preparations, cosmetics and others.

To increase the size of their business activities, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their third group loan.

Rokia is the Benkadi group member who sitting at the end holding a baby. She plans to use the loan to buy shoes and clothes from wholesalers. She gets her clothes from Koutiala. She then retails the clothes for cash, at home and at the market, to a diversified clientele.

Whereas other members of the Benkadi group expect to achieve an average profit of 77,000 CFA francs each during this loan cycle, Ms. Rokia expects to achieve 80,000 CFA francs.

In addition to repaying the loans they use some of the income to meet personal expenses and increase their stock-in-trade.

loans.use: buy various items

loans.name: Yenny Adelina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 30 de Agosto se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Yenny, tiene 32 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 2 hijos de 18  y 4 años, el  mayor estudia en universidad y el más pequeño en jardín de infantes. Su marido es comerciante.

Doña Yenny es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para ayudarle a su marido, el se dedica  al comercio, vende carcasas, accesorios y repuestos de teléfonos celulares para lo cual se desplaza hasta Manta a vender sus productos, ella por su parte también en sus ratos libres se dedica a la venta de bisutería pero solo por su localidad, ella deja  a crédito y cobra por semanas. Trabajan todos los días el  casi todo el día mientras que ella solo cuando está desocupada. Llevan más de 10 años dedicados a esta actividad la cual les permite salir adelante y que a sus hijos no les falte nada.
 
Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar bisutería, accesorios, carcasas y repuestos para teléfonos celulares.  Lleva 3 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener un local.
texts.en:
The communal bank '30 de Agosto' (30 August) get together every fifteen days at the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo.  The place is well known for being a very commercial area, as well as for its traditional festivals of 'San Pedro' and 'San Pablo' and the cheerfulness of its people.

This is where Yenny, a 32-year-old woman, lives.  She lives with her husband who she has two children with, one 18 and the other 4.  The eldest studies at university and the youngest is at kindergarten.  Her husband is a trader.

Yenny is a very good wife who is taking the loan to help her husband.  He works as a trader and sells cases, accessories and spare parts for cell phones, for which he travels all the way to Manta to sell his products.  In her free time Yenny also sells costume jewelery, but only in her area.  She sells on credit and collects payment every week.  They both work every day.  He works almost all the day while she works only when she is not busy.  They have been working for more than ten years in this field, which allows them to get ahead and make sure that their children have everything they need.

She will use this loan to buy costume jewelery, accessories, and cases and spare parts for cell phones.  She has been in the communal bank for 3 loan cycles and she likes it because the loans help her to finance her business.  Her dream is to have her own shop.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelery, accessories, and cases and spare parts for cell phones.

loans.name: Rosa Elvia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 30 de Agosto se reúne en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, una de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su esposo trabaja para el Estado. 

Doña Rosa con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y calzado pero por catálogos, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene unas vitrinas. Trabaja todos los días ya que sale y también vende en su casa, ella  deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y calzado. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener un gran local en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The communal bank "30 de Agosto" meets in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo.  It is a very commercial place known for its traditional Saint Peter and Saint Paul festivities and for the cheerfulness of its people. 

This is where Rosa, 51, lives.  She is married and has three adult children, one of whom still lives at home.  Her husband works for the state.

In order to earn her own income and help the household economy, Rosa sells all kinds of clothing and shoes by catalogue.  She sells door-to-door and also from home where she has display cases.  She works every day and sells on credit, collecting payment every 15 days.  When she needs to buy merchandise she goes to Guayaquil.  She has been in business for five years and things are going well for her.

This loan will allow her to buy more goods such as pants, blouses, t-shirts and shoes.  She has been a member of the communal bank since its beginnings and she  likes it because the loans allow her to finance her business.

Her goal is to have a large shop in the city center.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and shoes.

loans.name: Luafulu

texts.en: Luafulu is 61 years old and married with five children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of goods. She has been doing this for many years. Luafulu needs a loan to buy snacks, soft drinks, a fridge and a cash register. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2007 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft drinks, a fridge and a cash register

loans.name: Glady Mercedes

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 30 de Agosto se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Glady, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 22, 17, 12 y 5 años, los tres menores estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante. 

Doña Glady es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para ayudarle a su marido el cual se dedica  al comercio, el vende ropa de todo tipo, sabanas, edredones, ollas y varios productos más, su marido se desplaza  a varias ciudades del Oriente Ecuatoriano lugares donde se queda tres semanas y una vez que vende lo que ha llevado regresa a su hogar para descansar una semana y volver a viajar, esta forma de ventas es muy dura para ella y su familia pero  es la única forma que él tiene para llevar el pan diario a su mesa. Lleva más de 20 años dedicado a esta actividad la cual les permite salir adelante honradamente.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar sabanas, edredones, ollas, etc. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque así ella puede ayudarle a su marido. 

Su sueño es tener un local para que su marido no viaje más.
texts.en:
