The communal bank "30 de Agosto" meets in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. It is a very commercial place known for its traditional Saint Peter and Saint Paul festivities and for the cheerfulness of its people.

This is where Gladys, 43, lives.  She is married and has four children, ages 22, 17, 12 and five.  The three youngest go to school and her husband is a merchant.

Gladys is a good wife and is requesting the loan to help her husband who is a merchant.  He sells all kinds of clothing, sheets, comforters, pots and pans and other products.  He travels to different cities in eastern Ecuador where he spends three weeks at a time.  Once he sells all his merchandise he returns home to relax for a week and then goes out again.  This type of work is very hard on Gladys and the family but it is the only source of income they have.  Her husband has been in this business for over 20 years and it has allowed them to get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy sheets, comforters, pots and pans, etc.  Gladys has been a member of the communal bank for three loan cycles and she likes the fact that is is able to help her husband this way.

Her goal is to open a shop so her husband will not have to travel any more.

loans.use: To buy sheets, comforters, pots and pans, etc.

loans.name: Urwego Group

texts.fr:
Zéphirin fait partie du groupe  Urwego  et  habite à Bujumbura. C’est un célibataire de 30 ans.  

Il fait le commerce des sacs en plastique depuis  15 ans. 

Il est à son  onzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  200 sacs en plastique à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait  avoir  une maison propre à lui.
texts.en:
Zéphirin is part of the Urwego group and lives in Bujumbura. He is a single 30-year-old man.

He has been retailing plastic bags for the past 15 years.

This is his eleventh credit loan with Turame. With the KIVA credit he obtains, he will increase his capital and buy 200 plastic bags for resale, to earn more.

In coming years, he would like to have his own house.

loans.use: increase his capital and buy 200 plastic bags for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
This is Candelaria. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to buy different snacks needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy different snacks needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Candelaria hopes for a continuous growth in her business and dreams of being happy and content. She attends the weekly fellowship* wherein she is inspired to share her weekly life experiences with her co-fellowship members and she learns more about the importance of having quality time with God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for different snacks needed in her business.

loans.name: Vuka Group

texts.fr:
Viola fait partie du groupe  Vuka et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 32 ans et est mariée à Jules, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants  âgés de 1 à 9 ans, dont  2 étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de madriers et des clous,…depuis 4 ans. 

Elle est à son  troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  200 madriers, 100 planches et 100 chevrons  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait  construire une maison sur sa parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Viola is part of the Vuka group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 32 years old and is married to Jules, a merchant. Together they have three children aged from one to nine years, of whom two are in school.

She has been trading planks and nails for the past four years.

This is her third credit loan with Turame. With the KIVA credit she obtains, she will increase her capital and buy 200 planks, 100 boards and 100 rafters for resale, to earn more.

In coming years, she would like to build a house on her land-plot and have her children pursue their education.

loans.use: increase her capital and buy 200 planks, 100 boards and 100 rafters for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana tiene 23 años, vive con sus padres, es soltera y tiene una hermana menor, su familia es muy trabajadora, que con mucho sacrificio está saliendo adelante.
Ella cursa el Tercer Año de la carrera de Licenciatura en Relaciones Internacionales. Actualmente ella tiene un negocio que con la ayuda de sus padres está llevando adelante, su familia la apoya en todo. Su objetivo es poder terminar su carrera y poder ejercer en algunos de los Puertos privados que se encuentran  instalados en su comunidad.
Ella pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, y así seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Diana, 23, lives with her parents.  She is single and has a younger daughter.  Her family works very hard and through much sacrifice is getting ahead.  Diana is in her third year of International Relations at the university.  She runs a business with the help of her parents who support her in everything.  Her goal is to finish her degree and work in one of the private ports in her community.

She is requesting a loan to pay university costs so she can continue her education.

loans.use: To pay higher educations costs.

loans.name: Consuelo Margarita

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 30 de Agosto se reúne en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Consuelo, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 12 años que estudia en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante. 

Doña Consuelo es una muy buena esposa que para ayudarle a su esposo realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en su negocio, el se dedica a la venta de productos para el hogar, vende planchas, platos, ollas, licuadoras, entre otros productos para lo cual todos los días se desplaza a otras ciudades en especial a los campos lugares donde más ventas realiza, el deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, lleva más de 20 años dedicado a este tipo de negocio  con lo cual ha sacado adelante a su familia. 

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar planchas, licuadoras, ollas, platos, etc. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta porque con los créditos ella le ayuda a su esposo. 

Su sueño es tener un local en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The communal bank "30 de Agosto" meets in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. It is a very commercial place known for its traditional Saint Peter and Saint Paul festivities and for the cheerfulness of its people.

This is where Consuelo, 43, lives.  She is married and has a 12-year-old son who attends school.  Her husband is a merchant.

Consuelo is a good wife who is requesting the loan to help her husband in his business.  He sells household products such as irons, dishes, pots and pans, juicers and other products.  Every day he travels to other cities, especially to the rural areas where sales volume is highest.  He sells on a credit basis and collects payment every eight days.  For over 20 years he has earned a living this way to provide for his family.

This loan will be used to buy irons, juicers, pots and pans, dishes, etc.  Consuelo has been a member of the communal bank since its beginnings and she likes the fact that she is able to obtain loans to to help her husband.

Her goal is to open a shop in the city center.

loans.use: To buy irons, juicers, pots and pans, dishes, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, y dice que su sueño es recibirme y ser alguien importante en la vida, poder trabajar bien, así para poder ayudarles a sus padres que gracias a su ayuda esta pudiendo estudiar y estar cerca de su sueño de ser una profesional reconocida.
Ella pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus gastos de la universidad, y sus cuotas, y así seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Maria is from the city of Coronel Oviedo and is studying to be a nurse.  Her dream is to graduate and become someone important in life so she can work and help her parents.  Thanks to them she was able to continue studying and get closer to her goal of becoming a renowned professional.

She is requesting a loan to pay for her university costs and continue with her education.

loans.use: To pay higher education costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and galvanized sheet metal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, and sheet metal.

loans.name: Sabaly (Le Pardon) Group

texts.fr:
Sabaly est un regroupement de femmes de Medina Coura de Koutiala qui   vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 29 ans, sont mariées et au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les fruits et légumes, les cosmétiques, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt de groupe. 
Djeneba  est un membre du groupe assise de la  droite  vers la gauche, elle  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des articles divers :pagnes et des ustensiles de cuisine de fabrication locale ses articles. Elle se procure de ces articles à Koutiala et effectue ses ventes en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Sabaly comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 65 000  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Djeneba  compte réaliser  70 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Sabaly is a group of women from Medina Coura in Koutiala, who live in large traditional families. They average 29 years of age, are married and have at least three children each.

This group of women buy and sell a variety of products such as fruit and vegetables, cosmetics, etc. In order to expand their activities, the members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. They are on their first group loan.

Djeneba, who is a member of this group, is sitting on the far right of the photo. She is planning on using her loan to buy various products: "pagnes" (pieces of highly decorative fabric) and kitchen utensils, all manufactured locally. She gets her products in Koutiala and sells on a retail basis and for cash, from home and at the market, to a diverse customer base.

While the other members of the Sabaly group expect to make an average of 65,000FCFA each during the course of the cycle, Djeneba expects to make 70,000FCFA.

They will use their income to repay their loans but also to cover general expenses and expand their businesses.

loans.use: to buy various products.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Soutoura est un regroupement de femmes de Hamdallaye de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 6 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels du charbons de bois, les fruits et légumes, divers etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt de groupe. 
Djeneba, 2 eme assise  de la  gauche vers la droite, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter au fur et à mesure des légumes de tous genres. Elle se procure de ces aliments à Koutiala avec les jardiniers. Elle vend ses légumes en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Soutoura comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 62 000  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Djeneba  compte réaliser  65 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Soutoura is a group of women from Hamdallaye in the town of Koutiala. They know each other well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They average 44 years of age, are married and have at least six children each.

This group of women buy and sell a variety of products such as charcoal, fruit and vegetables.

In order to expand their businesses, the members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. They are on their first group loan.

Djeneba, who is sitting second from the left on the photo, is planning to use her loan gradually to buy vegetables of all sorts. She gets her food in Koutiala from gardeners. She sells her vegetables on a retail basis for cash, from her home and at the market, to a diverse customer base.

While the other members of the Soutoura group expect to make an average profit of 62,000FCFA each during the course of the cylce, Djeneba expects to make 65,000FCFA.

They will use their income to repay their loans, as well as to cover their personal expenses and expand their businesses.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Amadou est un habitué du Guichet, il est marié et père de famille. Agé de 32ans il évolue dans la vente de bétail et a une expérience de 7ans dans ce activité. Il commence sa journée à 6h du matin pour la terminer à 19h du soir. Amadou sollicite ce montant pour augmenter son fond de commerce afin de pouvoir diversifier son cheptel et satisfaire sa clientèle. Monsieur Amadou gère les charges des dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants; a l'avenir il aimerait ouvrir une grande ferme ainsi il va augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Amadou is a regular at his local branch of UIMCEC. He is 32 years old and married with children. 

He is developing his cattle-selling business and has seven years experience in this area. He begins work at 6am and finishes at 7pm. 

Amadou is requesting this loan to build up his business. He would like to diversify his livestock and satisfy his customers. 

Amadou manages his family’s daily expenses and his children’s school fees. In the future he would like to open a large farm to increase his income and improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cattle to resell.

loans.name: Coumba Demba

texts.fr: Madame Coumba est une femme mariée et mère de famille qui est âgée de 44ans. Elle habite à coté du guichet et vient souvent pour y épargner son argent. Coumba évolue dans le commerce de tissus, chaussures et des pochettes qu'elle revende à ses clients. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h. Elle sollicite ce crédit d'un montant de 100000 pour renforcer son fond de commerce et augmenter son stock de marchandises. Elle aide aussi son mari dans la gestion de la dépense journalière. Avec l'aide de l'IMCEC, Coumba souhaite ouvrir un grand magasin au marché central et augmenter ses revenus ainsi elle pourra construire sa maison.
texts.en:
Coumba is 44 years old and married with children. She lives near her local UIMCEC branch and visits it often to save her money. 

Coumba is developing her business, which consists in buying cloth, shoes and bags and reselling them to her customers. She starts her working day at 8am and finishes at 6pm. 

Coumba is requesting this loan of 100,000 francs to build her business and increase her stock. She also helps her husband with daily expenses. With the help of UIMCEC, Coumba would like to open a large shop in the central market and increase her income. Then she would be able to build a house.

loans.use: to buy cloth, shoes and bags to resell.

loans.name: Refuges De Dumas Group

texts.fr:
Cantave est le coordinateur de son groupe Refuge de Dumas. Il est marié mais il a 5 enfants. Cantave habite dans la ville de Dumas d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Cantave a dirigé son business pendant les 7 dernières années. Avant de commencer ce commerce, Il etait a l’ecole. 

Cantave voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat des boeufs. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Des autres membres de les refuge ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et du poisson. Cantave dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant. Il dit que ses buts principals sont l’augmantation du bussiness. Son rêve est l’achat d’une camion pour transporter les animaux.
texts.en:
Cantave is the coordinator of his group, “Refuges de Dumas”. He is married with five children. 

Cantave lives in the town of Dumas in Haiti, where electricity is rarely available and the water supply extremely limited. He has been managing his business for seven years, and before starting this business he was in school. 

Cantave would like to use this loan to purchase cattle. He hopes that this loan will help him grow his business. Other members of the Refuges group also need loans for their businesses, which include activities such as selling charcoal, rice and fish. 

Cantave says that his main challenge is the lack of regular customers. He says that his principal aim is to expand his business and his dream is to buy a truck to transport the animals.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Lassana

texts.fr:
Monsieur Lassana, un homme âgé de 39 ans, s’active dans le commerce de céréales depuis maintenant 10 ans. Il habite dans un village situé à quelques kilomètres de la ville principale. S’étant rendu compte que son capital était très faible, il s’est tourner vers IMCEC pour chercher un appui financier et hausser un peu son fond de roulement. Avec le crédit, il va acheter des céréales, du mil, du mais, de l’arachide pour revendre dans le marché local. Lassana, avec les revenus de son activité, s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de sa famille, constitue une épargne pour s’acheter une maison et améliorer les conditions alimentaires de son foyer. 
Il désire ouvrir un grand magasin de ventes de céréale local et devenir un grand fournisseur pour les petits commerçants débutants.
texts.en:
Lassana is 39 years old. He has been involved in the cereals business for ten years now and lives in a village a few kilometres from the main town. 

Due to his lack of capital, he went to UIMCEC for financial support and to increase his working capital a little. With this loan, he will buy cereals, millet, maize and ground nuts to resell at the local market. 

With the revenue from his business, Lassana will pay his family’s daily expenses, build up savings to buy a house and provide better food for his household. 

Lassana would like to open a large cereals shop in the local area and become a major supplier for new small businesses.

loans.use: to buy cereals, millet, ground nuts and maize to resell at the market.

loans.name: Refferances De Bordemer 4, 5 & 6 Group

texts.fr:
Bazile est le coordinateur de son groupe Les Refferances de Bordemer 4, 5 & 6. Il est un commercant et habite dans la région DE BOR DE MER où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. 

Bazile voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans les divers produit. Il va acheter des chaussures, vêtements, cosmétiques, etc. Bazile espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business les Produit Divers. Des autres membres militant ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme charbon, cosmetiques, chaussures, etc.

 Bazile dit que les défis principal c'est devenus une grande commerçante. Bazile dit que son but principal et son rêve c'est possède un gros business avec son fond et par la grâce de Dieu.
texts.en:
Bazile is the coordinator for his group, “Les Refferances de Bordemer 4, 5 & 6. He is a trader and lives in the region of Bord-de-Mer, where electricity is rarely available and the water supply extremely limited. 

He would like to use this loan to invest in general goods. He will buy shoes, clothes, cosmetics, etc. 

Bazile hopes that this loan will help him grow his business in general goods. Other members require loans for businesses selling items such as charcoal, cosmetics, shoes, etc.

Bazile says that his main challenge is to become a top businessman. He says that his main aim and his dream is to build a large business with his funds and by the grace of God.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothing, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Babacar âgé de 53 ans s’active dans la vente de pièces détachées de moto depuis maintenant 2 ans. Il possède une cantine dans la gare routière et il reçoit une affluence grâce au bon emplacement de son domaine d’activité. Babacar est marié et père de famille.
Il vient solliciter pour la première fois un prêt a l’IMCEC pour acheter des pièces détachées de motos.
Le bénéfice récolté lui servira à nourrir sa famille et à réaliser peut être un jour son rêve, celui d’avoir un grand entrepôt de pièces détachées.
texts.en:
Babacar is 53 years old and has been selling spare parts for motorcycles for two years. He has a small shop at the bus station where he serves a large number of customers thanks to the good location of his business. 

Babacar is married and has a family. He is requesting his first loan from UIMCEC to buy spare parts for motorcycles.

He will use the revenue from his business to feed his family, and perhaps one day achieve his dream, which is to run a large warehouse of spare parts.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycles.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shoes, women's accessories, clothing, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Yaneth Esmeralda

texts.es: Yaneth Esmeralda de treinta y ocho años de edad vive junto a sus tres hijos menores de edad y su padre en casa propia. Ella se dedica a los servicios varios, lava ajeno, limpia una escuela y además posee un empleo en un cafetín, trabaja día y noche para ganarse el sustento diario; Yaneth es una mujer luchadora y muy trabajadora, siempre está buscando buenas oportunidades que le ayuden a salir adelante, su vivienda desde hace algún tiempo necesita un muro perimetral pues quiere mantener segura su casa y a los miembros que habitan en ella, necesita varios materiales pero por sus bajos recursos económicos no puede costear el gasto, por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar cemento, hierro, arena, grava, tubo y por supuesto el pago de mano de obra. Yaneth Esmeralda se siente muy agradecida con la ayuda y se compromete a cancelar toda la deuda.
texts.en: Yaneth Esmeralda, who is 38, lives in her own home along with her 3 grown up-children and her father.  She offers a range of services - washing other people's clothes and cleaning a school, and she also works in a small café.  She works day and night to earn a living.  Yaneth is a determined and very hardworking woman who is always on the lookout for good opportunities to make progress.  For some time now, her house has needed a perimeter wall and, as she wants to keep her home and those live in it secure, she needs various materials to build one.  Unfortunately, because her earnings are low, she cannot afford it and that is why she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to buy cement, iron, sand, gravel, pipes and, of course, pay the workmen.  Yaneth Esmeralda is extremely grateful for the help and guarantees that she will repay her debt.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, sand, gravel, pipes and pay the workmen

loans.name: Kotognogotala (L’Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Kotognogotala est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Hamdallaye Extension qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 24 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels le bois de chauffe, les fruits et légumes, les tissus, les condiments, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt de groupe. 
Sali  est un membre du groupe Kotognogotala debout  avec un short  jaune devant du bois qu’elle vend.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des chargements de bois. Elle se procure de ces bois dans les villages de Koutiala Beleso et Welinguena. Elle vend du bois en détail et au comptant à la maison et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Kotognogotala comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen  de 62 500  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Sali compte réaliser  65 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Kotognogotala is a group of women from the Hamdallaye Extension neighbourhood. They know each other well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They are married, have an average age of 24 and have at least three children.

This group of women trade various items such as firewood, fruit and vegetables, cloth, condiments, etc. 

To increase the size of their businesses, the members have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan programme. This is the first loan for the group. 

Sali is a member of the Kotognogotala group. She is pictured in a yellow top standing in from of the wood she sells.  

Sali will use her loan to buy bundles of wood. She gets her supply of wood from the villages of Koutiala Beleso and Welinguena. She sells the wood from home to individuals for cash and has a diverse clientele. 

While the other members of the Kotognogotala group are hoping to make an average of 62 500 francs during the loan cycle, Sali is hoping to make 65 000 CFA francs. 

In addition to repaying the loan, the group members will use part of their income to meet personal expenses and grow their businesses.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Kokadje Group

texts.fr:
Kokadje est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Koulikoro de la ville de Koutiala qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, sont mariées et ont en moyenne 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels les fruits et légumes, les habits, de la restauration, des condiments,  etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur septième prêt de groupe. 
Mariam assise avec son un enfant et ses ingrédients de restauration, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des condiments et céréales. Elle se procure de ces articles à Koutiala. Elle vend de la nourriture bien cuite au comptant et à une clientèle diverse. 
Mariam compte réaliser  120 000FCFA de bénéfice au cours de cycle.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Kokadje is a group of women from the Koulikoro neighbourhood in Koutiala who live in large traditional families. They are married, have an average age of 35 and an average of five children.

This group of women are involved in various businesses, selling fruit and vegetables, clothing, condiments, or running a catering business, for example. 

To increase the size of their businesses, the members have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan programme. This is the seventh loan for the group. 

Mariam, pictured sitting with her child and some ingredients for her catering business, is intending to use her loan to buy condiments and cereals. She buys her supplies in Koutiala and sells good food to a wide range of customers. Mariam is hoping to make 120 000 CFA francs during the loan cycle. 

In addition to repaying the loan, the group members will use part of their income to meet personal expenses and grow their businesses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for catering.

loans.name: Amad

texts.en: Amad is a 22-year-old single young man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He sells mobile phone accessories, recharge cards and mobile phones to his customers. He has been able to expand his business from his first loan. Amad is a hardworking man who attracts many customers. He would like to increase his profits, so he has applied for a youth loan of 130,000 YER from AMB Bank. He will use the loan to purchase mobile recharge cards and phone accessories to sell to his customers. Amad hopes to be a successful merchant in order to be able to expand his store and get married.

loans.use: to purchase mobile recharge cards and phone accessories to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Kwt Sawe Permata Indah Group

texts.en:
The KWT Sawe Permata Indah group sells agricultural products, and they now wish to develop their business by raising pigs.

Agung Ayu is the group leader who would like the loan to purchase piglets, cages and feed. She would like to run this pig-raising business on the side, in addition to her business as an agricultural products seller. She wants to develop her business and income by raising pigs. She hopes her plan can succeed. 

Agung Ayu has a dream to repair her house with the profits she earns. For this reason, she would like to start saving money to realize her dream.
Every month the group has a meeting where they share their business progress and also receive family updates. These activities help to build camaraderie among group members.

loans.use: To purchase piglets, cages and feed.

loans.name: Yoselin

texts.es: Yoselin  de treinta y uno años de edad vive junto a sus tres hijos uno de 2 años, uno de 14 y una niña de 13 años en casa propia. Ella vende en un chalet ubicado en un centro educativo, trabaja todos los días para lograr completar los gastos del hogar; Yoselin es una mujer muy entregada a lo que hace, se siente orgullosa de tener una familia muy unida por eso trata de darles lo mejor, su vivienda necesita de la construcción de un cuarto ya que necesitan más espacio, se levantarán las paredes y se le pondrá techo de lamina; quiere iniciar el trabajo lo más pronto posible porque eso le dará más comodidad a los miembros de la casa, pero no posee de capital suficiente que respalde para cubrir los gastos de materiales por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar lamina galvanizada, cemento, arena, ladrillos, polines y también el pago de la mano de obra. Yoselin está muy contenta con ayuda y se compromete a cancelar los pagos establecidos.
texts.en: Yoselin, who is 31, lives in her own home with her three children: two sons of 2 and 14 and one daughter of 13.  She has a shop which is located in a school and works every day to cover her household expenses.  Yoselin is a very dedicated to what she does. She is proud to have a very close family and so she strives to give them the best she can.  She needs to have an extra room built onto her home as they need more space and this will mean building the walls and putting on a tin roof.  She wants to start the work as soon as possible because that will make things more comfortable for those who live there.  Unfortunately, however, she does not have enough capital to cover the cost of the materials and that is why she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanised steel, cement, sand, bricks, poles and to pay the workmen.  Yoselin is very happy to receive this help and guarantees that she will repay her debt.

loans.use: Galvanised steel, cement, sand, bricks and poles

loans.name: Baatarchuluun

texts.en:
Mr. Baatarchuluun is 41 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in a ger, which is a traditional nomadic tent, in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife, Delger, is also 41 and has run a small traditional shoe-manufacturing business at home for four years. His two daughters, Delgermaa and Amarzaya, are local school students. 

Baatarchuluun started a family business as a cobbler with his wife working at home four years ago. He is now working as a part-time driver at a local company. He is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to enable his wife to restart their family business of shoe manufacturing in another ger next to their own ger on their plot of land. Delger sells her shoes to people in the countryside of the Uvs province and other provinces. The Baatarchuluuns are hardworking and neat people.

loans.use: to restart their family business of shoe manufacturing.

loans.name: Maura Dolores

texts.es: Maura Dolores treinta y tres años de edad vive junto a su hija, sus padres y sus dos hermanos en casa propia. Ella para ganarse el sustento diario vende fruta, tostadas y gaseosas además los fines de semana vende tamales, Maura es una mujer emprendedora, responsable y muy humilde, su vivienda está ubicada en una zona rural y se encuentra deteriorada, necesitan más espacio por eso quiere construir un cuarto, levantar paredes de ladrillo resistente, con un techo de lamina, espera poder realizarlo lo más pronto posible pero no posee de capital suficiente que pueda costear los gastos de materiales por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar cemento, arena, ladrillo de bloque, hierro, lamina galvanizada y mano de obra. Maura  Dolores está muy contenta con la ayuda y asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda.
texts.en: Maura Dolores is an enterprising, responsible and modest woman of 33, who lives in her own home with her daughter, her parents and her two siblings.  To earn her living, she sells fruit, toasted sandwiches and soft drinks and, at weekends, she also sells tamales.  Her house, which is in a rural area, is not in good condition and the family needs more space.  For that reason, she wants to build an extra room which will mean building walls of resistant brick and adding a tin roof.  She hopes to do this as soon as possible but, as she does not have the capital necessary to buy the materials, she is applying to FUSAI  for a loan to buy cement, sand, breezeblocks, iron, galvanised steel and to pay for the work to be done.  Maura Dolores is delighted to receive this help and she guarantees that she will be able to repay her debt.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, breezeblocks, iron, galvanised steel and pay for the work to be done

loans.name: Sigfredo Alexander

texts.es: Sigfredo Alexander de cuarenta y dos años de edad vive junto a sus hijos, dos menores de edad, una niña de 17 años y un niño de 15, también un hijo mayor de edad, habitan casa propia. El es ordenanza de un centro educativo, trabaja diario y se gana el pan de cada dia, también su hijo mayor le ayuda a completar gastos en el hogar, es un hombre emprendedor, dedicado a su trabajo y a su familia, Sigfredo siempre ha buscado en la medida de sus posibilidades darles lo que necesitan por eso se decidió a levantar el techo ya que está muy abajo, desea levantar cuatro hiladas de ladrillo mas, en toda la casa, quiere empezar el trabajo lo más pronto posible pero debido a su condición económica no posee de capital que lo respalde para la compra de los materiales, por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar, ladrillo, polines,  cemento, arena, hierro. Sigfredo Alexander está muy contento con la ayuda y se siente comprometido a cancelar la deuda.
texts.en: Sigfredo Alexander is forty-two years old. He lives with his two children, a 17 year old girl and a 15 year old son, as well as another son who is grown, in a home he owns. He works cleaning an education center. He works every day. His oldest son also helps him pay for the household expenses. He is an enterprising man who is dedicated to his job and his family. Sigfredo has always looked for what he can do to give them what they need. That is why he decided to raise his roof, because it is very low. He wants to put up four more rows of bricks on the whole house. He wants to start the work as soon as possible, but due to his financial condition, he doesn't have the capital to back him up to buy the materials. That is why he is asking FUSAI for a loan that will allow him to buy bricks, poles, cement, sand, and iron rods. Sigfredo Alexander is very happy with the help and he feels committed to paying off the debt.

loans.use: to buy bricks, poles, cement, sand and iron rods.

loans.name: Adja Aby

texts.fr:
Adja Aby âgée de 27 ans, s’active dans le commerce depuis 2 ans.  Elle a démarré sur fond propre avec un capital peu consistant. En ce temps, elle ne connaissait pas encore l’IMCEC et travaillait avec ses propres moyens. Elle était active de 9h du matin à 18h. Elle vient donc solliciter pour la première fois un crédit pour acheter des tissus appelés basin riche et des chaussures pour hommes.
Adja Aby est divorcée et n’a pas d’enfants ce qui fait que les bénéfices acquis sont refinancés dans l’activité d’une part et d’autre part serviront à régler ses besoins personnels quotidiens. 
Elle désire atteindre un niveau plus élevé dans son domaine d’activité et augmenter son capital.
texts.en:
Adja Aby is 27 years old, and has worked in retail for 2 years.  She started trading using her own, limited funds.  At that time, she didn't know about the field partner IMCEC, and worked with her own money.  She worked from 9am until 6pm.  She has recently requested this first loan to buy damask fabric and men's shoes.  

Adja Aby is divorced and has no children, which means that the profit she earns will be reinvested in her business, and used to pay for her personal day-to-day needs.  She wants to improve the level of her business and increase her capital.

loans.use: to buy men's shoes to resell, and fabric.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es la hija mayor de una pareja muy trabajadora, su padre es chofer de un camión transportador de ganado, su madre es ama de casa, tiene 2 hermanos, aspira trabajar como administradora de algún establecimiento agropecuario como profesional en emprendimientos rurales. 
Ella es soltera trabaja y a la noche se va a la facultad le falta poco para terminar la carrera y todavía tiene ganas de seguir estudiando, la carrera que está estudiando es la de administración agropecuaria.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y así estar al día y no tener cuentas que juntar.
texts.en:
Rosa is the oldest daughter of a very hardworking couple. Her father is a driver of a cattle truck and her mother is a housewife. She has 2 brothers and her goal is to work as a manager of an agricultural or livestock business as a rural business professional.   

She is single and works and at night she goes to school. She only has a little bit of time left until she finishes her major and she still wants to keep studying. She is studying agricultural and livestock management. She is asking for this loan to invest in making tuition payments so she can be up to date and not have to pay any bills.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Iuliana

texts.en:
Iuliana is a 46 year old married woman with six children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years.

Iuliana has requested a loan to buy taro crops, chemicals, sprayers, a wheelbarrow and fertilizer.
 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. With her profits, Iuliana hopes to pay for her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy taro crops, chemicals, sprayers, a wheelbarrow and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto es una persona dedicada al estudio en tiempo completo, es un alumno regular de la carrera de medicina en todas las materias sin con muy buenas notas.
Cuenta que viene de una familia humilde pero trabajadora,  y quiere poder llegar a ser un buen profesional ejerciendo su profesión y ayudando a personas que necesiten de atención en su salud. Su mayor aspiración es tener un buen ingreso y una mejor calidad de vida y así también poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de libros para su estudio, ya que los libros de medicina son muy caros, pero son una inversión que valen la pena ya que es parte de una formación fuerte.
texts.en:
Gilberto is a person who studies full time. He is a regular student of medicine and gets good grades in all subjects. He says that he comes from a humble but hardworking family, and he wants to be a good professional, practicing his profession and helping people who need health care. His biggest goal is to  have good income and a better quality of life as well as help his family.

He is asking for this loan to buy text books, since medical books are so expensive. They are an investment that is worth it, since they are part of a strong education.

loans.use: to buy text books.

loans.name: Elza Leticia

texts.es: Elza Leticia de treinta y tres años de edad vive junto a sus dos hijos menores de edad una niña de 4 años, un niño de 12 años y sus padres en casa propia. Ella es empleada de un cafetín recibe un sueldo pequeño pero le ayuda con el sustento diario, sus padres también aportan un poco para completar los gastos del hogar; Elza es una mujer entregada a su labor y a su familia, quiere lo mejor para ellos por eso se decidió realizar algunas modificaciones a la vivienda, quiere construir un baño, ya que solo poseen el de fosa de hoyo y está cubierto con plástico, desean levantar paredes, poner una pila y techo para también para instalar una ducha, espera poder empezar el trabajo lo más pronto posible pero no cuenta con los recursos para poder costear los gastos de materiales por eso solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar cemento, ladrillos, arena, lamina galvanizada. Elza Leticia está muy feliz con la ayuda y se compromete a cancelar en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Elza Leticia, who is 33, lives in her own home along with her two children (a girl of 4 and a boy of 12) and her parents.  She works in a small café for which she receives a small wage which, along with a contribution from her parents, covers the household expenses.  Elza is a woman who is dedicated to her work and her family and, as she is keen to do the bet she can for them, she decided to have some work done on the house.  She wants to install a bathroom, as all they currently have is a hole in the ground with a plastic covering.  They want to build walls, put in supports and a roof so they can install a shower.  She hopes to begin the work as soon as possible, but she cannot afford the cost of the materials and so she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to buy cement, bricks, sand and galvanised steel.  Elza Leticia is delighted to receive this help and promises to make her repayments punctually.

loans.use: cement, bricks, sand, galvanised steel

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
Nestor es un odontología muy profesional, es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, y que siempre esta esforzándose por ir mejorando en la vida. El crédito anterior de Kiva lo utilizó para la compra de insumos dentales, pero hoy solicita de un nuevo crédito para poder hacer una especialización en ortodoncia.
Quiere seguir creciendo como profesional y es por eso que quiere hacer este curso, ya que sabe que la única forma de crecer es por medio del estudio.
texts.en: Nestor is a very professional orthodontist and also a very hardworking and determined person, who is constantly striving to get on better in life.  He used his previous Kiva loan to buy dental supplies, but he is now applying for this new loan to enable him to specialise in orthodontics.  He knows that further study is the only way to continue progressing professionally and it is for that reason that he wants to do this course.

loans.use: to pay for him to study for a specialised orthodontics qualification

loans.name: Raf'uddin

texts.ru: Рафъуддин житель города Вахдат. Он женат, имеет двоих дочерей и двух сыновей. Ему 49 лет. Его жена домохозяйка, а дети еще учатся. Рафъуддин занимается торговлей. Он в течение 20 лет обеспечивает свою семью за счет своего торгового бизнеса. У него на рынке города Душанбе имеется своя торговая точка, где он занимается продажей продуктов и фруктов. Рафъуддин имеет двух помощников в торговле, которым каждый месяц платит зарплату. Он любит свой бизнес и делает все, чтобы успешно продвигать его. Сейчас Рафъуддин обратился за кредитом, чтобы расширить бизнес. Он хочет купить ассортимент различных продуктов и сезонных фруктов. Его товар всегда имеет хороший спрос, так как он относится к своим клиентам добросовестно и предлагает им товар только хорошего качества.
texts.en: Raf'uddin is a resident of the town of Vahdat. He is married and has two daughters and two sons. He is 49 years old. His wife is a homemaker and his children are still in school. Raf'uddin is in retail. For the past twenty years he has been supporting his family by doing his own retail business. He has a vendor space on the market of the city of Dushanbe where he sells food and fruits. Raf'uddin has two helpers in his business whom he pays salaries monthly. He loves his business and does everything so that he can successfully promote it. Right now Raf'uddin has come for a loan to expand his business. He wants to buy a variety of different foods and seasonal fruits. His stuff is always in good demand because he treats his customers honestly and offers them only good quality produce.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of different foods and seasonal fruits to grow business.

loans.name: Baasan-Ochir

texts.en: Baasan-Ochir, 31, lives with his wife and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in his father's house on a plot of land. His family's income consists of his taxi income and his wife's earnings from selling goods at a grocery store. He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase furniture such as a chest, a closet and a television. He thinks that this furniture will improve his family's living standards. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy furniture.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 57 years old and lives in Mialen, Clarin, Philippines. She is married with five children. Loreta works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for ten years. She has requested a loan to buy additional fishing equipment such as fish hooks, fishing tackle, terminal tackle, reels, rods, etc.

Loreta has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Loreta hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing equipment such as fish hooks, fishing tackle, terminal tackle, reels, rods, etc.

loans.name: Djekafo (Parler La Même Voie) Group

texts.fr:
Djekafo est un regroupement des femmes du quartier  Hamdallaye Extension de la ville de Koutiala  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans, sont mariées et ont en moyenne 6 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les fruits et légumes, les cosmétiques et divers etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt de groupe. 
Djenebou deuxième personne de la droite vers la gauche ne vend des produits cosmétiques.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des cartons de crèmes, parfums, savons de toilette, des pommades, lotions et vernis. Elle se procure de ces produits avec les Yoruba en gros à Koutiala. Elle vend ces articles en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Djekafo comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 62.000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Djenebou compte réaliser  70 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Djekafo is a group of women from the Hamdallaye Extension neighbourhood of the town of Koutiala.  They live in large traditional families.  They have an average age of 37 years, are married, and have an average of 6 children.  This group of women trade in various items such as fruit and vegetables, cosmetics and others.  

To improve the scale of their businesses, the members of Djekafo have decided to request a loan from the field partner Soro Yiriwaso. This will be the first loan for this group.  

Djenebou (second person from the right) only sells cosmetics.  She will use her loan to buy boxes of creams, perfumes, toilet soaps, pomades, lotions and nail varnish.  She buys these products in bulk in Koutiala, from the Yoruba people.  Djenebou makes retail and cash sales from her home, and at the market.  She has a diverse range of customers.  

Whilst the other members of the group hope to make an average profit of 62,000 francs CFA each during this period, Djenebou expects to make 70,000 francs CFA.  As well as repaying their  loans, they will use part of their profits to fund their day-to-day, personal expenses, and increase their stock levels.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Pua

texts.en:
Pua is a 46-year-old married woman with 6 children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro, banana and breadfruit to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Pua has requested a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, a wheelbarrow, fertilizer, and an axe.

She is a new member of SPBD this year. With her profits, Pua hopes to sell her products at the market, where there is a higher demand.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, a wheelbarrow, fertilizer, and an axe.

loans.name: Connielyn

texts.en:
This is Connielyn. She previously accessed a 23,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase fabric, thread and other raw materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children, in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan so that she can buy additional fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Connielyn hopes to be more successful in business and have more customers. She dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from studying the word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Ladiri (L'honnête) Group

texts.fr:
Ladiri est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Hamdallaye qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans, sont mariées et en moyenne 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les fruits et légumes, les cosmétiques, de tissus et divers etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt de groupe. 
Awa,  première de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des sacs de savons. Elle se procure de ces produits à Abidjan avec les chauffeurs. Elle vend ces articles en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Ladiri comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 55 000 FCFA chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Awa  compte réaliser  60 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Ladiri is a group of women from the Hamdallaye neighbourhood who live in large, traditional families.  They are, on average, 30 years old, married, and with an average of 3 children.  This group of women buy and sell various products such as fruit and vegetables, cosmetics, fabric and others.  To improve the size of their businesses,  the members of the group have requested a loan from the field partner Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be the group's first loan.

Awa (on the left of the photo) will use her loan to buy sacks of soaps.  She uses drivers to buy this product in Abidjan.  Awa makes retail and cash sales from her home and at the market.  She has a diverse range of customers.

Whilst the other members of the Ladiri Group hope to make an average profit of 55,000 francs CFA each during this loan cycle, Awa hopes to make a profit of 60,000 francs CFA.  As well as repaying their loans, they will use part of their profits to pay for their day-to-day personal expenses, and to increase their stock levels.

loans.use: to buy soaps.

loans.name: Richel

texts.en: Richel resides in Sepac, Sapang Dalaga with her family and three children. To make a living, she manages her own grocery store in her home. She borrowed a loan of 4000 PHP to buy canned goods and more grocery items to sell. She is determined to give a better living and comfort of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 60 years old and married with five children.

Lolita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional spices, noodles, milk, sugar, coffee, and other goods for her inventory. 

Lolita borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years, and she earns additional income from food vending and farming sugarcane.

Lolita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional spices, noodles, milk, sugar, coffee, and other goods for her inventory.

loans.name: Gary

texts.en:
With a positive outlook on his hometown of Baton Rouge, Louisiana, Gary decided to go into business with his recently created magazine, "The Rouge Collection".

Based on his agenda to display everything that is “red hot” within the city, Gary created the mag 10 months ago in efforts to revamp the industry. Financed from personal funds, Gary expanded his business and was recently able to purchase office space for production with hopes to break through Baton Rouge boundaries and connect to readers outside his town.

The primary goal of The Rouge Collection is to share photos and articles that highlight everything positive happening in Baton Rouge along with the people behind the positive events and include places worth visiting. Gary’s new goal is to receive articles from fresh writers with fresh perspectives, ideas and concepts to shape the future of the mag. 

Currently, The Rouge Collection is in high demand for samples and orders but, due to lack of equipment and supplies, Gary is unable to execute large orders and sample requests. Failure to complete orders could result in closing the business. As new as his business is, it was no surprise to Gary that he would eventually need financial assistance. A quick Internet search introduced him to Accion Texas Inc., a nonprofit microlender with America’s largest lending portfolio, and ended his worries. Once approved, Gary set out to purchase office equipment to print product samples.

With his recent loan, the 28-year-old was able to continue his service to his hometown, keep his four part-time sales employees, and continue to educate his readers on relationships, health and fitness, style and beauty, entertainment and sports. View everything Gary offers via The Rouge Collection on his website: http://therougecollection.net/therouge/.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to continue his service to his hometown, keep his four part-time sales employees, and to continue to educate his readers on relationships, health and fitness, style and beauty, entertainment and sports.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 36 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. Joy has requested a 9000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like soap, sugar and other groceries.

Joy has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years, and she earns additional income from rice retailing and pig fattening.

Joy aspires to save enough money to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, sugar and other groceries.

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Mr.Battulga is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in a ger, the traditional nomadic tent, in the Uvs province of Mongolia. 

He and his wife Enhtuya started their family business, a butcher shop, in a rental counter of a local market in 2002. They purchase livestock from herders in countryside and sell fresh meat to local customers. 

He is now requesting MNT 1,500,000 to buy cattle to butcher and sell at retail price to clients. 

His two sons are soon to be enrolling at the local school, and Battulga needs to increase the family's income to prepare their children for school.

loans.use: to buy cattle to butcher and sell at retail to clients

loans.name: Natta

texts.fr:
La dame, Natta, âgée de 27 ans, mariée et mère de famille  fait du commerce depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle vend des sacs et possède sa clientèle parmi le voisinage et ses proches. Natta vient pour la première fois solliciter un crédit de 150000F CFA afin d’augmenter son capital pour pouvoir acheter des sacs a main et préparer les fêtes de la Tabaski qui sont dans moins d’un mois. 
Natta participe activement a la dépense quotidienne de la famille et aide son époux dans les charges domestiques.
Son vœu le plus cher est d’améliorer son commerce, et d’atteindre un niveau beaucoup plus élevé allant jusqu’ a ouvrir un grand magasin de ventes de pièces détachées. Et cela en espérant l’appui de l’IMCEC comme partenaire financier.
texts.en:
Natta is a 27-year-old married woman and mother.  She has been in retail for more than 5 years.  She sells bags to her customers who are friends and neighbours.  Natta has requested a loan for the first time of 150,000 francs CFA, in order to increase her capital and be able to buy handbags in preparation for Tabaski (a religious festival), which is in less than a month.  

Natta contributes to the daily expenses of her family, and helps her husband with the responsibilities of their household. Her dearest wish is to improve her business, and to achieve a level whereby she can open a large shop selling lengths of fabric.  She hopes to have the support of IMCEC as her financial partner to achieve this.

loans.use: to buy handbags for resale.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Ms. Maricel is a 39-year-old single lady and a full-time businesswoman. She sells peanut food delicacies, such as fried peanuts, sugar-coated peanuts, and plain peanuts. She has been selling a variety of peanut products for eight years already. She will use the loan to buy raw peanuts, which she will process and deliver to different restaurants, hotels, and resorts within the city and nearby towns. She sells her peanut products on a consignment basis. She generates income through this business to support her daily needs. Her plan is to expand this business by increasing the volume of peanut products, because there are already more customers buying her product.

Ms. Maricel has been a member of Paglaum Multipurpose Cooperative for almost five years and has taken advantage of many types of loans.

loans.use: To purchase raw peanuts to make peanut delicacies.

loans.name: Todd

texts.en:
For half his life, Todd was an avid smoker and only recently switched to vaporizing. The alternate to smoking regular cigarettes, vaporizing allows a smoker to enjoy the vapors of an e-cigarette and avoid the multitude of harsh chemicals and potential life-threatening side effects of traditional cigarettes. 

As stated on his site, http://www.zooksvapor.com/, Todd says: “I have always wanted to go into business for myself, and now I am able to do that and help others along the way! The more you get to know me, (the more) you will understand how passionate I am about this!” 

Todd says his family history of health issues increased his need to discontinue use of traditional cigarettes and find a new outlet. Once he made the switch to vaping and experienced the difference, Todd began spreading the word. He noticed he could make a business out of the work he was already doing. Realizing the need for inexpensive, high-quality vapor supplies and accessories in his hometown of Memphis, Tennessee, Todd went to work opening Zooks Vapor.

Beginning his business seven months ago from his own money, Todd hopes to one day open a store and attract more customers and hire a team instead of working alone. Before he can accomplish his next goal, Todd ventured to community partner SCORE, which then referred him to nonprofit microlender Accion Texas Inc. Now approved, Todd expects to replenish his inventory according to his clients’ wants.

“This loan will help me not dig so much into my pockets to support the business. This will help me make better profits. It allows me to keep doing what I’m doing and allows me to work for myself,” Todd says. Without the loan “I would have to reduce my Christmas inventory plan.”

loans.use: to purchase more inventory.

loans.name: :l' Espoir 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.fr:
Jonas est le coordinateur de son groupe L'Espoir 1, 2 & 3. Il es un commercant. tous les membres de ce groupe vivent dans la région DE BOR DE MER où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Jonas a dirigé son commerce pendant 7 années. Avant de commencer ce commerce Jonas était un etudiant.

Jonas voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans les produit divers (cosmetiques, chaussures, vetements). Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son commerce de produit divers. Des autres membres militant ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme Divers produit. Il dit que les défis principal c'est devenus une grande commerçante.
texts.en:
Jonas is the coordinator of his group L'Espoir 1, 2 & 3. He is a merchant. The members of this group all live in the DE BOR DE MER region, where electricity is rare and potable water is very limited. Jonas has been running his business for seven years. Before starting it, he was a student.

Jonas would like to use this loan to invest in a variety of goods (cosmetics, shoes, clothing). He hopes that his loan will help him to expand his business selling various products. Other members of the group have need of a loan for such businesses. He says that his main challenge is to become a big shopkeeper.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products, shoes, clothing, etc. to resell

loans.name: Dialika

texts.fr: Madame DIALIKA est une brave femme qui est âgée de 39ans et elle habite aux environs du Guichet. Elle évolue dans le commerce des prêts à porter et a une expérience de plus de 5ans dans cet activité. Madame DIALIKA sollicite ce montant pour augmenter son fond de commerce afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et diversifier ses produits. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h. Elle s'occupe des dépenses familiales quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. DIALIKA souhaite à l'avenir diversifier ses produits et augmenter ses revenus pour pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en: Ms. DIALIKA is a good and honest woman, 39 years old, and she lives near the branch office. She does commerce in ready-to-wear clothing and has over five years of experience in this business. Ms. DIALIKA is requesting this loan to increase her business capital in order to satisfy her customers and diversify her products. Her day starts at 8 AM and ends at 6 PM. She takes care of day-to-day family expenses and her children's schooling costs. For the future, she would like to diversify her products and increase her income to be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase ready-to-wear clothing to resell

loans.name: Nahomie De Danda Group

texts.fr:
Nanotte est le coordinatrice de son groupe Nahomie de Danda. Elle est une commercante. ils habite dans la région de Danda où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Nanotte a dirigé son commerce de produit alimentaire pendant 8 années.  

Nanotte voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans les produit alimentaires et elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son commerce. Des autres membres militant ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces de produit divers comme charbon, cosmetiques, chaussures, vetement, etc. Nanotte dit que les défis principal c'est devenus une grande commerçante.
texts.en:
Nanotte is the coordinator of her group "Nahomie de Danda". She is a merchants and lives in the Danda region, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. Nanotte has been running her grocery business for eight years. 

Nanotte would like to use this loan to invest in grocery items, and she hopes that this loan will help her to expand her business. Other active members have need of a loan for selling various products, such as charcoal, cosmetics, shoes, clothing, etc. Nanotte says that her main challenges include becoming a major merchant.

loans.use: to purchase food items to sell

loans.name: Burmaa

texts.en:
Burmaa is 34 years old and lives in the Uvs province of Mongolia with her family. Her husband Anhbayar is a police officer in the local police department. Burmaa's children go to a local primary school and kindergarten.

Burmaa has been selling clothing and stationary at a rental counter at a local market since 2012. She has great taste in clothes and stationary imports from Erlian, China. She already has regular customers and is appreciated by her customers because of her attitude and friendly manner. She is now requesting loan of 600,000 MNT to purchase more inventory from Erlian, China to sell at her counter. She is a hardworking, diligent and welcoming lady.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory from Erlian, China to sell at her counter

loans.name: Las Empresarias Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LAS EMPRESARIAS está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Mery tiene 23 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo,  es promotora de productos de belleza ella vende de manera ambulante visitando instituciones públicas y privadas, barrios distintos domicilios ofreciendo sus productos, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Mery va a usar este préstamo  para comprar cosméticos que se encuentran en promoción para tener en stock para su  negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es tener variedad de productos para  satisfacer a sus  clientes, la Sra. Mery enfrenta retos en su negocio que son atender  con eficiencia a sus clientes y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y salir adelante  sola.
texts.en:
Communal bank “Las Empresarias” [Entrepreneur women] is composed of eight members; six women and two men. The bank’s president is Mery, 23, who sells cosmetics from a catalog. She works as a street vendor and sells her products by visiting private and public companies, and different neighborhoods.

This is her first loan with the institution. Mery will buy cosmetics that are on sale in order to stock her business. She is thinking of having a wider variety of products to satisfy her customers’ needs. Mery faces some challenges with her business, such as giving her customers a good service. The benefits from this loan will help her improve her family’s quality of life, being this the only activity she has to support herself and get ahead on her own.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Medelina

texts.en:
Medelina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock like noodles, canned goods, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Medelina has been in this business for 30 years. Medelina earns more income from farming sugarcane.

Medelina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like noodles, canned goods, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 26 years old, married with four children. Three of her children are in school, so she is a very hard -working entrepreneur. 

Jenelyn has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Jenelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

Jenelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jenelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice to sell

loans.name: Norlyn

texts.en:
Norlyn is 24 years old and married and works very hard to help her husband.

Norlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like soft drinks, soap, milk, chips, bread, etc.

Norlyn has been in this business for three years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soft drinks, soap, milk, chips, bread, etc

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Janet works hard to support her family.

She has a food stall business in the Philippines, and she earns extra income from food vending.  Janet is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to  buy additional stocks of frozen foods to sell in her food-vending business.

Janet has sustained her business activities through no fewer than 25 past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stocks of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Mrs. Edna is the 41-year-old mother of two children. She is engaging in retail selling of different grocery products. And her primary customers are the nearby houses within her vicinity. She is in the business for almost ten years now. The major activity of her business is purchasing products at wholesale and sell them at retail. 

By this business, she is able to generate income, which helps her day-to-day needs. The demand for her products is increasing frrom her neighbors, who fill a boarding house and apartment.  By increasing her inventory, she can improve her business, and she can finance the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her retail grocery store

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, three of whom are in school, Ruth works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. 

Ruth is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. Ruth hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Karyn

texts.en:
After only a year and seven months of working as a janitor, Karyn already has a team of four part-time, two full-time employees and plans to hire another three full-time employees.  As much of a go-getter as Karyn is, she experienced difficulty securing new contracts because of insufficient insurance. While watching TV, she noticed a commercial for Accion Texas Inc., nonprofit lender with America’s largest microlending portfolio.

Inspired, Karyn ventured to her nearest Accion to inquire about a loan. Shortly after approval, she purchased insurance for her company, equipment and began marketing her business, Yasmin Janitorial Services, LLC in her hometown of Metairie, Louisiana.  The 36-year-old is now able to ensure work for herself and her employees through new contracts.

loans.use: to purchase insurance and secure more contracts.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like eggs, noodles, canned goods, spices, etc for her general store business.

Virginia has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from buying and selling herbal medicine.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like eggs, noodles, canned goods, spices, etc

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en: Lydiah is a  Kiva borrower. She has three children. She describes herself to be intelligent. She operates a boutique where she sells clothes. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate water and poor drainage. She will use the KES 35,890 loan to buy a water dispenser to store clean water for drinking. She hopes that in the future, she will buy a water tank and educate her children. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water dispenser

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a  Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be highly motivated. He operates a farm where he grows crops for sale and also for his own consumption. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough clean water. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future, he will live happily and have a healthy life. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a  Kiva borrower. She operates a farm where she grows crops. She describes her family challenge as an unhealthy source of cooking energy. She will use the KES 12,900 loan to buy a gas cooker that will enable her to cook efficiently. 

She hopes that in the future, she will be outstanding in farming. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 50,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a gas cooker.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is married with an only child. He operates a service-based business providing motor transportation in the community of Bunawan, Calamba. His wife is working abroad as an Overseas Filipino Worker to make a living. 

Patrick borrowed a loan of 50,000 PHP from Gata Daku MPC, which he had joined in 2009 to acquire a motorcycle for his transportation business. He plans to use the profits he earns to finance his own farm. In the future, Patrick is determined to improve the general living situation of his family.

loans.use: to acquire a motorcycle for his transportation business

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as innovative. Ann operates a farm where she grows crops for her own use and to sell. She describes her biggest business challenge as the high cost of cooking. 

Ann will use the KES 12,900 loan to buy a gas cooker to enable her to cook efficiently. She hopes that, in the future, she will have an improved business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She repaid her previous loan of KES 20,000 successfully.

loans.use: to buy a gas cooker

loans.name: Hafeez Begum's Group

texts.en:
Hafeez Begum is 53, married, mother of a daughter, and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her daughter has gotten married and living in her home happily. 

Hafeez Begum's husband owns a livestock trading business and does most of his trading within the city. He purchase goats and billy goats from rural areas and sells them in the city. He has to feed and look after his livestock which is very tough for him in his old age. He is making an effort and earning money for the survival of both of them. 

He wants to buy billy goats to sell because the Eid-ul-Azha is about to come and many people like to buy billy goats to sacrifice on Eid-Ul-Azha. This is very profitable but he does not have enough savings to buy billy goats.

Therefore, Hafeez Begum requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband could buy billy goats to sell. And he could earn maximum profit so they can spend their old ages with peace and calm.

Hafeez Begum is very pleased after taking this loan and thankful to the BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy billy goats to sell before Eid.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Luzviminda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Luzviminda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of daily use items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, spices, etc. for her general store business.

Luzviminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of daily use items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Jona works hard to support her family. She sells ice cream in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Jona is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her ice cream.

Jona has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice cream.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 47 years old and married. She has three children.

Merlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a grocery store in the Philippines. She has been running the grocery store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish.

She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, chips, soft drinks, eggs, soap, sugar, etc.
