A loan of USD 1,500 will be a great support to Elmira and her family, helping them to purchase a new cow. This will give them more opportunities to develop their agribusiness. 

As this Elmira's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who have not had access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. The family will be very thankful to the lenders for the goodwill and support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is married and has a internet cafe business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional computer.

Jocelyn has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional computer

loans.name: Armen

texts.en: Armen is from Spitak city of Lori region. He lives with his wife and one-year-old daughter. Armen works in the private sector; he works in a car-washing service. His salary alone is not enough to meet his family's needs. Besides working in the private sector, Armen is also involved in breeding cows, pigs and hens. He also cultivates potatoes. Armen is the only breadwinner in his family. To continue his agribusiness he needs some financial resources. A loan of USD 1750 will be very helpful for him and will enable him to purchase forage for the livestock and to make loan repayment. Armen relies on the good will of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for supporting him to sustain his agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase forage for his livestock and to make loan repayment

loans.name: Lizeth Yisela

texts.es:
Lizeth tiene 20 años con mucho esfuerzo estudio costura, con lo cual luego de mucho ahorrar logro iniciar su negocio de de servicio de costura y confecciones, con lo cual atiende hasta 10 clientes y trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día, Lizeth  cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable y realiza un buen trabajo.

Lizeth está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han  brindado podrá comprar materiales como telas, hilos, botones, entre otros materiales y así poder realizar su trabajo y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño: ” Tener su casa propia y estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Lizeth is twenty years old. She put a lot of effort into becoming a seamstress, and after a lot of saving she was able to start her sewing business. She now serves up to ten customers and works around nine hours per day. Lizeth thinks the reason why her business is going well is because she is kind and does a good job. 

Lizeth is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will be able to buy materials like fabric, thread, buttons, and other supplies in order to do her work and keep fighting to make her greatest drem a reality, which is to have her own home and attend university.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta is 61 years old and married with one child who is in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Roberta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 8000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Roberta has been in this business for 24 years and sells a variety of items, such as school supplies, snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Roberta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Victor Jesus

texts.es:
Victor es un joven de 21 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de chincha. Victor es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que cada día se esfuerza en su centro de labores, el trabaja como operario mecánico, y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar sus gastos de manutención, el cree que le va bien porque es responsable en su trabajo.

Victor está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que el han brindado podrá comprar materiales de construccion para poder realizar reparaciones en el cuarto donde vive, ya que es necesario mejorar el techo y el piso que actualmente es de tierra, así tendrá un mejor ambiente para vivir y seguirá luchando por su gran sueño:” Tener una casa propia y estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Victor is a 21-year-old young man who lives in the city of Chincha. Victor is a young man with a great desire to succeed. It is because of this that each day he exerts himself in his work center. He works as a mechanical operator, and with the fruit of his labor he can settle his living expenses.  He believes that it is going well for him because he is responsible in his job.

Victor is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help that they have provided he will be able to buy construction materials to be able to make repairs on the room where he lives. It is necessary to improve the roof and floor that currently is made of dirt. Therefore, he will have a better environment in which to live and he will continue fighting for his greatest dream, “To have his own home and to study for a university degree.”

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Santy Nataly

texts.es:
Santy es una joven de 19 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona. SAnty e suna joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, por ello y a pesar de las adversidades trabaja como vendedora en una tienda de artefactos de su ciudad, con lo cual puede solventar sus gastos y apoyar a su madre con los gastos del hogar, Santy cree que le está yendo bien porque es responsable y le gusta trabajar.

Santy está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar una cama, ya que actualmente solo tiene unas maderas y una esponja como cama, así ella podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y luchar por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Estudiar una carrera universitaria”
texts.en:
Santy is a young woman who is 19 years old. She lives in the city of Ica in the district of Parcona. She is a young woman who is eager to succeed. Thus, despite the adversities in her life, she works as a salesperson in an appliance story in her city so that she can pay her expenses and help her mother with household costs. Santy believes she is doing well because she is responsible and likes to work.

Santy is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy a bed since she currently has wood and a piece of sponge for a bed. Consequently she will be able to improve her quality of life and strive to make her great dream of studying at the university a reality:
 .

loans.use: to purchase a bed.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 33 years old and married with two children.

Imelda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, etc..

Imelda has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns income from buying and selling rice.

Imelda aspires to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Faasalafa

texts.en:
Faasalafa is 44 years old and married with eight children.
 
She has a plantation where she grows taro, bananas, and yams that she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Faasalafa needs a loan to buy barb wire, bush-knives, wheelbarrow, chemicals, backpack sprayer, and pickaxe. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. Faasalafa will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy barb wire, bush knives, wheelbarrow, chemicals, backpack sprayer, and pickaxe for her plantation.

loans.name: Corina

texts.es:
Corina tiene 32 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Aguaytia, para poder llevar el sustento a su hogar trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes y bebidas, el cual inicio con mucho esfuerzo y luego de varios meses de ahorro, Corina trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes al día, asimismo ella confecciona ropa, y con ello puede tener un ingreso extra para su hogar Corina cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable con los clientes y ofrece buenos productos.

Corina esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que con su apoyo podrá comprar materiales de construcción ya que actualmente su vivienda se encuentra en malas condiciones y con ello podrá reparar el techo de su vivienda, así mejorara su calidad de vida y seguirá luchando para hacer realidad su sueño de “Tener un taller de confección de ropa para niños”.
texts.en:
Corina is 32 years old and lives in the city of Aguaytia. In order to support her family she works in her small business selling groceries and drinks. She started her business with a lot of effort and after several months of saving money. Corina works approximately 10 hours a day and can wait on up to 15 customers a day. In addition she makes clothing and is able to generate extra income for her household. She feels that she is doing well in her business because she is friendly with her customers and offers them good products.

Corina is grateful to Kiva lenders since with their support she will be able to buy construction materials. Currently her house is in poor condition and the loan will enable her to repair the roof, thereby improving her quality of life. She will continue striving to make her dream a reality, that of having a shop making children’s clothing.

loans.use: to purchase construction matereials.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 53 years old and married with two children.

Delia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell, such as canned goods, eggs and spices.

Delia has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal and raising pigs.

Delia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell, such as canned goods, eggs and spices

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom is 31 years old and a mother of two dependent children residing in Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. 

For the sake of her family, she mainly rely on rice cropping on a hectare and half, while her husband works for others for a fee. The business she has been involved in for about 10 years has returned her almost 27,000 KHR per day. 

Mom is not a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her past three loans have supported her business and uplifted her living conditions better than before. 

Now, she is seeking a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizers and herbicides for her farmland. She hopes to gain a good income from her business so she can send all of her kids to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for her farmland.

loans.name: Oynamoz

texts.ru:
Ойнамоз из района Кубадиён. Ей 47 лет. У нее есть муж, двое сыновей и дочь. Сейчас ее муж находиться на заработках заграницей. Он не смог найти работу в своем районе и уехал в Россию. Дочка вышла замуж, а двое сыновей еще школьники. Ойнамоз на земельном участке выращивает пшеницу, и все свободное время отдает работе на земле. Она занимается растениеводством в течение 10 лет. Ее сыновья после школы помогают ей. 
Ойнамоз как и другие жители района готовится к осеннему посеву. Она просит кредит, чтобы приобрести пшеничные зерна, минеральные удобрения и горючую смесь. Ойнамоз старается работать еще лучше, чтобы к весне получить отменный урожай.
texts.en: Oynamoz is from the Qubadiyon district.  She is 47 years old.  She has a husband, two sons and a daughter.  Currently, her husband is working abroad.  He could not find a job in his district and went to Russia.  Their daughter got married, and the two sons are still school students.  Oynamoz grows wheat on her land plot and spends all of her free time working on the land.  She has been involved in agriculture for 10 years.  Her sons help her after school.  Oynamoz, just like other district residents, are preparing for the autumn sowing.  She is requesting a loan to buy wheat seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel.  Oynamoz tries to work even better to get an excellent harvest by the spring.

loans.use: to buy wheat seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Mirian Beatriz

texts.es:
Mirian es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante, a pesar de las adversidades, como por ejemplo debido a sus pocos recursos económicos, solo pudo estudiar hasta el tercer grado de secundaria, pero ello le ha dado más fuerzas para luchar, por ello actualmente trabaja como asistente en una pequeña empresa de venta de su ciudad, ella labora alrededor de 9 horas al día, y con el fruto de su trabajo puede sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo de 3 años de edad, asimismo Mirian ha logrado iniciar su negocio de venta de animales como patos, pollos y pavos, con lo cual tiene un ingreso mas para los gastos de su hogar, Mirina cree que le va bien porque es muy luchadora y responsable.

Mirian agradece el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder realizar mejoras en la casa donde vive ya que se encuentra con las paredes agrietadas y el techo en mal estado, así ella le podrá mejorar la cálida de vida de su hijo y luchar por hacer realidad su sueño de tener una casa propia y darle una profesión a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Mirian is a woman very driven to get ahead in spite of adversity. For example, due to limited financial resources, she was only able to get a ninth grade education, but that only gave her more stregth to keep fighting. That is why she currently works as an assistant at a small local sales company. She works around nine hours per day, and the fruit of her labor allows her to support her little boy, who is three years old. Mirian has also managed to start a business selling animals like ducks, chickens, and turkeys, which provides her with extra income for her household expenses. Mirian believes the reason why things are going well for her is because she is a fighter and a very responsible person. 

Mirian appreciates the support offered to her by Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will be able to purchase construction materials in order to improve the house where she lives. There are cracks in the walls and the roof is in disrepair. The improvements will allow her to improve her child's quality of life and to strive to make her dreams of having her own home and giving her son a career come true.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Son is 43 years old and a resident of Battambang province. 

To make a living, her family counts on her agribusiness, corn, soybean, and cassava farming. It is the business that she had for more than 10 years. 

Including this loan, she is a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). After the successful past two loans she repaid back completely, she can upgrade her lifestyle better than before. Now, she is seeking a new loan of 1,200,000 KHR in order to pay for the plowing fee for her cash-crop. 

She hopes to boost her crop yield on time and make a good profit for her family.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fee for her cash-crop.

loans.name: Fatima Del Carmen

texts.es: Fátima tiene 34 años de edad,originaria de la ciudad de Boaco y madre de un hijO.Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería desde hace 5 años. Cuenta con el apoyo de su mama quien le ha ayudado a realizar esta actividad desde muy joven. Tiene como otra fuente de ingreso el servicio de cocinera que realiza en ocasiones especiales. Solicita el crédito para comprar: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, jabón, detergente, pollo entre otros con el fin de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. su plan futuro es construir su casa y su meta próxima es expandir  su negocio.
texts.en:
Fatima, 34, is originally from the city of Boaco. She has one son. She has worked as a vendor in a small grocery store for 5 years. Her mother helps her out and has helped her with this skill since she was young. As another source of income, she has a cooking service for special occasions.

She is requesting this loan to buy rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, ham, soap, chicken, and other products so she can satisfy her customers' needs. Her plan for the future is to build a house and her next goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, ham, soap, chicken, and other products.

loans.name: Josselin Marisol

texts.es:
Josselin vive en la ciudad de Ica, es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que con mucho esfuerzo estudio la carrera de administración y actualmente trabaja como cajera en una institución de su ciudad, ella labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo solventa sus gastos de manutención con mucho esfuerzo; Josselin cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable y cuidadosa.

Josselin está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que podrá comprar una computadora para poder realizar los trabajo que le encomiendan en su empleo, de esta manera  no tendrá quejas en su empleo y seguirá luchando por hacer realidad su sueño de Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Josselin lives in the city of Ica. She is a young person with a great desire to get on in life and this is why she put a lot of effort into studying for her career in administration. She currently works as a teller in one of the city's institutions. She works around 9 hours a day and she makes a lot of effort to cover her own costs with what she earns. Josselin thinks things are going well for her at work because she is responsible and careful.

Josselin is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as she will be able to buy a computer to carry out the work she is given in her job, and so she won't have any complaints about her work and will carry on working hard to make her dream of having her own house a reality.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Herminigilda

texts.en:
This is Herminigilda, 42, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Wilfredo, a security guard, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Herminigilda operates an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines, such as ylang-ylang, golden shower and dahlias, as well as a variety of hanging plants and others. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors and the nearby community. She earns a minimum of 1000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operation of her business, Herminigilda is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy gardening materials and supplies, such as seed and fertilizer, needed in her business.

Herminigilda hopes to buy another lot to be used for her business and dreams that her child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and garden inputs

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 45 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school; she is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marivic has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Marivic requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Marivic has been in this business for three years. In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy items like soda, beer, sugar,  etc., for resale in his shop

loans.name: Atirgul

texts.ru: Атиргул 41 год, вместе с супругом воспитывает 3 детей, из которых старший сын является студентом, остальные школьники. Cупруг помогает по хозяйству, а также основной его деятельностью является частный извоз пассажиров, предоставляет услуги такси местному населению. Атиргул  в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается предоставлением услуг общественного питания, стартовав 2 года назад с 15,000 сом KGS. Атиргул арендует небольшое кафе. Меню в кафе состоит в основном из национальных блюд. Благодаря упорному труду Атиргул она смогла развить свой небольшой бизнес и привлечь постоянных клиентов. Работу свою она любит. Ведь приготовление пищи приносит большое удовольствие. Со слов клиентов кафе- еда очень вкусная и разнообразная. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Атиргул  обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на расширения бизнеса и закупа оптовых продуктов для кафе, для разнообразия меню в кафе. Доходы от кредита Атиргул  планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, и планирует накопить средства на обучение старшего сына, который в этом году поступил на медицинский факультет государственного университета.
texts.en:
Atirgul is 41 years old; she and her husband have three children. The oldest son is a college student, and the rest are in school. Atirgul's husband helps around the house, and his source of income is his taxi business. 

Atirgul's main source of income is a cafe which she opened two years ago with 15,000 KGS. The menu mainly consists of national dishes. Thanks to her hard work, Atirgul was able to develop her business and attract regular customers. She loves her work and enjoys making the food. According to her customers, the food is delicious and there are many choices.  In order to further expand her business, Atirgul is applying for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS from Bai Tushum and Partners in order to buy additional products for her cafe and to diversify the menu. Atirgul plans to invest any profits resulting from this loan into her business, and wants to save enough money to educate her oldest son, who just started medical school this year in the state university.

loans.use: to buy food products, to diversify the menu in the cafe.

loans.name: Francisca Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Francisca es originaria de la ciudad de Boaco. Tiene 48 años de edad, madre soltera de 3 hijos, es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería desde hace 11 años. Inicio esta actividad luego de terminar de trabajar en una institución estatal. Poco a poco con dinero propio y ayuda de otras financieras ha logrado mantener su pulpería. Solicita el crédito para comprar: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, café, leche, gaseosas, jugos, golosinas, servilletas, papel higiénico entre otros con el fin de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y mantener su negocio surtido. Tiene como expectativa que su negocio se convierta en una miscelánea. Su plan futuro es expandir su negocio e implementar la venta de comida. Su meta próxima es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa y poder alquilar un espacio para adquirir mayores ingresos. Agradece a Kiva y MiCredito por esta oportunidad que les ha brindado a los comerciantes, lo cual es de ayuda para ellos.
texts.en:
Francisca is from the city of Boaco. She is 48 years old and is a single mother of three. She works as a retailer and has worked selling groceries for eleven years. She started this business after she finished working for a state agency. Little by little she has been able to keep her grocery store going, with her own money and help from other financing institutions. 

She is requesting this loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, coffee, milk, sodas, juice, sweets, napkins, toilet paper, and other items. This will allow her to meet her customers' needs and keep her business well stocked. She expects to turn her business into a general store, and her plans for the future are to expand her business to include food sales. Her next goal is to improve her home's infrastructure and rent out a space in order to obtain more income.

She thanks Kiva and MiCredito for this opportunity they offer retailers, which is of help to them.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, coffee, milk, sodas, juice, sweets, napkins, toilet paper, and other items.

loans.name: Leonena

texts.en:
Leonena is 44 years old, married, with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Leonena has an egg-retailing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks of eggs to sell.

Leonena has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of eggs to sell.

loans.name: Elba Maria

texts.es: Doña Elba es originaria  de la ciudad de Boaco. Tiene 43 años de edad, madre de 3 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de calzado, desde hace 5 años. Gracias a su esfuerzo, trabajo y dedicación ha logrado salir adelante. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo e hijos quienes le ayudan con la comercialización de dichos productos en el mercado. Solicita el crédito para comprar: sandalias de hule y cuero al por mayor, con el fin de surtir su negocio  y satisfacer a sus clientes. Estima que al adquirir el crédito, podrá mejorar su calidad de vida, ya que al aumentar su inventario, obtendrá mayores ingresos. Su plan futuro es ahorrar dinero .su meta próxima es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Elba is originally from the city of Boaco. She is 43 years old and is the mother of 3 children. She is a business woman. She has been selling footwear for five years. Thanks to her effort, dedication and work she has been able to get ahead. She has the help of her husband and children who help her sell the products in the market.

Elba is requesting this loan to buy rubber and leather sandals wholesale. She wants to stock her business to satisfy her customers. She estimates that if she gets this loan she can improve her standard of living as increasing her stock will generate greater income.  Her plan for the future is to save money. She would like to improve the infrastructure of her house.

loans.use: to buy rubber and leather sandals wholesale.

loans.name: Joyita

texts.en: Joyita is 58 years old and  married with ten children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as soap, herrings, tinned food, and others. She has been doing this for two years. Joyita needs a loan to buy a new deep freezer, tinned fish, milk, boxes of chicken, sausages, snacks, bags of rice, sacks of sugar, onions, salt, soy sauce, and ice cream for resale in her store. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2008 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new deep freezer and stock of food for resale in her store

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Sreymom is 28 years old. She is married and resides with her four-year-old child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than five years, earning about $8 per day. Her husband is an excavator driver who earns about $7 daily. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Sreymom is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to buy more groceries and fertilizer to sell. This purchase will help her generate more profit for the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand the business and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries and fertilizer to sell

loans.name: Si, Si, Si Group

texts.es: “SI, Si, Si” es un nuevo grupo conformada por 06 socios quienes se encuentran muy contentos por iniciar una nueva etapa en sus vidas. Grace tiene 50 años es casada con 02 hijos. Hace 03 años implemento una pequeña bodega en su vivienda y a la vez  es líder de una línea de belleza años a atrás  se dedicaba a la su hogar. Es de esta  manera que ha podido apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de de arroz, azúcar y bebidas. Su mayor deseo es tener un local comercial. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Grace se encuentra sentada en el medio viste chaleco plomo.
texts.en:
“SI, Si, Si” is a new group made up of 6 members who are very happy to be starting a new stage in their lives. Grace is 50 years old and is married with 2 children. Three years ago she opened a small grocery store in her home and at the same time she is running a line of beauty products. In previous years she looked after the home. This is how she has been able to help her husband with the family expenses.

She will use the loan to buy rice, sugar and drinks. Her main wish is to have a shop.

The group thanks the Kiva lenders for the loan.

Grace is sitting in the middle wearing a grey waistcoat.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and drinks.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is married, and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and she earns extra income from rice retailing.  Annabelle is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Annabelle has sustained her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Kakigani Twimukye Newer Group

texts.en:
Jane is a widow, age 35, from Kakigani, a suburb in Mbarara municipality. She dropped out of school and got married when she was young. At the age of 35 and with four children, the husband passed away leaving her with no source of income to support the family. 

She acquired a loan of UGX 800,000 and started up a food stall in the market in order to survive and cater for her children. This business grew and helped her sustain her family. 

Her business progressed with the help of Ugafode micro-finance loans, and this motivated her to mobilize her colleagues in the market to form a development group called Kakigani Twimukye group. This group has made their businesses prosper, and they are requesting loans to help them increase their business working capital to improve their standards of living. 

Jane in particular will use the loan to buy more stocks of food stuff to sell.

loans.use: to buy stocks of food for sell.

loans.name: Korn's Group

texts.en:
Korn is a 29-year-old mother of two children who are in school. 

She earns a living via cassava farming in a one-hectare area, with support from her husband. The business that she has had for 11 years has enabled her to generate almost KHR 17,000 per day to cover the daily cost of living for her family. 

This is the first loan for Korn with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). Korn and her co-borrower are seeking loans of KHR 1,000,000 and KHR 500,000, respectively. 

As the leader, Korn will spend her loan portion to pay for plowing and reaping fees as well as to buy insecticide for her crops. She hopes that she makes  more income, so that she can keep her children in school until tertiary level.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and reaping fees and to buy insecticide.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Джамшед из Зафаробода. Зафаробод место прекрасных долин и гор. В одном из таких долин Джамшед выгуливает своих коров. Ему 31 год, он женат и имеет троих детей. Джамшед в течении 5 лет занимается животноводством. Ухаживать за скотами  и держать в порядке скотный двор ему помогает его младший брат, который не далеко живет. Целью кредита является покупка коров. Чамшед хочет увеличить поголовья коров и быков на своем скотном дворе.
texts.en: Jamshed is from Zafarobod. Zafarobod is a place with beautiful valleys and mountains. In one of these valleys Jamshed pastures his cows. He is 31 years old, married, and has three children. Jamshed has five years of experience in animal husbandry. His younger brother, who lives close by, helps him care for livestock and maintain the barnyard. He is is taking out a loan to buy cows. Jamshed wants to increase the number of cows and bulls in his barnyard.

loans.use: Для приобретения коров для увеличения поголовья скота

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married, with four children, and all are in school. She has no additional family members to take care of.

She sells timber and firewood from home on a retail basis. She has been in business for the past two years. She gets extra income from poultry. She works seven days a week.  

She has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy timber and firewood. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. 

Her aspiration is to build rental houses. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more timber and firewood to sell

loans.name: Firelly Melaine

texts.es:
Firelly vive en la ciudad de Aguaytia al lado de su hijo de 5 años de edad, a quien quiere mucho y por el que lucha cada día. Firelly trabaja como secretaria en una pequeña institución de su ciudad, pero para poder obtener un dinero extra para solventar los gastos de su hogar, tiene un pequeño negocio de venta ropa, con lo cual le ayuda en los gastos.

Firelly está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le están brindando podrá comprar mercadería para su pequeño negocio y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una boutique y poder darle una profesión a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Firelly lives in the city of Aguaytia with her 5-year-old son, whom she loves very much and who is the centre of her life. Firelly works as a secretary in a small organisation in her city, but in order to have some extra money to cover the household costs she has a small business selling clothing, which helps her with her expenses.

Firelly is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help she is getting she will be able to buy merchandise for her small business. In this way she will be able to improve her income and keep striving towards making her biggest dream a reality: to have a boutique and to be able to give her son a profession.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy software.

loans.name: Yav's Group

texts.en:
Yav is 45 years old and blessed with four children living in Battambang province, where rice farming is the popular agribusiness to generate income in the area, and it is the core business for Yav’s family as well. 

She has been involved in the current business for 10 years, earning about 32,000 KHR per day. Yav is joining a group of three to get a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner); she is a third-time borrower and the group leader. 

Her past loans have enabled her to upgrade her living better than before, and she has repaid her loans with success. For this cycle, she and one of her co-borrower are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each, while a remaining borrower is applying for 600,000 KHR. 

As a leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop. She hopes this purchase will gain her a good yield better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crop.

loans.name: Trea's Group

texts.en:
Trea is a mother of four schoolchildren, and is in her late 20s. She is a local farmer who does rice cropping and cassava farming, with which she has been  involved for several years. It has returned her about 12,500 KHR per day. 

This is the first micro-loan for Trea's group, consisting of three borrowers, with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking 700,000 KHR, while remaining two borrowers are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. 

As a leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy cassava, plow her farmland, buy insecticide, and pay for reaping fee. She hopes that she can gain a good yield from her crop and make more income to relieve her family's burden.

loans.use: to buy cassava, plow her farmland, buy insecticide, and pay reaping fee.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina makes a living from her retail business selling beauty products in her community. Her husband is a driver. 

Gina sells lotion, shampoo, soap, and assorted liniments, and she collects the payments in cash or on an amortized basis. She joined GDMPC to gain access to micro-finance services. 

Shis borrowing PHP 4,000 to buy more beauty products and liniments to sell. She wants to improve the living situation of her family and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products and liniments to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all are in school. She has no additional family members. She sells snacks like chapatti, roasted groundnuts, pancakes and biscuits at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last two years. She works seven days a week. 

Josephine has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 300,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy baking flour, cooking oil, spices, and sweet bananas for making pancakes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a fridge so as to sell cold drinks. She lives in her own house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, baking flour, spices, and sweet bananas

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
Dante is a hard-working spouse and responsible father to his four children. According to him, income gained from vending of vegetables and from his variety store goes toward their daily necessities and allowance and school fees for his youngest child. With his determination to get ahead of life and obtain a viable source of income, Dante decided to request additional capital of PHP 10,000 from lenders so he could attain his goals in life.

Dante will use the loan amount in buying grocery items such as cases of soft drinks, assorted biscuits and raw meat. He knows that his own success relies on his wise management of the capital he has and his hard work. Dante hopes that lenders will grant his requested loan amount so he can educate his youngest child and become a better entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as cases of soft drinks, assorted biscuits and raw meat for his variety store

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 54 years old and married.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Cristita has been in this business for ten years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Cristita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lay's Group

texts.en:
Lay is 33 years old and comes from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She has three dependent kids to take care as they are still in school. For their sake, she and her husband do cassava farming on three hectares; it is the business that she has had for more than 10 years. 

Lay and her co-borrower in this group of two are new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and they are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. Lay will spend her loan portion to pay for plowing fees, reaping fees, and to buy insecticide for her cash-crop. She hopes to gain a good yield from her business so that she can better her living conditions progressively.

loans.use: To pay for labor for plowing and reaping and buy insecticide for her cash-crop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for his soldering workshop.

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en:
Arsen is from Gyumri town. He lives with his wife, mother and three grown-up sons. For sustaining his family, Arsen has been providing taxi service to locals for many years. In order to help her son, Arsen's mother sells clothing in neighbouring villages and earns income which helps Arsen to cover some of the family's costs. 

Unfortunately now the car that Arsen drives as a taxi needs to be renovated and Arsen has no financial means for doing that. He is asking for this loan to purchase four tires and renovate the engine. This will greatly help Arsen to continue his taxi driving business and sustain his family

Arsen has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So, the support of lenders is very important for Arsen and his family and will greatly assist them.

loans.use: to pay for four tires and renovate the engine

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 31 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school, Catherine works very hard to provide for them.

Catherine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like biscuits, sugar, coffee, etc. to sell .

Catherine has been in this business for three years. In the future Catherine would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like biscuits, sugar, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy items like sugar, sodas, soap, beer, etc.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is 52 years old and single with one child. She owns and operates a food flea market, selling items such as cucumbers, coconuts, cabbages etc. She has been doing this for 37 years. Rosa needs a loan to buy pumpkins, coconuts, cucumbers, tomatoes, Samoan coconuts, watercress, cabbages and carrots. She hopes to use her profits to support her family. She became a member of SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy pumpkins, coconuts, cucumbers, tomatoes, Samoan coconuts, watercress, cabbages and carrots

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children and four are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last two years. She works seven days a week.  

Gorret has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 300,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. She lives in rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
Ya is 41 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been breeding pigs for more than three years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband (joining her in the picture) is a drama actor who makes an income of $7 daily. One of her children sells groceries and earns about $8 each day. 

To improve her family’s finance, Ya is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase pigs and fodder for breeding. By doing so, she would be able to make more income to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her son earn a Bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and fodder for breeding

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Managing a food selling business in a school during weekdays is the business of Marcelina, who is 49 years old, married to a farmer named Pedro Jr. She has four children and only her youngest remain studying in college. Her family lives harmoniously in the Nueva Vizcaya Province. 

The average net sales that she earns weekly from selling various food snacks and even meals in school is PHP1,500. This is very helpful in sustaining her youngest child's school allowances and also for the inputs needed  for her husband's farming. After more than one year doing the business, Marcelina came to know about this loan program through her sister-in-law. Because she wanted to further expand her business through additional capital, she is requesting a loan to buy sugar, glutinous rice, seasonings and more items  needed in the expansion of her food selling business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, glutinous rice, seasonings and more items needed in the expansion of her food selling business.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun is 58 years old and a villager from Kandal province.  She is the widowed mother of six children, who are still in school, 

She has two and a half hectares of rice cropping as the main source of her family's income for daily basic needs and her children’s education costs. She has been involved in her current business for ages, and it has returned her almost US$ 5 per day. 

This is not the first loan for Sun with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her previous loan, which she has fully repaid back, enabled her to provide three decent meals a day for her children and keep them in school. 

Now one of her children wants to pursue a bachelor degree specializing in information technology. Therefore the education cost is quite a big challenge for Sun. To tackle this problem, she has applied for an education loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) in order to cover her son’s tuition fee. 

She hopes that this loan will fulfill her son’s dream of getting an academic education and a good job after graduation to help the family.

loans.use: To cover her son’s tuition fee

loans.name: Sina's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Kampong Cham province, Sina is 32 years old and blessed with three children, who are still in school. 

The family’s main sources of income are from rice cropping and her husband’s occupation as an assistant to a house builder. Sina has been involved in their rice farming business for ages, and it has returned to her about KHR 33,000 per day. 

This is the second loan for Sina with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She repaid her first loan wisely, and it helped to improve her living at a good pace. 

Now Sina leads a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay plowing fees and labor costs and to buy fertilizer to boost her crop yield. She hopes to gain a good yield and make more income from her agribusiness.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay plowing fees and labor costs

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Michelle Ann

texts.en:
Michelle Ann is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Michelle Ann has been in this business for nine years.  She also earns extra income from pig fattening.

Michelle Ann has sustained her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is 54 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, eggs, biscuits, sugar, coffee, etc. to sell.

Charito  has been in this business for 25 years.

In the future Charito would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, eggs, biscuits, sugar, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Leilani

texts.en: Leilani is 30 years old and married with six children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. Leilani has requested a loan to buy a bag of flour, sugar, oil, a frying pan,and baking soda. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings,Leilani will extend her business.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, sugar, oil, a frying pan and baking soda

loans.name: Jeralyn

texts.en:
Jeralyn works hard to support her family. Jeralyn is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Jeralyn requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soap, shampoo, canned goods, etc, to sell.

Jeralyn has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Jeralyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soap, shampoo, canned goods, etc, to sell

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: A villager from Kandal province, Seng is a father of three children who are still in school. He struggles for a living, working as a policeman and growing rice. It is the business that he has had for several years.  This is the first microloan for Seng with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He is seeking an education loan to pay his son’s tuition fee. His son wants to pursue the associate degree majoring in medicine.  He hopes that he can support his son’s education cost on time so that his son can pay more attention to his studies and get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay his son’s tuition fee

loans.name: Deodelyn

texts.en:
Deodelyn is 43 years old and married, with six children, who are in school.  Deodelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Deodelyn runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like rice, sugar, soap, noodles, milk, sugar, etc., to sell.

Deodelyn has been in this business for nine years.

In the future Deodelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy additional stocks like rice, sugar, soap, noodles, milk, sugar, etc., to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee processing machinery.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married, with two children, both in school. She has no additional family members to care for. 

She sells fruits and vegetables at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the past two years. She works seven days a week.  

She has requested a loan of UGX 200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of Irish potatoes, boxes of tomatoes, onions, watermelons, pineapples, and passion fruits. Her major business challenges are electricity and transportation. 

Her aspiration is to get more space in her stall so as to serve more customers. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy Irish potatoes, watermelon, pineapple, passion fruit, greens, tomatoes, and green peppers to sell

loans.name: Jilmar

texts.es:
Jilmar, tiene 18 años, nació en Pasorapa, pueblo que se encuentra a ocho horas de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Tiene doce hermanos, él es el último hijo. Sus papás no fueron a la escuela y sólo los últimos cuatro hijos pudieron ir a la ciudad para acceder a educación. Su padre falleció hace 5 años y su madre es ama de casa.
Jilmar, ahora vive con dos de sus hermanos y un sobrino. Hace tres meses comenzó a estudiar gastronomía en las tardes y en las mañanas trabaja como ayudante de cocina.

Él solicita un préstamo educativo, para poder financiar sus estudios de gastronomía, debido a que el ingreso que percibe es mínimo y además debe apoyar en la economía de su hogar. 

Su sueño ser Chef de su propio restaurante de comida boliviana.
texts.en:
Jilmar is 18 years old and was born in Pasorapa, a town eight hours from the city of Cochabamba. He has 12 siblings and is the youngest son. His parents didn't go to school and only the four youngest sons were able to go to the city to access education. His father passed away five years ago and his mother is a housewife. 

Jilmar now lives with two of his siblings and a nephew. Three months ago he started to study cooking in the afternoons and in the mornings works as a kitchen helper. 

He is requesting an education loan so that he can finance his chef training course. This is due to the fact that the income he earns is minimal, and in addition he must help with the household finances. His dream is to be the chef of his own restaurant specializing in Bolivian food.

loans.use: To pay for tuition and materials for his chef training course.

loans.name: Kea

texts.en: Kea is a villager from the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. She is married and has one schoolchild to cater for. To manage the daily cost of living in her household, she does cassava farming on one and a half acre as her current income-generating activity. This business has returned her about 32,000 KHR per day. Kea is a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan with success to improve her living condition better than before. Now, she is seeking of a loan of 3,000,000 KHR in order to buy cassava seedlings and to pay for plowing fees for her agribusiness. She hopes to replant her cassava on time and gain a good yield.

loans.use: To buy cassava seedlings and to pay for plowing fees

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Salafune

texts.en:
Salafune is 34 years old and married, with five children. She runs a small business selling iced cakes in her community. To earn extra income she also has a small farm. 

Salafune has requested this loan to buy cordials, sugar, foam cups, large spoons, and Chinese candy, as well as barbed wire, a backpack sprayer and a pickaxe. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Salafune will help pay for her children's education.

loans.use:
to buy cordials, sugar, foam cups, large spoons, and  
Chinese candy, as well as barbed wire, a backpack sprayer, and a pickaxe

loans.name: Rocio Del Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROCIO DEL AMANECER”  iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María Luisa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de abarrotes, venta de minerales, reciclaje de minerales, artesano, venta de leche, venta de celulares.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María Luisa es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de compra y venta de minerales; este negocio lo emprendió de su esposo, ya que antes que se case el trabajaba comercializando este producto, posteriormente ampliaron su negocio con un pequeño capital que tenía.

 El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de minerales) que adquirirá de las ferias aledañas a la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el servicios en salud.
texts.en:
The "Rocio Del Amanecer" communal bank is in its fifth cycle with Pro Mujer which is part of the focal point of Villa Exaltación.  The group is made up of 8 member and is headed by a board of directors of which María Luisa is the president.  The businesses run by the members are varied, and they include: a grocery store, mineral sales, mineral recycling, artisans, milk sales, cellular phone sales.  

The requested loan will benefit small businesses that María Luisa is a member of.  She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago following the invitation of a friend who is also a member of the institution.  María Luisa has a business where she buys and sells minerals.  She took on the business from her husband who prior to their marriage worked selling minerals.  Later, they were able to expand the business with a small amount of capital that they had.

The loan she is currently seeking is to increase her inventory by purchasing minerals from the surrounding fairs in the city of El Alto.  She will later sell the minerals in her store.

The work allows her to generate a sufficient income to maintain her home since she is married and has three children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the medical services.

loans.use: to purchase minerals.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is married with an only child and resides in El Paraiso of Sapang Dalaga. She has run a general store in their community for ten years to earn a living. She joined GDMPC recently and borrowed a loan for 10,000 PHP to purchase grocery items for sale, and add to her working inventory capital. Her determination to be successful is her strength to help her business improve.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items for sale.

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
María Consuelo tiene 29 años de edad, con 4 años de educación primaria cursados, comerciante y agricultora, madre de 1 hijo el cual es menor de edad. En compañía de su conyugue se dedican a la siembra y cultivo de café el cual es posteriormente vendido en el mercado local siendo una fuente de ingresos más para su familia y hogar. Ella aprendió las diferentes tareas para el cultivo de café hace 4 años siendo su esposo quien le enseñara a trabajar la tierra. Ella también se dedica al comercio mientras no está en el campo, como otra fuente de ingresos más para su familia por medio de la venta de golosinas en una caseta en la escuela de la localidad siendo sus clientes los niños de la escuela y maestros de la institución. Sus cultivos de café están ubicados a 100 metros de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a pie para dar mantenimiento y asistencia a sus cultivos de café.    

Sus sueños son los de poder ver a su hijo convertido en profesional mediante el estudio de una carrera universitaria la cual de frutos a su vida y a su familia, como también los de poder comprar más tierra para poder extender sus cultivos de café y fortalecer el patrimonio familiar. Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado un financiamiento para poder invertir en sus cultivos de café mediante de compra de insumos como abono, fertilizantes, foliares y formula cafetalera.
texts.en:
María Consuelo, age 29, has four years of primary school education.  She is a merchant and a farmer, and she has one minor child.  She and her husband plant and grow coffee.  The coffee is later sold at the local market, and this is one more source of income for her family and her household.

She learned the different jobs about growing coffee four years ago.  Her husband is the one who taught her how to work the land.  She is also a merchant when she is not in the field.  As another source of income for her family, she sells candy at a stall in the local school.  Her customers are the children at  the school and the teachers at the institution.

Her coffee crops are located 100 meters from her house.  She travels by foot in order to provide maintenance and care to her coffee crops.

Her dream is to be able to see her son become a professional by studying for a university degree.  This will provide benefits to her life and her family.  She also dreams of being able to buy more land in order to be able to extend her coffee crops and strengthen the family heritage.

She is now requesting a loan in order to be able to invest in her coffee crops.  She will buy supplies like organic and chemical fertilizers, leaf pesticides, and coffee-growing formula.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to provide maintenance to her coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cover her daughter’s education cost

loans.name: Tynar

texts.ru: Тынар 71 год, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает сына, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Тынар - высшее образование, на протяжении долгих лет, она проработала в местной школе преподавателем. Вырастила не одно поколение учеников, которые на сегодняшний день очень тепло и хорошо отзываются о ней. Тынар  в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 40 лет назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Тынар, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 2 теленка, 30 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Тынар обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Тынар планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Tynar is 71 years old and a widow. After her husband’s death, she raised her son on her own. She also manages her own business. Tynar has a college degree; for many years, she worked as a teacher at a local school. She has educated several generations of students; many still remember her and talk warmly of her. As a main source of income for her family, Tynar raises livestock, having launched 40 years ago by buying cattle for 3,000 KGS. Thanks to Tynar’s hard work, her farm today includes four dairy cows, two calves, and 30 sheep. Her monthly income is 10,000 KGS. In order to develop her business further, Tynar has turned to the “Bai Tushum & Partners microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 60,000 KGS to buy cows to increase her cattle headcount. Tynar plans to use the resulting income for a further increase of her livestock.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Vary

texts.en: Vary is 50 years old and a resident from the Battambang province. She has five children, two of whom are still dependents as they are in school. To support herseld, she farms rice, corn, and sesame. She has had this business for several years. This is the first microloan for Vary with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking 4,000,000 KHR in order to buy seed and insecticide, and to pay for labor costs for her cash-crop. She hopes to earn a good income from her business and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy seed and insecticide, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Sreyda

texts.en: A local farmer from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sreyda is 24 years old and married. She grows rice on six hectares as her core income-generating activity that supports her entire household. She has been involved in this business for several years. Sreyda is not new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) as she has been with VisionFund for one cycle already. She has managed to repay her past loan to improve her living conditios. Now, she is seeking a new loan of 4,000,000 KHR in order to buy an additional plot of farmland to expand her rice farming. She hopes this expansion will enable her to grow more rice and get a good yield in return.

loans.use: To buy an additional plot of farmland.

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es: Guadalupe del Carmen de 45 años de edad, vive junto a su familia su esposo y sus 4 hijos mayores de edad que junto a su esposo  le ayudan en el aporte económico a su hogar. Es una mujer comprometida y trabajadora; Actualmente trabaja en un comedor de una playa conocida de nuestro país, su compañero de vida es albañil y juntos tienen una necesidad de poder reparar una pared de su hogar ya que se encuentra muy agrietada es por esa razón que solicita a FUSAI un préstamo para la compra de cemento, arena, la mano de obra la pondrá su esposo. Espera pueda lo antes posible realizar dicha reparación para evitar mayores daños.
texts.en: Guadalupe del Carmen is 45 years old and lives with her husband and their 4 adult children, who in conjunction with her husband help her support the household financially.  She is a committed and hard working woman.  Currently, she works in a restaurant at a well known beach in her country.  Her husband is a bricklayer and they are in need of repairing a wall in their home since it is very cracked.  For this reason, they are seeking a loan from FUSAI to purchase cement and sand, her husband will provide the labor.  She hopes to be able to make the repair as soon as possible in order to avoid heavier damage.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand to repair cracks in a wall.

loans.name: Sunny

texts.en:
Sunny is requesting a loan to buy various vegetable seeds like cabbage, eggplant and squash for her husband to plant and harvest. She will also use the loan to buy rice and other seasonings needed for preparing food snacks to sell to her fellow vendors. She has been in this business for 15 years and is earning an average of PHP 3,000 monthly. Sunny says that if she is not able to sell, life is dead. 

Sunny married at an early age, after her junior year in high school. Her husband, Leonardo, works as a farmer and gardener. She has three children who are all students. They live in the village of Nagbitin, a peaceful place for them. Sunny is 42 years old.

loans.use: to buy various vegetable seeds like cabbage, eggplant and squash, and to buy ingredients for prepared food to sell.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Ofelia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice. Ofelia is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell in her buy-and-sell rice business.

Ofelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Sambo's Group

texts.en: A villager from Ponhea Leu district of Kandal province, Sambo is 43 years old and a married mother of eight children. Her entire family solely relies on rice farming which she has been doing for several years with 19,000 KHR per day as daily income. Sambo is now leading her first microloan group consisting of eight borrowers taking their first loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  For Sambo, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes this latrine will improve sanitation practices in her family.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine for her family

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Lorna has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets.

She has been in this business for 28 years.

In the future, Lorna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en: A mother of four children originally from Battambang province, Chhem is a rice grower and vendor. She has engaged in her current business for six years. This is the first loan for Chhem with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is taking out a loan of 650,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer, insecticide and rice seed, and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that this purchase will help her to replant her cash crop soon and earn her a good income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, and rice seed, and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Ulaelemamae

texts.en: Ulalemamae is 19 years old and lives with her partner and one child. She runs a small business selling barbeque in her community; she has been doing this for two years. Ulalemamae has requested a loan to buy garlic, soya sauce, pots, tongs, a bbq set, abox of chicken, sausages, tomato sauce, foil and mutton flaps. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Ulalemamae will hope to expand her business within nearby villages.

loans.use: to buy garlic, onions, soya sauce, pots, tongs, a bbq set, abox of chicken, sausages, tomato sauce, foil and mutton flaps.

loans.name: Taufau

texts.en:
Taufau is a 57 year old married woman with 7 children. 
She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, etc to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Taufau has requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals and a water tank for a water reservoir. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Taufau hopes to improve her family's home condition.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals and a water tank for a water reservoir

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Né vers 1975 à Bamako capitale du Mali Mariam est mariée et mère de deux enfants, résidant avec son mari à Kolondièba au quartier Koko, dans une famille traditionnelle.
 Mme Mariam s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à la vente du dégué et des petits articles.  Elle est très sollicitée au marché et surtout pendant le jour de foire.
Fort de ses années d’expériences dans le domaine, elle collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  deuxième prêt, après avoir remboursé le prêt précédent. 
Mariam  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des céréales, du sucre et du lait. Elle s’approvisionne chez les grossistes au marché. Elle effectue ses ventes en détail au comptant en famille et au marché le jour de foire à une clientèle  composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Mariam  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born around 1975 in Bamako, the capital of Mal, Mariam is married and the mother of two children, and lives with her husband Kolondièba in the Koko neighborhood, in a traditional family. Mrs Mariam was quickly interested in commercial activity, in particular related to the sale of dégué [a local Malian drink made from millet, a common african cereal] and small articles. She is very often solicited at the market, notably during the main market days. Building on her experiences in this domain, she is collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso to enlarge her business in order to better satisfy her growing customer base, by asking for her second loan, after having correctly reimbursed the first one.

Mariam plans to use this loan to purchase cereals, sugar and milk. She stocks up at the wholesalers in the market. She sells her merchandise individually for cash to families as well as during market day, to a customer base composed of both men and women. Mariam hope to earn monthly profit of 60 000 FCFA, which she will use to cover the needs of her family, reimburse her loan, and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: purchase cereals, milk and sugar

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед живет и работает в северной части Таджикистана в городе Худжанд. Ему 33 года. Хуршед женат на Шоире и имеет двух сыновей. Шоира занимается торговлей одежды на рынке. Хуршед работает сантехником. Скоро дети Хуршеда и Шоиры пойдут в школу. В наше время собрать ребенка в школу нелегко. Хуршед собирается открыть свой интернет кафе и просит кредит, чтобы приобрести 8 штук настольных компьютеров. Он уже арендовал помещение, расположенное в людном месте. Данный кредит позволит ему открыть собственный бизнес и иметь постоянный источник дохода. Он будет благодарен за поддержку.
texts.en: Khurshed lives and works in the northern city of Khujand, Tajikistan. He is 33 years old. Khurshed is married to Shoira and they have two sons. Shoira works selling clothing at the market. Khurshed works as a plumber. Soon, Khurshed and Shoira's children will start school. In our day, it is not easy to put a child through school.  Khurshed is going to open an internet cafe and is asking for a loan to buy eight desktop computers. He has rented a building in a busy location. This loan will allow him to open his own business and have a regular source of income. He is grateful for your support.

loans.use: buy eight computers to open an internet cafe.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.en:
Maria Victoria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials need for fishing for her fishing/fish vending business.

Maria Victoria has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from food vending.

Maria Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business and afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for fishing.

loans.name: Sithol

texts.en: Sithol is a young man residing in Kandal province. He has been a policeman for one year. Sithol wants to pursue his bachelor degree majoring in Law to support him in his career. Therefore, he has applied for an education loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) as a first-time borrower. He will spend his entire loan to support his education as he does not want to burden his parent. He hopes that he can get a better job with a high salary after graduation to support himself as well as his family.

loans.use: To support the cost of his education.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 57 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase an addition stock of groceries to sell.

Teresa has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from selling charcoal.

Teresa aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase an addition stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nelgen

texts.en:
Nelgen is married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nelgen is 34 years old and has two children who are in school.

Nelgen has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Nelgen has been in this business for one year. In the future, Nelgen would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Guillermo Arturo

texts.en:
Guillermo, a Tlaxcalan hog farmer, believes in the importance of small, family-owned local farms - a group in danger of extinction. Guillermo faces two major hurdles - his production costs and complaints from his neighbors, as his farm is in a recently urbanized area.

His 10-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester will treat the large piles of pig manure he has on-site (pictured) to produce odor-free, potent biofertilizer and renewable, methane-rich biogas. The resulting displacement of fossil-fuel based agrochemical fertilizers and liquefied petroleum gas will save him money, and the elimination of piles of animal waste will dramatically reduce the flies and odors associated with hog farming. Concurrently, Guillermo will reduce his farm's environmental impact. 

This loan represents 51% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a 10-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 62 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living as a fish pond operator in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her fish.

Teresita has been a fish pond operator for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her fish

loans.name: Nerio

texts.en:
Nerio is a long way from home. Originally from Colombia, he resides in Houston, Texas, working as a bookkeeper and tax preparer. His business, Easybooks, has assisted Houston residents during tax season for more than eight years. He specializes in assisting Spanish-speaking citizens and immigrants in the area.  

When Nerio needed extra money to purchase computer equipment and programs, a friend informed him about Accion Texas Inc., the nation’s largest microlender. After applying and receiving a business loan from Accion, Nerio proceeded to purchase additional equipment so that he can expand and process a higher volume of tax returns. Nerio purchased computer software to make his job easier and more efficient.  

All these improvements allowed Nerio to grow his business, retain his one full-time and two part-time employees, and make plans to hire an additional part-time worker soon. “Without the Accion loan I would not have been able to purchase what I needed to grow my business”, says Nerio.

loans.use: to purchase computer software to make his job easier and more efficient.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 70 years old and married and works hard to support her husband.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Zenaida is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like coffee, soft drinks, canned goods, etc, to sell for her general store business.

Zenaida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like coffee, soft drinks, canned goods, etc, to sell

loans.name: Jahaziel Nieves

texts.en:
Jahaziel dreams of working in environmental engineering but without a degree knows it may never be possible. Jahaziel was accepted into the Universidad Tecnológica Boliviana and now, with the chance to achieve her dream, is concerned about affording tuition fees. She expects to graduate in December, 2015 but without a loan is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. Her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return.

Jahaziel shares that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. Jahaziel plans on using the loan to cover the cost of her tuition. To help pay for her education Jahaziel currently works 25 hours a week as a waitress. One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and focus on her studies.
